(Perfect temp.) Pours almost clear golden with large white head of minute bubbles. Excellent retention and some lacing. Fresh aroma of acidy fruit, apples, pears and also of acidy? bread. Full, warm taste dominated by malt, alcohol and licorice with hints of clove and Belgian yeast. Aftertaste is serious and warming as the bitterness of the hops kicks in. Very long lasting and very complex. Medium to slightly heavy body with a well balanced carbonation adds up to a great tripel - to me the winter sister of the magnificent Karmeliet.

Nose is spiced bananas and floral hops.
Pours clear golden with a long one finger head.
Quite poppy on the tongue.
Taste is floral & spice and sweet & bitter with a long lasting finish. Quite deep and complex.

Bottle. Mainly bananas in the aroma, with some apricots as well. Very pleasant, almost like a weizen. Pale with some tiny bits and white head, which quickly disappears. Taste is quite similaer to the aroma- again bananas and apricots, then an alcohol. Medium- full bodied, high CO2, All in all, not bad.

Goudgeel, licht wazig, witte schuimkraag, veel koolzuur. 
Aroma: Citrus, hoppige florale hinten, lekker fruitige geuren van ananas en Sinaasappelschil en mango.
Smaak: Mooi zuurtje, citrus en fruitig als  groene appel. Een kruidige/peperige  prikkeling in combinatie met een florale hopbitter.  Dit geeft in combinatie met het koolzuur een flinke prikkeling op de zijkant van de tong.
Iets prikkelige schil en een herkenbare Belgische gist smaak. Zeker niet zoet...... eerder bloemig, fruitig, kruidig en een prettige bitter. Tikje alcohol warmte zeker niet op de voorgrond. 
Medium body, aktief en prikkelig mondgevoel, afdronk is fruitig en licht bitter....iets droog.
Wat een prachtige goed gehopte tripel!

Es de color amarillo dorado con una esponjosa corona de espuma blanca dispuesta para el encaje.

Maravillosa al servirla en la copa y cuando empieza a desplegar todo su aroma: fruta madura y flores.

En boca es cremosa y delicada. Muy afrutada, plátano y naranja amarga. La carbonatación es maravillosa y puedes apreciar fácilmente el rosario de burbujas semejantes a una copa de cava o champán. Su final es agradablemente amargo, algo seco y muy duradero.

Lo mejor es que la Westmalle Tripel va mejorando en botella durante varios meses, alcanzando al año de estar embotellada su momento álgido.

Solo me faltaría por comentaros que tiene 9,5% de volumen de alcohol y que en absoluto se nota cuando la estás bebiendo. Así que ojo que luego se pone uno a levantarse de la silla y vienen los sustos!!

Deep cloudy golden color with storming glass clinging activity. Extra foamy white 3 finger island head, lasting around 20 minutes, with decent legs. Flavors of red licorice, coriander, sweet grains, lemon, apples, pears, clove, Belgian yeast, leafy spices. Super malty and sugary with a harsh dose of spices. Smooth slick medium body with almost champagne like carbonation. Strong finish, boldly spiced, lingering fresh malts, floral yeast and hops, with a soft barrel aged feel. Very rich, filling, and warming. Slightly boozy and acidic but with good freshness. Delicious flavors but slightly too spicy. And you get the happy kind of buzz as usual from quality tripels. Overall excellent quality craft.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Bastante buena. Muy al estilo belga. El sabor corto es sabroso y el sabor largo un tanto amanzanado. En general muy bien.
Nawet nawet. Aromat średni, wygląd spoko, w smaku pijalne. Nie zachwyciło mnie jakoś szczególnie.

Beer #2 in the "How the Hell have I not rated this??" series. Bottle drunk some time 2005-2008, cant remember exactly.Large, foamy white head tops a light blonde body, good clarity and sediment left behind. Very strong retention.Brett! and lots of it, in the nose. Light perfume, light band aid and lots of fruity esters to match; nectarine, pear, apple. Delicate honey, seemingly nicely attenuated lies behind it. Its joined by black pepper and just a hint of marmalade. Wow, this is one of the better "Trippels" Ive had, though its not really a trippel. No big breadiness, absolutely no clove. Not even all that yeasty, in comparison to most other trappist beers. No alcohol or flaw.Fruity, dry and with enough residual base malt to provide a soft, but not too soft, texture. Some light graininess and lots of ester character, with moderate bitterness, lots of black pepper phenol and easygoing, lightly funky brett notes (light lime, hickory, band aid). Tight, natural carbonation is very high, and needs time to breath. A bit of sharpness and alcohol on the end, mixed in with the big ester character, but its not really problematic. Nice honeyish malt, grain and light brett lingering.Looks like this one has gone downhill in recent years...so I probably just let my memories rest on this older bottle.
Yellow colour with a small head with a mild fruity aroma. Slightly sweet taste with fruity and spicy hints. Full bodied, smooth and a classic trappist beer.

Aroma Honey and cherry , dark blonde appearance with little foam, not strong initially to palate but full of flavours when expanding in the mouth, bitter but keeping the honey nuance in the sides if the tongue, that remains in the last palate even concealing the alcohol point
泡沫散發溫潤

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2016 Très bonne bière triple trappiste, forte, chaleureuse, étiquette sobre à la graphie soignée, bon goût sur le palais et en fin de boiche, un classique. Pas de fioritures (ni "fruitée" ni goût particulièrement caramélisé). Je la trouve plus facile à boire que la Chimay blanche (triple) à l?amertume plus prononcée. Pas encore trop chère en région parisienne et facilement trouvable.
Очень вкусный Бельгий& трипль, красивы& цвет, хороший аромат и вкус, приятно& послевк& хорошая плотнос& качеств& пиво! Дата розлива 28.02.2016. (Bottle 0,33/ 9,5%)

UPDATED: APR 2, 2017 Bottle, aged version, bb 11.2016. Pours hazy yellow/orange with small white head. Fruity aroma of peach, mango combined with spices and flowers. Taste is medium sweet, has estery, fruity character, with very light acidic notes, light bitterness in finish and lots of spices. Full body, nice light alcohol bite, very smooth. Very good trappist classic, rich fruity aroma and taste, maybe just a little too much spice notes for me.

Ljusgul, disig med stort vitt skum. I doften finns torkad frukt, lite skumbanan och friskt äpple, lite jäst och viss örtighet. Smaken är eldig, fyllig, kraftig med fruktighet och tydligt äppelinslag, en fin kryddighet, lite citrus och med bra beska som ger en fin och långvarig eftersmaken, mycket välbalanserad.
De Klomp 29/11 -16

Light yellow, little bit hazy with nice long lasting white head. Yeasty and fruity (citrus) aromas, rather low. Low body, medium carbonated, dry but with light oily mouth feel . In taste also yeasty with slightly acidic / bitter finish and alcohol warming

Bottle @ home. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of belgian yeast, spices, fruity stonefruit alike, light almonds, a whiff some bubblegum. Taste is quite yeasty, caramel, quite fruity with loads of spice, very good balance. Solid!
Bottle bought in Belgium, A classic, but not as good as it´s reputation. Probably many ratings are old. Strong, powerful. Limited hops.
0,33l bottle from Beergium. Yellow colour with quite strong head. Aroma of citrus, yeast, spices, herbal, sweetness. Mediumish body, pretty strong citrusy taste.

Butelka. Piana obfita, średnio i drobnopęcherzykowa, opada powoli i pozostaje na całej powierzchni piwa, ładnie koronkuje. Barwa jasnozłota, opalizujące. W aromacie brzoskwinia, pomarańcza kandyzowana, kwiaty. Goryczka niska. W smaku delikatny alkohol, przyprawy i brzoskwiniowy finisz. Pełnia niska, nasycenie wysokie.

The Mother of all tripels and still the best overall tripel around. Nice citrusy, fruity and hop balance (aroma and taste) together with a 9,5% volume which gives the beer a nice kick and punch. Great bitter aftertaste. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Immediately positive response. The group was not fully United, some are very sensitive towards citrus

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2016 Color entre amarillo y naranja (parece una limonada con naranja o una naranjada con limón), medianamente turbio, con capa de espuma blanca, de textura jabonosa (muy buena retención). Carbonatación a tope. El aspecto es una pasada. El aroma es complejo: frutal (creo haber captado plátano, pero no hagáis mucho caso), un toque de alcohol, reminiscencias amargas y ácidas (lás últimas no están en el sabor, así que puedo haberme confundido). El sabor es amargo, frutal, con regusto alcohólico placentero y carbonatación perfecta. Una Tripel de nivel.

Bottle. Color: Clear golden, dense white head. Taste: Good balance between malt, hops and yeast. Hints of flowers, grass and yellow fruits. Pretty much carbonation. Yeasty and fruity bitter finish. Very nice beer.

A chaque ouverture sinstaure un véritable rituel. On ne déguste pas une Westmalle Triple comme une quelconque bière. Dès son service, la solanité sinstalle. Cest avec un profond respect pour le travail des moines trappistes et une attente tout juste contenue que lon déverse alors le nectar dans son calice. La bière est magnifique, dun blond dorée, tout juste troublée par un léger voile, elle est pourvue dune mousse blanche blanche, d1 cm dépaisseur. Leffervescnce, bien dosée, complète sa majestuosité.
Le nez pose dès lors les bases de la bière : Force, équilibre, complexité. Les flaveurs de céréales, de coriandre, caramel avec une pointe citronnée sentremellent à merveille, et lalcool présent avec des notes de girofles, lui confère une belle intensité. La dégustation tant attendue peut commencer. Lattaque est souple et soyeuse, avec des arômes de céréales, caramel et doranges confites. A partir de ce moment, la symphonie peut débuter. Lamertume telle des cuivres puissants, donne la base de la mélodie. Celle ci est majestueuse, ample et profonde. Les arômes doranges, de girofles et de fruits confits prédominent. Mais les cordes et les vents sentremellent pour donner des variations et des contre mélodies de toute splendeur et sans fin. Des notes épicées, herbacées, de caramel,candi ou de vanille se succèdent et sallient dans une parfaite hamonie. La corpulence est exceptionnelle et le final, très long, laisse sexprimer complètement le houblon. La maîtrise de lart brassicole des moines de labbaye de Wesmalle est sans faute. La communion est totale, et un mot simpose de lui-même : GRAAL. 5 lettres qui ne peuvent que valoir un 5.

Pours a lovely bright gold with a huge white head. Can see light through it, but still thick enough that the sediment and bubbles are almost invisible. Floral and fruity notes hit you as soon as you pour. More carbonation than I wouldve expected, but its the perfect amount. Tastes like the smell, with an added slight spice, and just the right amount of bitterness. Long lasting flavor. Been a while since I first had this, and its better than I remembered. Excellent!

Floral and grassy aroma, clear straw yellow copper color with sediment and bubbles. Bubbly on tongue then lingers with clove kick. Apricot and spice flavor with malty finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Its been a while that Ive tasted Westmalle Tripel. And its been too long! Light gold. Strong and powerful. Banana, yeast, fruity notes. Pronounced bitterness. Pretty dry. Nice fine foam.

Dentrée le choc ! Cette bière est magnifique, une mousse superbe, bien blanche avec de fines bulles et la robe est dorée comme une prune bien mure ! En bouche elle est soyeuse et fruitée, très douce et légèrement sucrée, lamertume apparaît en fin de bouche mais est très agréable et donne une belle longueur en bouche sans être trop astringente. La carbonation est parfaite, toute en subtilité. Bref cette bière mérite amplement sa réputation.
Huge fine white head. Secnt of pale malt, light alcoholic. Some hints of hops. Heavy thick body with the taste of pale dried fruits. Sweet fruity warming Trappist.

Nice fruity aroma with yeast notes present, body is a very hazy deep yellow with orange tinge, a mid sized white cap leaves thick laceing. Alcohol is well hidden in the taste, flavors of fruit, spices, and yeasty malts. Overall a pretty good tripel glad i finally tried it. Originally rated on 10/9/2008.

Dégustée dans un verre Maredsous.
Robe dorée/orangée avec une mousse généreuse peu persistante.
Le nez est dune grande richesse ; houblons, levure, épices et fruits.
Le goût est à lavenant dans un parfait équilibre entre douceur et amertume avec de délicates touches de banane et dagrumes.
Larrière bouche est longue et dune élégance rare.
Une référence!

Excellente bière,bien équilibrée et très raffinée dans le goût.
Belle robe dorée.
Un mélange dodeurs fruitées et épicées difficiles à définir.
Une douceur et un velouté très agréable en bouche!
Une amertume et un léger soupçon de sucre avec alcool en arrière bouche.
Un délice!!!!!
CLoudy pale yellow liquid with big frothy white head. Fruity aroma, nice bitterness, can taste some of the alcohol, a bit sour. Nice carbonation.

Pale golden with big, white, frothy head. In aroma and taste pleasant peach fruitiness, bit of honey, some peppery and spicy notes also hint of alcohol. Pleasant bitterness in opposite to honey/fruity sweetness. Very soft, smooth and creamy in taste medium carbonation
Bottle. Hazy yellow/golden with big white head. Frooty aroma. Taste is a bit saur and yeasty, boozy and bitter long lasting finish. Abbey Tripel is just not my favorite style

- goldgelbe Farbe mit fantastischer Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach Früchten, Koriander und etwas Nelke
- die Carbonisierung ist mir zu hoch
- im ersten Antrunk steigt einem der erhöhte Alkoholgehalt schon leicht
 unangenehm in die Nase
- im weiteren Verlauf kommt etwas Birne zum Vorschein, aber auch dies
 wird gleich wieder vehement mit Alkohol überdeckt
- der Abgang ist dann durch die immer stärker werdende Bitterkeit geprägt
Fazit: Alkoholisch, bitter und unausgewogen
Charakterystyczna butelka 330 ml. Jasnozłota barwa, gęsta i drobnopęcherzykowa piana. Duże wysycenie, długo utrzymuje się w ustach. Pełna faktura. Ostry smak, bardzo mocne. Top.

From 330ml bottle. Pours amber gold with great head and lacing. This is a good trippel with less pronounced yeastiness that you often get with Belgium beers. Complex taste with malty biscuitness and just enough bitter

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours quite hazy golden, large creamy white head, great lacing. Aroma of Bready Belgian yeast, honey, grains of paradise, a bit grassy. Flavor is medium sweet, minimal bitterness. Medium body. Tasty.

Bottiglia da 33 Cl. Questa birra trappista con un tipico colore giallo dorato. forma un cappello di schiuma candida, densa e cremosa, e presenta un aroma fruttato e lievemente luppolato. Al palato si contraddistingue per il suo sapore pieno e rotondo, con una punta di amarognolo e un retrogusto elegante e persistente.
Non ci si stanca mai di berla e lalcool lo si scopre solo molto tardi.

Bottled. Bright yellow with a persistent white head. Aroma is citrus with a little sourness and a spicy yeast character. Smooth, good body and good carbonation. The taste has a notable yeast character with some sourness. The finish is spicy bitter.

A bottle from Jasons in the basement of 101, drunk at home. Aroma: nice, slightly sour vegetable-like smell. Appearance: slightly hazy, orange-amber, minimally frothy off-white head. Palate: full-bodied, lively carbonation, long, very boozy finish. Taste: very complex, plenty of fruit in there, the alcohol certainly makes its presence known. This beer is a work of art, lovely.

Valeur sûre. 
Note: bière expirée en avril 2011 dégustée après 5 ans (oubli!). Bonne tenue, le goût a évolué, plus fort et alcool plus présent. A comparer avec une récente.
Favourite beer.  Love most Belgian trappist beers but this tops them all for me  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
A real topgame. A bit fruity and a little beet sweet. My personal topbeer. Perfect in when it is cold enough.

A very good tripel, not my favourite Belgian style, but all around well made. I don't think it's as good as its ratings on here suggest, because it is so popular.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Espuma blanquecina que permanece como una fina corona, color dorado anaranjado y turbio, aroma intenso en nariz bastante dulce, sabor potente que torna de un sabor afrutado en inicio que se torna en un regusto seco y duradero.

Amber. Malt, fruity notes, spicy yeast, and in the aroma, some noble hops. Very rich, sweet and slightly pungent taste, with a dry and lightly bitter finish. A bit of alcohol, too. Medium body, with high carbonation. Overall, a wonderful tripel, and one of the best. Incredibly tasty, balanced, and still very drinkable.

Bottle. Light yellow, little bit hazy with nice long lasting white head. Yeasty and fruity (citrus) aromas, rather low. Low body, medium carbonated, dry but with light oily mouth feel . In taste also yeasty with slightly acidic / bitter finish and alcohol warming. Very interesting, good and very drinkable for the 9,5%.

Apparence : Dorée, plutôt limpide, quelques sédiments, très gros col blanc mousseux laissant une belle dentelle, effervescence moyenne et moyennement rapide. 
Nez : Phénols de la levure belge très dominants (coriandre?), légèrement céréalier, très légers agrumes frais, léger alcool en trame de fond. Intensité moyenne. 
Goût : Phénols, phénols et phénols! Je crois percevoir de la coriandre, du clou de girofle et du poivre de Sichuan qui rappelle en même temps un peu le piquant citron. 
Sensation : Effervescence moyenne-faible, corps moyen, chaleur dalcool bien présente, poivré sur la langue, longue finale chaleureuse, sèche à lamertume contenue. 
Bref : Surprise! Après un nez plutôt discret, on a une explosion de phénols en bouche accompagnés de malt bien sucré, dune amertume en finale et tout ça dans un corps bien rempli pour une Triple. On dirait pratiquement un petit biscuit épicé. Belle exécution qui manque malheureusement de tonus au nez.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 33cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famiflora) U: wazig goudblond met witte schuimkraag G: Banaan, mout, kruidig, wat gist en ook een alcoholtoets S: zoetig, fruitig (opnieuw banaan), gist. De bitterheid wordt gecamoufleerd door de zoete fruitigheid. Vergezeld van een aangename alcoholwarmte.
Golden colour, nice head. Aroma: sweet a lot of fruits - oranges, peaches, grapes. Some bubblegum and herbal, spicy notes. Taste: rather sweet, fruity with spicy finish. All well balanced. Very good.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy light golden orange with a lasting fluffy off white head. Aroma is of oranges, pepper, honey, citrus, floral. Taste is of biscuits, honey, pepper, caramel, stone fruit, long spicy yeasty finish. Watery to oily mouthfeel, hard carbonation.

Aromat cudny - kwiaty, figi, rodzynki, fenole, po prostu wspaniale belgijski. W wyglądzie jasny bursztyn z białą, całkiem solidną pianą, bardzo ładne. W smaku pełen bukiet różnych nut - rodzynek, fig, słodkiego wina, owocowej nalewki, wyraźne drożdże. Bardzo przyjemne, każdy łyk rozgrzewający. Ciało stosunkowo lekkie, pijalne, wysycenie średnie. Znakomite, kompletne, belgijskie piwo. Świetny tripel

Aroma: the aroma is nice, yeasty, fruity. 

Appearance is just good, I always find it hard too judge appearance, isnt appearance quite often quite the same? Maybe my eyes arent subtle enough.

Taste: this one shines, I love the yeast dryness and that huge bitterness. 

Palate: good Id like to try this one when its slightly less carbonated though

Overall: I freakin love this beer, its really dry and high in alcohol contents but it tastes really well and complex

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2017 Golden color, hazy. Fruit aromas, yeast, alcohol. Taste is banana, fruits, yeast, spices and heavy alcohol. The high alcohol taste works though. Slight acidic finish, with lingering alcohol burn. Really good.
Bue en bonne compagnie, cette merveilleuse bière est puissante, forte et se laisse boire après un bon repas. Peu mousseuse, robe en or goût merveilleux. Une réussite !

Aroma: fruits, bubblegum, citrus, acidic, spicy, very light hint of alcohol.
Appearance: pale straw yellow color, with medium thickness white head. Hazy. Head with low retention (probably because of its high alcohol content).
Taste: medium sweetness, light-to-medium bitterness, light-to-medium sourness.
Palate: medium body, oily texture, soft-to-average carbonation, quite long light-to-medium bitterness finish with a touch of sourness.
Overall: a good beer without discussion. The high level of alcohol content is not present in the aroma nor in the flavor. Good for thirst quenching. NIce citric touch. Well balanced.
Köpt på flaska i Brugge. Klar, gyllengul med luftig vit skumkrona. Maltig och söt doft. Söt, vass och lite spritig kropp. Spritig smak av örter, lite skumbanan, koriander och ljus sirap.
Flaska från snabbköp i brugge. Ljusgul kulör. Örtig doft med säd, humle och hö. Liknande i smak.

Big Bottle into goblet. Hazy golden w decent head. Fruity aroma. Soft palate. Sweet. Fruity. Dried fruits and figs. Some caramel notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flesje thuis gedronken. Gougeel helder bier met veel en stevig schuim. Vreemd aroma; asperges ??? Smaak is zacht en licht bitter. Drinkt lekker weg.

Bottled 33cl. Color : hazy golden ale with very thick white head. Nose : yeast, yeast, and yeast (and some fruits too). Aromas : malt, yeast, alcohol. Interesting bitterness, medium texture, medium carbonation. One of the best beer of this style assuredly.

Big bottle from surdyks. Enjoyed with commonmac for beer 999. Beautiful gold with thick and extremely effervescent white head. Floral and yeast nose, some spice. Tangy, very effervescent mouthfeel. Light Belgian yeast, citrus, alcohol , some banana and non citrus fruit. Finish is just right. A really good beer.

Large bottle purchased at Surdyks and consumed as part of RateBeer 1,000 celebration with commonshawn. Poured into Moeder Lambic glass. Plenty of effervescence. Almost a full finger of white head on a slightly golden orange colored tripel. Aroma has some solid spicy characteristics and a funky quality. Taste is basically a great representation of a tripel. There is a nice fruity (banana) quality working well within a pleasantly spiced environment. Mouthfeel is very solid and probably helps enhance the overall rating. One of the better tripels on the market. They definitely didnt westmalle it in.

0,33l bottle. Hazy yellow colour with medium lasting small white head. Aroma: Frutiy, flowery, notes of citrus. Taste: Sweet start with a light bitter mouthfeel. Medium body with medium carbonation. Medium lasting bitter/sweet a bit sour finish. Good tripel.
Une triple vraiment agréable. Robe assez claire. De lagrume et de lacidité. Une valeur sure.

330ml Bottle (Pitchers, Västerås) - Golden with a white head and a slight haze. Banana, syrup, yeast and notes of citrus in the aroma. Fruity and moderately sweet taste with banana, lemon and yoghurt standing out along with some spicy notes in the finish.
Pours a straw yellow with a thick white foamy head. Belgian spice aroma. Fairly thick texture. Somewhat fruity taste but has a somewhat bitter and harsh finish.
Light orange color. Aroma is nice and spicy as is the taste. Also some nice fruit notes and s really creamy mouth feel. Very complex taste but also very balanced
Nez plutôt fermé. En bouche malt houblon, un peu amer. Se développe sir les épices. Très bon.

Finom gyümölcsös illat. Szép világos szín, enyhe homályossággal. Erős gyümölcsös, fűszeres, komlós íz, ami mögött elbújik az alkohol. Kezdetben gyenge utóíz, ami később erősödik, de nem válik tolakodóvá. Testes sör.

Pours a thick white head with spring hints of hops and some present barley aromas. Hazy and clear gold colored body. Warm in mouth with strong aromatic hops and barleys but managed bitterness and malts. Pairs excellently with creamed and fish courses. My model of tripel ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Banana, quince, phenols, some bread, light alcohol. Appearance: Clear golden with strange sediment floating, head ugly, quickly falls down. Taste: Not very intensive, alcoholic, sweet, phenolic, some fuit like old banana, peach, strawberry, sugar sweetness, some herbal hops notes, bit abstringent. Palate: Finish is abstringent and semi-sweet, carbonation high, body medium.

Aroma: well balanced, not overly prominent. gentle banana esters, some spice from phenols, gentle hoppy spiciness. 
golden- slightly orange. clear with some particulates, white head, minimal, average retention. light sweetness, light bitterness, same taste as in aroma but with some added caramel and dough taste that adds a nice layer to the beer. 
light body, slick feel, lively, fluffy, gentle smooth finish, medium dryness.
overall: interesting, well balanced, hides its alcohol amazingly, but not that exceptional as it is portrayed. Could be a slightly bigger on the aromatics and taste.

330 mL bottle shared by ebone1988 for this stupid fucking book. I wish there were good beers in it. The pour is a bright golden orange with a thicker pure white head that falls to a thin film leaving some decent lace. The aroma is all banana and clove. Great. Everything I hate about Belgian beers. This is bound to be a dandy. There is a little bready malt present, but this is just going to suck. The flavor is terrible. There is a strong sharpness of banana and clove. Its sharp and cloying. There is a hefty permanent marker that really hammers this home that I hate it. The mouth feel is thicker and strongly carbonated with a cloyingly terrible banana, clove, and horse shit aftertaste. This is just not good. Fucking book.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 Damn book. Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is tropical fruit, banana, clove, booze, standard tripel. Appearance is darker golden, white head, slightly hazy. Taste is banana, clove, booze, spice, permanent marker, harsh, unpleasant, other synonyms. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, booze and dank banana aftertaste. Overall, damn book. I thought my palate could have conformed to this style by now, but nope.
Strong malt, bitterness, caramel, rich yet smooth and very enjoyable. Cant really taste the high alcohol content. I like

Pours beautifully with billowy white head and lacing. aroma of banana and spice with a touch of citrus. flavor follows aroma with dry alcohol spiced finish. Spicier than I remember it. Prickly carbonation. Brighter and more complex than I just described.
UPDATED: MAY 15, 2016 Bottle at home. Cloudy golden colour, white foamy head. Predominantly yeasty, spicy, grainy malts, dry; bitter finish. Quite complex! Lively carbonation, medium body.
Bouteille 33 cl - couleur dorée trouble, odeur très complexe à identifier, portant sur le houblon, goût: fruité, amertume sur lalcool et sur un goût floral

27/IV/16 - 33cl bottle @ Verdronken Land (Gent) - BB: n/a (2016-447) 
Note: well, finally. This is one of those beers Ive been procrastinating for years, and often when I had one, I didnt have my notebook with me, the conditions werent optimal for rating (going out at night, e.g.), or I just didnt feel like it, and I put it off, knowing thered always be a next time Id be drinking this. Well there, after more than 6 years of rating beer, I finally did the Westmalle Tripel. :p
Clear dark blond to orange beer, thick creamy off-white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet, ripe banana, bit spicy, coriander touch. MF: lively carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bit sweet in the start, ripe banana, yeasty, bit sugary, spicy notes. Aftertaste: pretty bitter and dry, still some sweetness lingering through though, some alcohol. With right and reason the mother of all Belgian (and international) Tripels.

Unclear light orange gold. Lasting frothy white head. Yeasty. Banana. Dark fruit. Caramel. Bready crust. Peppery/spicy. Alcohol. A lighter full, soft body makes for a satisfying and easy drinking experience.
Bière jaune trouble avec une mousse bien épaisse et très blanche. Pas très généreuse au nez elle dégage une petite amertume en bouche.

Bottle 330ml. Yellow-brownish with a white fluffy head. Lots of yeast in the bottle, didnt pour the whole lot into the glass. Bitterness like cloves or coriander with some light hops in the aroma. Taste is ripe fruits like bananas and pears. Smooth mouthfeel. The aftertaste of the bananas lingers very long.

Sometimes you should go back to basics. Everynow and then I come back to this one. Beutiful tripel with a fantastic white head. Powerful yeast and malt aroma. Really balanced taste. Refreshing and yet very intresting beer. I know this gets even better with age.

Multiple 75cl, 33cl and draught pours over the years, most recently 75cl shared at Bier mit Stil 1: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Feb 2016. - Bref: a Belgian Hefeweizen on jenever steroids. - The banana, clove and fusels are strong in this style-defining tripel launched by the monks in 1932 taking their supposed cue from Slaghmulder. - Remains dry, while warming and oily, transporting baked banana flambéd with jenever, warming in the throat, mouthfilling liked spiced nectar. Late white peppery hops and a straight astringency which could either be those Belgian grassy hops or yeast on pale malts. - Overall this is quite a simple beer: high-octane pilsner malts do a jenever rendition of an Imperial Hefeweizen. - Not quite my style within an already less favourite octane-high style that does have its merits and couldnt be more Belgian (merci Vander Velde).

Served in a snifter from a bottle. Pours clear golden colour with a big remaining off-white head. Aroma is a typical Trappist combination of caramel, bread, yeast, but this one has a strong alcohol presence laced through very clearly. Taste is bread, yeast, peppery and again, very alcoholic with a lingering bitter-sweet finish. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Far too heavy alcoholic presence from start to finish makes this beer not very enjoyable.
Yellow beer with white head. Aroma and taste arent very strong. Nothing bad, but wanted stronger flavours and aroma. Very refreshing for a 9,5%.
Clear golden with a big fluffy white head. Plenty of funky Belgian aromas going on, flavour follows with ripe banana, yeast esters, bread, stone fruit... Alcohol quite present. Lovely.

En bouteille. Belle couleur mais peu de mousse.
Arômes de vanille et de banane. En bouche cest lexplosion de saveurs: cest complexe, sucré comme il faut. puis le palais, long, peu amer, légère carbo et corps bien plein.

Pours light golden colour with dense foamy head. Funky trappist aroma. Soft creamy mouth feel combines with caramel, honey and vanilla as well as a sweet malt undertone. Long finish during which the subtle trappist funk returns. Subtle and light for a trappist but delicious.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Copper colored with a nice frothy head renewed by streams of carbonation. The body starts off rather dank, but after aeration, it blows forth a profusion of esters and stone fruits, such as strawberry essence, with some stale bread crust in the background. A yeast saturated body replete with esters, some bread crust, and stone fruit. A liquid yeast and sourdough finish, with notes of unripe banana skin and apple.. Definitely improves with aeration and warming.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2016 Cloudy yellow with nice white top. High carbonation, very nice in alcohol, complex but well balanced. Full body. Citrus and pepper, very interesting and so natural. High class. This beer undergoes a secondary fermentation in the bottle.The current formula has stayed practically unchanged since 1956, thus more than 50 years.

Bottle @ Flamingobar Ulvenhout. Smell is quite light and doesnt give too much away but is somewhat fruity. Looks light hazy with a medium white head. Taste gives fruits with some yeast and hops and is overall quite light for the type of beer. Overall, a very solid beer I really enjoyed drinking on a sunny day like this.
It smels prety soft. It is awsome for a Nice day in the sun. It taste pretty soft but the after taste is abit stronger. I like this beer for his softer taste.

Appearance: Straw colour with 2 finger head.
Aroma: Banana, clove, sweet candi sugar and alcohol
Taste: Clove, earthy, dry, alcohol.
Overall: The triple that started it all, great beer that could do with a little age to remove the ethyl acetate left over from fermentation.

Bottle. Golden grain bright color, hazy liquid with a lot of sedimentation, white foamy head. Banana smell. Aroma of banana, alcohol, cherry liquor (griotte). Good, but alcohol should be less intense in my opinion.

Cloudy yellow. Moderate white head. OK retention. Nose of fruity & spicy yeast. Apples, pears, phenols. Medium body. Oily. The flavour is dry. Very fruity. Lots of apples. Belgian yeast. Proper amount of hops. Hoppy & yeasty finish. Outstanding.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Drunk 10/06/14 at home after work. it was hot and currensy was blastin through the flat. quality. pours hazy straw yellow with a huge pillowy head. aroma of yeast, spices, clove and hops. didnt get much fruit tho. taste is pepper, herbs, spices, yeast and quite hoppy. theres also a lotta booze in there which is nice and warming with the spices. again i didnt get much fruit. minimal fizz and goes down smoothhh
Bouteille datant du 10 août 2015, elle simpose peu au nez et nous dévoile sa douceur au goût, le tout rendant cette bière hautement appréciable.
Tåkete honningmelon i fargen. banan, krydder, bondegård og lett vanilje i duften. Frukt, gress, hesteteppe i smaken. Tørr avslutning. Behagelig.

Ljus nästan guldfärgad. Doft av banangodis och jäst. Fyllig och estrig smak. Inte riktigt min grej men ändå bra 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: dry and fruity, almost like champagne; Appearance: light blonde and cloudy with white head that dissipates fairly quickly; Taste: complex and fruity; boozier than most tripels; very nice and not yeasty; Palate: medium body with long, bitter finish. Overall: delicious; my favorite tripel so far.

Pours a hazy orange maize with a frothy white head that lingers. Banana and slight bubblegum. Morning bun with citrus zest. Taste upfront is blood orange and dried apricot - a citrusy sweetness. Middle is white bread crust that gives way to a floral and slightly bitter aftertaste that lingers. Mouthfeel is light but slightly slick with lively bubbles. A very good Tripel that I find to be such more complex and drinkable than the Dubbel. Fantastic.

750 mL bottle, poured into a goblet. The aroma is warm with notes of bread dough, lemon rind, banana, and clove with a mild, baked bread quality late. It pours a hazy, effervescent gold topped by soapy, rocky foam head exhibiting good retention and lace. The taste is a medium / medium high sweet backed by a medium light bitter. The carbonation is soapy and foamy with a slick, creamy texture. The medium body is flavored with mild clove, light lemon, and bread that finishes crisp with an brief, intense clove that turns to banana and has a mild, lingering clove and light metallic note. Solid example of a beligian tripel, but doesnt strike me as outstanding.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2016 Pours cloudy yellow with thick and persistent white head. Nose is yeasty and spicy. Aromas are Belgian yeast, banana, spices (pepper), an alcoholic note. Average carbonation, medium body. Long bitter, spicy and alcoholic finish. Very nice tripel! One of the best actually.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cor dourad, opaca, espuma densa. Aroma refrescante, adocicado. Bem lupulada, bem encorpada. Excelente.
Bottle. Pours cloudy gold. Aroma of yeast,clove, a bit fruity. Taste is a little spicy with some sweetness and bitterness in there. Overall a great beer.
dolce corposa leggermente speziata con un retrogusto amaro importante e persistente che pulisce bene il palato
En af de kendte trappist øl, den er lys i smagen og har en god kraftigt smag fra alkoholen.
fruty aroma, mouthfeel is soft&creamy. sugar powder tasty. oh its trappist!
En nariz muy frutal, dulce, de sabor prolongado y agradable. Una deliciosa cerveza trapense!!

Levure et fruit au nez, couleur jaune orangé trouble. Citron amère, agrume, bonbons frais, épices à la dégustation. Amertume qui reste en bouche avec les épices. Alcool agréablement masqué...ça chauffe au final. Cette bière est fantastique.....

Bouteille. Nez de levures fruitées sucrées (agrumes, léger de pomme, de pêche et de banane) et épicées (clou de girofle, poivre), léger de malt aux du genre sucre bonbon, et très léger dalcool. Ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture crémeuse. Goût de levures épicées (poivre, léger de clou de girofle, coriandre et cannelle) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi rapidement dun goût de levures fruitées légèrement acides (léger de citron, léger de pomme et notes de bananes) puis un goût de malt sucré (sucre bonbon, pain, léger de miel, traces de caramel doux) et finalement une douce chaleur alcoolique amère et une légère amertume de houblon herbeux se rajoute avec un léger goût poivré. Arrière-goût moyen, légèrement amer dû à lalcool et au houblon avec une très légère aigreur fruitée (pelure de pomme et de banane) [notes 2005]
Even nicer than its double brother. Heavy and round again, but more distinct palate and more kick from the alcohol.
Blond tripel with big white foam. Good taste and a pleasant aftertaste. I would recommend it.
Dorada algo turbia. Espuma de buena retencion; aromas citricos y florales; cuerpo intenso, con buenos perfiles citricos bien combinados con el amargor siempre presente. Deliciosa.
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2016 The elevated alcohol level is good hidden behind the bouquet. The aftertaste is very pleasant.
Aroma of spices and fruits. Taste is very sweet, spicy with a hoppy finish and unfortunately not so well hidden alcohol. A bit too harsh and unbalanced, but still good.
250ème bière goûtée, Mousse blanche, couleur ambrée caramel, arômes céréales épices, Goût malts, épices, caramel, la présence dalcool est importante, 33 Cl Vanuxeem

Bottle @ Yashs place. Appearance: pours slightly hazy amber with ok white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: bread, orange peel, coriander, alcohol, brown sugar and lots of spices. palette: strong yeasty aroma, sparkling carbonation, medium to full body, medium to notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by a medium bitterness, average duration and an oily texture. Overall: Tasteful and balanced tripel

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2016 Alles so wie es sich gehört. Ein weltklasse Triple. Nah an der Perfektion. Leicht trocken, der Alkohol gut versteckt hinter den arttypischen Obst und Kräuteraromen. Getrunken bei Brewcomer Kiel.

330ml bottle. Sparkling golden colour with a frothy white head. Aroma of haylage with subtle hints of banana. The taste is likewise of banana, with a buttery undertone. Carbonation gives a prickly feeling on the tongue.
Bottle. Cloudy gold body. Frothy white head with little retention. Wheat, clove, tangerines, oranges, banana. Bittersweet and tangy. Dry finish. Fizzy mouthfeel.

Pale, a bit hazy yellow colour. Medium, white head which stays very long time. Caramelly and flowery aroma. Malty beginning. Caramel in the middle. Berrys, dark fruits, flowery finish. Medium bodied, well balanced, medium carbonated, ennoyable beer. Very nice palate.
Big white unstable head. Hazy yellow colour. Aroma of malts, yeasts, bread, alcohol. Good but its not my favourite style.

From 0.33L bottle. Pours murky, dark yellow to amber colored with a huge, not very stable, white head. Moderate malty aroma with hints of light bread and cookies. Heavy yeasty aroma, dough and banana. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with an intense yeasty taste. Finish is long and very slightly acidic with a moderate bitterness with a slightly alcoholic touch. Medium to full body with a creamy consistence with lively carbonation. A very good one indeed.
Bottiglia da 33cl. Di un colore dorato chiaro e trasparente, bella schiuma spumeggiante e non troppo persistente. Ottimo aroma fruttato come al palato.

Look; off white top, clear strawy golden body, some lacing. 
Aroma; juicy fruits, yeast, potato peel, caramel notes.
Taste; hops, barley, grains, juicy yeast, hops - 
finish is yeasty hoppy grainy. 
Feels normal strong. 
Overall a barley shot.
[33cl btl 9.5%abv, BB25.08.17 #3725]

Copenhagen 7/2 2016. 33 cl bottle from Meny. Pours hazy golden yellow with frothy white head. Settles as 1,5 cm thick layer of foam. Fruity aroma dominated by citrus and banana. Belgian yeast coming through as well. Medium carbonation and oily palate. Taste follows the nose. Sweet banana, black pepper, citrus, yeast and good long lasting bitterness lingering in the aftertaste. Hides the high alcohol content very well. A fine specimen. I wish I bought a bigger bottle. But then I would probably have been half drunk by now.

Admittedly, I screwed up and got this instead of the dubbel next to it, so it was a surprise when I poured it. It was a cloudy golden straw color with a thick, somewhat-soapy head. Not getting a strong distinguishable scent out of it. A bit of spice and sweet - but nothing I can exactly point out. 

There is a bit of spiciness and pepper in the taste, some sweetness to it too. Even with the carbonation, had a creamy mouthfeel. 

It is a pretty good beer, but was a bit underwhelmed. Might be due to me wanting (and expecting a dubbel), so will try it again. I prefer the Chimay
Floral, citrus, golden, rocky head, refreshing and sweet with a bitter final, medium body, lively...the first tripel, nothing else to say.
Goede tripel. Mooie kleur, volle schuimkraag, frisse geur, karakteristieke bittere smaak.

33cl bottle, served in Trappist chalice. Poured a cloudy golden yellow with a 3 finger white head. Aromas of caramel, vanilla, banana, cloves. Taste a continuation of the aromas, very sweet spicy, fruity mouthfeel. Medium body with a creamy bittersweet banana finish. Very good!

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours light gold with a creamy white head. Aromas of apricot, banana and citrus with floral notes. Taste is nicely balanced between the bitter fruit and spicyness and the soft sweetness from the pale candy sugar used in brewing. A very generous beer with a long finish.

Slightly cloudy straw colored pour with thin, but lasting white foam top. I bought two bottles, so hoping the other is different. Lots of pepper dominates the aroma. in there somewhere is some banana and bubblegum, but pepper and/or clove overwhelms. Flavor is unfortunately very similar. Hard to discern the subleties, but there is some malt sweetness. Finishes with a bite from the pepper.

Bonne bière blonde servie à la bouteille 
Belle robe doré des arôme riche et puissant
Cloudy golden with big white head. Malty, fruity, aroma, some banana and a hint of spice. Sweet taste, with a citrusy finish. Nice.
Infinita complessità. Fruttata, morbida, dolce e alcolica in bocca. Enorme ampiezza. Si chiude improvvisamente sul palato, amarezza del luppolo molto pronunciata.

Pours cloudy golden with a big foamy white head. Fruity nose and initial aroma, balanced hops, spices and champagne. Light sweet and light bitter, all very well balanced. Creamy mouthfeel, full body, high in carbonation but pleasant. High in alcohol as well, but very warming. Top-notch.

Strong aroma of malt and wheat with notes of fruits (banana), hops and herbs. Hazy golden liquid with a beautiful white foam. Medium-high sweetness and light bitterness. Full body, long lasting taste, average carbonation.

(bottle 0,33l @ Picollo (Opava))
Aroma: Sweet, yeasts, later spicy, fruity.
Appearance: Cloudy yellow color. Huge, white head.
Taste: Medium sweet, spicy, fruity yeasts. 
Palate: Full body. Long warm, spicy, hoppy bitter finish.
Overall: Very good. Complex.
Excelente cerveja trappista. Amargor leve, espuma fina e persistente, teor alcoolico bem equilibrado. Muito boa.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2016 Very slightly cloudy, big white head. Some wheat aroma. Not as much yeast spice as expected. Some lemon. Very sweet taste at first. After it warmed up get some more hops and a lot more Carmelized sugar in it. Probably was too cold at first. Very light bodied.

Im not so into trappist beers, but I cant deny this is a good one.

Complex aromas and flavours. Yeast and hop, this is what this beer is about. Sounds simple right? 

Nice appearance, nice colour, nice foam. Looks like a beer to me.

Palate is good, very good. Complex. I enjoyed it a bit more than I thought.

I doubt people that drink shitty beers everyday would even understand how complex this beer is.
33 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours hazy orange with a huge white head. Aromas of malts, yeast and alcohol. Taste is medium bitter. Very good tripel.

Clear body with a foamy white head. Aroma is florals d grassy. Taste matches with Carmel notes and effervescent on the tongue.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2016 Aged for around 3 years; 750ml Corked bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. A hazy golden beer with a strong spicy citrus and floral flavour with fruity, herbal hops, followed by a warming powerful warming malty and plastic fruity finish. Pretty good.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 Bouteille 33 cl. Superbe triple trappiste flandrienne. Tout a été dit sur cette bière de classe mondiale : mousse, couleur, arôme, bouche parfaits ! Couleur jaune orangée or un peu trouble et mousse qui reste sur le verre. Arômes : citron, levures, houblon, herbes. Bouche : abricot, ce quil faut dacidité. Bière très équilibrée, bien ronde, longue avec une bonne touche damertume.

Cest beau, cela sent bon, cest exquis au goût

I poured it from the bottle into a glass. It pours a slightly orange and golden color with a nice white head and good lacing. The aroma is great with hints of fruit, honey, biscuit, and grain. The taste is Belgian yeast, fruit, champagne, and alcohol. The carbonation is high. It has a nice champagne quality to it. It packed a nice punch. This is quality stuff.

Hazy apricot-coloured beer with a big white head. Aromas of champagne, malt, cereals, grassy and floral hops, lime peel and honey. Bitter almond and malt in taste, some bitter hoppiness and lots of pleasant warming alcohol. Very Long medium dry finish with some pepperiness. Heavy body, more than avarage carbonation, creamy texture.

Kolor: złocisty, zamglony.
Piana: obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, zwarta, dość trwała.
Zapach: owocowy, szampański, winny, lekko miodowy, słodowy.
Smak: średnia pełnia, delikatna słodycz, goryczka wyraźna, sporo nut owocowych, szampańskich, lekka taniniczność.
Wysycenie: w kierunku wysokiego.

Cloudy pale gold pour with a thin, tight white head. Huge aroma of honey, yeast, sweet biscuits, champagne. Slightly sweet, fruity, spicy cakey taste, some orange, cloves. A tiny bit of sourness and a little bitterness, sligthly winey, champagne finish to it
Aroma of mslt with alcohol present. Taste is sweet with yeast, fruit and some hops present. A nice tripel and easy drinking for 9.5... Good.

Un dorato velato sormontato da una candida e pannosa schiuma tenace e con grana fine. Al naso è una vera xxx con sentori di arancia, coriandolo e frutta a pasta gialla leggermente candita. In bocca si rivela morbida e sinuosa con un corpo medio ed una arzilla carbonazione che mettono in evidenza gli aromi di frutta e nascondono il forte tenore alcolico. Il finale è più lungo di qualsiasi altra tripel con una secchezza ed una rivalsa dell'alcol che non mollano mai la presa sulla lingua.

Splende nel suo luminoso color dorato, leggermente velato, sul quale si forma un solidissimo cappello di schiuma bianca e cremosa, compatta, molto persistente. Perfetta nella sua sobrietà. Laroma mantiene il rigore monastico: uneleganza fragrante e quasi discreta, fatta di fiori bianchi, zucchero candito, cereali, miele, arancia e pesca candita, un tocco di fieno, una delicatissima speziatura proveniente dal lievito. Al palato si presenta perfetta, con corpo medio ed un vivace carbonatazione che non preclude assolutamente una sensazione quasi morbida in bocca. La bevuta inizia con una freschezza fruttata sorprendente per una Tripel dal contenuto alcolico elevato (9.5%), per passare poi al dolce della frutta candita (albicocca, arancia e pesca), del pane e del miele sino alla delicatissima chiusura amaricante che oscilla tra lerbaceo ed il terroso; il tutto allinsegna dellequilibrio più assoluto. Impressionano sia la secchezza che il modo in cui lalcool è nascosto quasi sino alla fine, consentendo una bevuta agile e quasi "veloce" per poi rallentare il tempo nel retrogusto, un caldo abbraccio etilico ricco di frutta sotto spirito.
One of my favorite Abbey beers, and definitely in my top 5 tripels. Nice full body, complex taste that has light sweet and bitter tones, and a lingering aftertaste.

Pours hazy gold with a creamy white head. A rather sweet bubble gum aroma greets the nose. Taste is bittersweet, yeasty, with orange peel, bubble gum, and coriander tossed together. The hops presence is floral, fruity, and quite strong, but still in balance. Dry and very smooth with an alcoholic warmth that rises throughout. Very nice.
Typical Belgian aroma: a lot of fruits, some honey, bread, raisins. Carbonation is very high, something like champagne. Alcohol is well hidden. Perfect Tripel.

L: pours a bright hazy honey-gold, with a huge pillowy white head that lasts for days and laces strongly. 
S: theres a big up front whiff of Belgian yeast and champagne, this settles and offers a complex fruity aroma, spice and must, bready malt. 
T: fruity and spicy flavour, a tad boozy, more of a balanced mish-mash of flavours that work as one than separate parts. 
F: medium up front carbonation, full mouthfeel, smooth with a dry finish. No alcohol feel. 
O: its finessed, balanced, a benchmark for the style, although there are a few other tripels that excite me more this is great drinking.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2016 Really, I must have had this hundreds of times, but the last time was apparently before my RB years... Bottle, shared. Clear golden color. Big, rocky white head with good retention. Aromas: sweet, some fruit, malst/grain. Retronasal its sugar and fruit. Flavor is moderate sweet, somewhat fruity. Good carbonation. Rather strong alcohol feel. Medium bodied. Will add the finish with a next bottle :-) Some positivity points, because this has to be considered the Mother Of All Triples.

Color dorado, claro y cristalino. Con suave espuma blanca.
Aroma floral, con algo de plátano. Dulce y afrutada. Notas de bizcocho y especias. Final seco. Calidez alcohólica sin molestar.

Bottle.A: Cloudy gold with a foamy white head. N : Clove, coriander, white peppercorn, cracker, leaves, rye bread and doughiness. Good amount of banana and a hint of lemon rind.T: Good amount of bitterness and a touch of bitterness.M: Medium body, prickly carbonation, no alcohol.O: Given how sweet most American tripels are, this is downright hoppy. Well balanced and a classic but there is just something I am missing here.
Brilliant Belgian Tripel. This is complex and spicy, and it has a fantastic, champagne-like carbonation that really opens the entire beer up. Just a textbook example of what a tripel should be.

Aromat drożdżowy, szampański, zielone jabłko, landrynki. Kolor jasno złoty, doskonale przejrzyste. Piana średnia, utrzymuje się, szkła nie zdobi. W smaku znacznie lepiej - wysokie wysycenie, musujące, zdecydowanie wytrawne - brak kontrującej słodyczy. Goryczka niczego sobie, dość alkoholowa ale ogólnie alkohol bardzo subtelny. Posmak bardzo długi, gorzki, zdecydowanie rozgrzewający.

Orange colored, unclear, medium- white head. Aroma is Belgian sugar and spicy yeast, some caramel and bit of fruit. Taste is similar, medium+ sweet caramel and candy sugar, some fruits, quite phenolic spicy, Belgian yeast, bit of alcohol and warmth, medium- spicy bitterness, dry. Full bodied, soft to average carbonation.

My absolute only critique of this beer is it has zero head. Aside from that it is one of the single most incredible beers Ive ever had in my life, not too happy, perfect flavor and color, simply amazing!

Amarelo palha, turva, alta carbonatação. Espuma branca de boa formação e persistência, alguma precipitação de fermento. Aroma transparece o álcool, notas adocicadas, caramelado, banana, cereais, complexa. Paladar novamente alcoólico, leve acidez tipicamente belga, dulçor moderado. Corpo licoroso e alcoólico, média carbonatação. Aftertaste persistente, mantendo a acidez e sabor maltado.

Goudblond bier met rijke witte schuimkraag. Een fruitige geur, appels, peren en wat banaan. Heerlijke geur en ik lust niet eens banaan! De smaak is ook fruitig met vooral citrus, wat broodgist, ietwat banaan, maar laat ons vooral de aangename bitterheid niet vergeten die mooi in balans is met ietwat zoetigheid. Ook een goeie carbonatie en door de romigheid van het bier een volmondigheid die net goed is. De afdronk is bitterig en lekker lang droog. Voor velen nog altijd de voorbeeld tripel en terecht!
Bottle at Biercab. Golden colour with white head. MAlt, honey aroma. Sweet, malt, honey, fruity taste. Medium body.

Bottle from Cesky Brod-Liblice, CZ, Malt,yeast spicy alcohol tones, nice fruity aroma, Hazy dark yellow color, huge lasting head, Sweeter taste, followed by bitter and dry finish, Medium body, Average carbon, Pleasant strong trappist ale.
Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is light floral, some spices, yeasty, fruity. Taste is floral but crisp with a nice bitter hop, herbal finish. A full flavored Tripel.
Alcohol is not a priority, not strong, very soft and creamy in the mout, very elegance

Bottle, BB 07/04/2017. Pours a near clear light golden with a big fluffy head. The aroma is citric bittersweet, yeasty-doughy soft, but unfortunately a bit too modest. Tastes similarily bittersweet, with indistinct ripe (yellow, maybe red) fruits opening the scene, and continuing with green (unripe lemon, almost lime) bitterness, and the tiny zing of peppery spiciness. I love the subtle and rounded, yet pronouncedly bitter finish. The alcohol is well hidden, except for later on, lets say after 30-45 minutes, an alcoholic warmth starts to shine through the slightly lightish, dry palate. The body and carbonation are just right at perhaps a notch below medium. It is, without doubt, an excellent beer. 

Next step: must get a few more bottles to see how it develops over time.
Cloudy yellow in color with some sediment. Frothy white head. Sweet grassy aroma. Sweet flavor at first and then the hop bitterness kicks in with a long lasting finish.
Ottima birra,per corpo,sapori e profumi.Aspetto eccellente, facile da bere.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2016 Pours a dark, hazy yellow, with a tall head that goes away relatively quickly, leaving behind a thin lacing. Small sediments floating around. Sweet aroma, ripe bananas, pears, apples, dried grass and alcohol. As expected, the taste is also sweet, ripe fruit with a punch of spiciness from the alcohol. Nice carbonation. Warm after-taste, again, due to the alcohol. Will get sour with time, so drink it as fresh as possible.

correcta triple.aunque no la mejor de westmalle q me tomo.esteres afrutados
alcohol demasiado evidente.
Farven er gylden og skummet er tæt og fast. Aromaen er frugtagtig og smagen er tør, krydret sødlig. En øl som man nemt kan forfalde til.

Butelka 0,33l. To jedno z moich ulubionych ,,trapistów" Kolor jasnozłoty, mętnawy, piana szybko redukująca się ale zostaje w śladowych ilościach. Aromat cytrusowy, korzenny lekko. Smak gorzki także cytrusy i w tle przyprawy korzenne. Bardzo dobre piwo.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2016 Hazy golden color. Intense carbonation. Fruity yeast aromas, some caramel, and banana. Surprisingly sweet with some acidity. Has a noticable, but not overbearing hop bitterness.. Citrus grapefruit like flavors, nice and fruity. Finishes dry and spicy.

33cl bottle
 pours a golden yellow light haze,thin white head
 Aroma is bit of hop light fruit and grain
 Taste dryish bitter notes bit of citrus,long hoppy finish
 nice beer,I remember this being better ,still ok

Caramel malt aromas followed by citrus and banana,
Golden, hazy in color with a rocking head,
Taste is in balance with malt sweetness and hop bitterness,
Medium bodied, oily feel with average carbonation and long
bitter finish.

Vrij veel carbo, redelijk zoet en wat minder hop en fruit. Wel goede standaard kwaliteit.

Bottle
Aroma-floral, fruits
Appearance-golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour,

Overall-very good
Triple favourite beer. Good in taste, alcohol dont recognisable in taste,but in head, bitterness disapear fast, aroma is increasing in time. Good belgian beer I recomend
Orange/golden color with big thick white head. Aroma of yeast and raisins. Taste is dry, spicy and little sweet. Strongly carbonated with full body.
Hazy golden with a medium white head. Aroma is bread, yeast and banana. Taste is lemon, vanilla and bread.

330ml bottle @Bir&Fud Bottega (Rome). Pours golden with a big and persistent white head. Aroma of malt, yeasts, some esters, alcol. Flavour is very sweet, alcol burns in the throat. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. Too much strong.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2015 Willemstad, bottle at E&W. Clear gold and proper white head. Looks good in its original glass. Sweet malts, sour dough/yeastiness, fresh coriander, orange peel, lemon, cloves. Very strong aroma. Taste is sweet, spiced and then sour and bitter. Body is medium and carbonation is quite strong. A lovely beer! Great taste development.
33cl Flasche. Goldenes Bier mit schönem weissem Schaum. Komplexes Aroma. Malz, hopfen, etwas Hefe und Trockenobst. Schwer im Geschmack. Cremiges Mundgefühl. Tolles Bier.

Pours hazy and golden with huge and stable white head. Perfect. Aroma of malts, yeast and fruits like peach and grapes. Tastes dry and spicy, with notes of sponge cake, yeast and peach. Medium bitterness.
11.2 oz. bottle. Pale gold, velvety off-white head. Aroma of banana, malt, yeast, alcohol. Similar flavors, with some mild bitterness. Creamy texture. Very good.
33cl bottle on 19-Oct-2015. Dark amber with a medium sized tan coloured head. Aroma and flavours if sweet malt, dried fruits, figs and alcohol which continues throughout tasting. Sweet dry finish.

Bitter and dry. Spicy and rubbery flavours. Fresh bottle (2 months from botting time) has a clear hop character; older bottles lose this. A grainy maltiness in fresh bottles develops into a mellow chocolate flavour in older ones. Good beer.
Fruity esters. Slight haze. Honey gold. Dry & crisp. Rather easy drinking for a belgian tripel.

Bottle from Aeon Liquors. A contrast to yesterdays Avec Les Bons Voeux, heres Westmalles Tripel.

It also clocks in at 9.5% but pours a lighter honey gold with a thick foamy head of fizzy white. 

The aroma is bready, orange with a musty cinnamon-like quality. Full bodied but sharply carbonated with a dry-ish finish. 

This is much boozier than the Du Pont, it is rougher but that could be due to being a younger bottle. The taste is spicy, a bit of plum and nutty. Nice but not as satisfying as Avec Les Bons Voeux. I do enjoy the spicy/fruity finish though.

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

Light aroma, fruity but hard to distinguish. Pours hazy amber with a nice creamy head. Quite a bitter taste that lingers long.
Barwa jasny bursztyn, metne. Piana wysoka, szybko redukujaca sie do niskiej, trwalej warstwy. Aromat cytrusowy. W smaku cytrusy, alkohol. Bardzo pijalne piwo.

Light Amber with bubbly white head; aroma is appley and hint of sherry; flava is rich malty sweet not sugary tho grapey fruit some anise; feels medium to thick and foamy; finishes malty grainy subtly bitter
Duft sødlig honing malt lidt blomster smag maltet sødlig honing varm alkohol varm lidt krydret eftersmag

Smells like sweet over-ripe plums and spices. Fruity on the tongue - more dark fruits like plum and a hint of sour apples - with a smooth and creamy texture. The rich yeasty malts and the alcohol kick in on the aftertaste.

Aroma: peach, dried fruits, malty, some alcohol
Taste: medium bitter, light sweet, malty, peach, fruity

750 mL bottle poured. Bottled on 03/02/14. Held on to this one for a while, though Im not sure if I should have. Seems like a best fresh product, but either way, this is damn good. Pours a golden orange with a fluffy foam head. Spicy, fruity aroma from a distance. Huge aroma on this. Flavor has a lingering spice, Indescribable beer really. Unique. Nicely done.
UPDATED: JUL 3, 2016 Fruity aroma but quite weak. White medium head, hazy gold color. Medium sweet and bitterness, alcohol and yeast notes, with a long hop-bitter aftertaste.
Certainement ma triple préfèré, fort en goût. Dune couleur translucide, elle saccroche au palais

Apricot in the glass with a crown of pure white foam on top. Crisp red apples, sour candy sugar & green grapes. Booze burns a little as it goes down. Carbonation prickles the mouth. Great sense of balance. Would love to cellar a few of these & see how these age but its hard enough to keep a beer in the house for more than a week, so who am I kidding?
Трипель от Вестмал& немного уступае& дубелю, но все равно являетс& одним из лучших трапист& элей
Denne triple har et nogenlunde klar og lyst udseende. Den har en en kraftfuld smag af frugt, humle og en bitter afrunding. Rigtig god og kraftig smag. Medium karbonering.

Aroma of yeast, fruits, malt
Taste is the same. Good beer with strong bitterness in the aftertaste, though little bit more spicy would be better

Bottle from Auchan Market, Luxembourg City!

Pours hazy orange wirh lots of yeast particles. Aroma has fruits and belgian yeast. Taste is lovely fruity, yeasty wirh a hint of boozy alcohol. Finish has some perfume, lots of sweet fruits and belgian yeast.
Aroma is nice and fruits, yeast. Appearance s hazy orange with fluffy white head. Taste is strong with bitter and dry finish.

330ml bottle. Hazy orange with a big fluffy white head. The aroma is nice, fruits, banana, spices, yeast. Strong taste, and a bit too sour and bitter for my liking, I felt it overpowered the other flavours. Dry finish. This is one Id like to try again and re-rate in the future.
2015-07-01
Had this in Amsterdam, .3l bottle poured a hazy golden colour beer. Thick white and soapy head. Strong body, high carbonation. Yeasty aroma and flavour.

Poured from a 9.4oz bottle into a trappist. Slightly cloudy amber, thin white head, good lacing. Nose of banana bread, and some alcohol when chilled. Alcohol seems to subside a bit as the temp. comes up. Citrus rind, tending towards bitter on the tongue, like grapefruit. Creamy texture that lasts. Less sweet, with an enduring, somewhat bitter finish. Excellent example of the style.

33 cl bottle. Hazy, golden to orange, thin off-white head, very lively carbonation and lacing. Aroma hits the nose immediately after pouring it into the glass. Grapefruit, bitter orange peel, dark fruits and a slight hint of alcohol. Taste is cherries, grapefruit and light alcohol up front. Dry and bitter cherry, long lasting aftertaste. World class? Oh, yes!!

Bionda chiara, moltissima schiuma cremosa e duratura.
Profumo fruttato, malto caramellato, luppolo erbaceo.
Frizzantezza medio-alta, sapore dolce, malto caramellato, fruttato, chiuso da un importante finale amaro sui toni erbacei, e secco, come da stile. Alcool ben nascosto. Molto buona, bilanciata ottimamente.

Poured from the bottle to the glass, drank from the glass.

Aroma: plenty of caramel, a little resinous, some hay, and alcohol. Quite complex.

Amber orange colour, hazy with big, white, stable head.

Taste: more dry than sweet, medium bitterness.

Medium body, nether thin nor oily, soft carbonation and bitter, long finish.

Decent. Ive realised, that I dont like tripels... This one however is not so bad.
Cloudy amber, with thick white cap. Sharp bitter and sour taste, staying strong in aftertaste.

Pours a hazy golden yellow from the bottle with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave good lace. Aroma of Belgian yeast esters, banana, soft fruit, slight spice. Taste follows, ester is big, exactly what you would expect. This is the epitome of the style, good stuff if you like it.

Bottle, BB 10.03.17.
15 srm. Great head rentention. Dark orange with a bright yellow hue. Chilled haze. Reminds me of a Lost Abbey Belgian Golden (Porch). Less received residual malt sweetness vs StBT. Grain like a honey sweet graham cracker. Light fruity esters, but deep aroma of peppery spice comes to forefront. Straight cane sugar. Some alcohol burn, definitely not off-putting. Bit nutty as it warms up, Belgian yeast shampoo, floral, perfumey. Wet clay like Rochefort 6.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2017 Deze tripel heeft een aroma van banaan en graan. De smaak is vol en rijk: hop, gist, tarwe. Een mooie schuimlaag. Troebel en goudgeel gekleurd.Geweldige balans tussen ijp exotisch fruit, graan, alcohol en wat hop.
Maravilhosa, coloração clara, forte aroma alcoólico, sabor adocicado, amargo, com um leve gosto de ervas.

0.33l bottle. Hazy golden body, long lasting white head. Aroma of bread, candi sugar, orange peel and champagne. Taste of bread, candi sugar, pineapple and grassy hops. Sweet and bitter at the same time. Very nice.

Adquirida en Whole Foods, LES, New York. Trappist triple ale muy disfrutable. Sabor fuerte, cuerpo ligeramente cremoso. Espuma blanca abundante.

Złote, zamglone piwo o obfitej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w postaci warstewki. Aromat intensywny, owocowy, winogronowy, bardzo przyjemny. W smaku owocowe, cierpkie, kwaskowe, alkoholowe. Goryczka średnia w stronę wysokiej, alkoholowa. Ogólnie bardzo dobry tripel, gdyby jeszcze alkohol był minimalnie lepiej ukryty, było by to piwo idealne, a i taj jest bardzo, bardzo dobrze.
