Pale, big head. Malty aroma, yeast and spices. Light to medium body, bit sour, some bitterness.
Not my kind of beer. Its hoppy and fruity but it just get the flavors I really like.
High carbonation, golden and shiny. Beautiful spicy smell, dry. Complex body and long lasting spicy aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden, off-white head. The aromas are particularly full and with tons of small different notes: lemon peel, yeast, malt, but everything really toned down without any clear predominance of any single aroma (apart from the obvious malty one). Flavours are rich in malt, dark caramel, slightly herbal and with hints of spicy yeast, but with a detectable presence of the alcohol - not as well-balanced as I would have liked it to be. Body is medium to full, with a oily to creamy texture, long finish (again with that alcohol bite there that does not let me rate it 5/5 for palate.. together with the slightly too one-dimensional finish; let me point out that these are subtleties as I consider this beer to be a very good one) and a slick feel. Almost fantastic.
Pours light cloudy golden. Aroma is very malty, sweet. Taste is malty, warming alcohol.

Golden color, white head. Belgian yeast nose, banana, citrus, caramel, hint of dried fruit. Fruity taste, Belgian yeast, light malty, hints of alcohol, sour fruit and green apple, dry finish. Full body, soft carbonation.
UPDATED: NOV 21, 2016 Robe jaune, au nez agrume. Bière complexe en bouche : de lamertume, des arômes fruités, du corps. Equilibre bien mené.
Pours yellow and cloudy. Highly carbonated. Citrus fruity but pretty sweet in the mouth, but a little bit more bitter and lemony in the finish. Very nice
Im a big fan on Belgium beers. This one is of the best beers I ever drunk.... you cant fault it in any way!

330 ml bottle from the LCBO.
Appearance: Pours a
hazy golden yellow with a finger of white head. Retention is short and lacing dense.
Aroma:
Flour, yeast.
Flavours:
Yeast, fresh dough, lemon and sour fruit.
Mouthfeel:
Average viscosity and higher carbonation. Harsh bitter finish.
Overall: Did not really like this and would say it rates among the worst beers Ive had.

Aromat jest intensywnie drożdżowy, pieprzowy. Mamy mieszankę owoców, są morele, brzoskwinie ale także delikatny zapach bananowy i lekko cytrusowy - jednak nie jak od chmieli, bardziej kojarzy się z jakimiś cytrusowymi likierami. 
Smak to także bomba słodowa, z kolejno ukazującymi się owocami. Ponownie mamy morele i brzoskwinie. W tle lekkie posmaki pieprzowe. Alkohol jest wyraźnie wyczuwalny i rozgrzewający. Goryczka jest lekko zarysowana, drożdżowo-alkoholowa.

33 cl bottle. Pours a clear yellow with creamy white head. Aroma of resin, banana, alcohol and pepper. Taste is slightly sweet but finishes slightly bitter so hard to decide. Palate is full body with a full, creamy mouth feel. Overall excellent beer, one of my favorites.
330ml bottle at home. Strong and fruity Belgian tripel, a little hoppy bitterness but very smooth.
Nearly perfect. Basically as good as a Belgian tripel can get. It made me really tired, really quickly.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2015 Butelka 330ml, data ważności 19.11.2016, temperatura serwowania 12 stopni+, szkło snifter. Aromat: przyjemny, złożony, typowy dla stylu, estry( słodkie cytrusy, delikatny przejrzały banan), fenole(goździk), kwiatowość, po zamieszaniu szkła alk. W miarę ogrzewania się jest coraz lepiej pojawiają się nuty przyprawowe, bez wad sensorycznych. Barwa: jasne złoto, klarowne (stało kilka miesięcy w lodówce, na dnie butelki delikatny osad), przy dolewaniu nalane z osadem. Piana: biała, średnia, zbudowana z pęcherzyków o średniej wielkości, opadając tworzy kożuch o wysokości ok 1,5cm który utrzymuje się do końca, leasing słaby. Smak: przyprawowo-owocowy, z wyczuwalnym alkoholem ale w szlachetny sposób, goryczka średnia pieprzowo-alkoholowa delikatnie szczypie i rozgrzewa z wytrawnym finiszem, wysycenie wysokie, musujące do końca, średnio treściwe, szybko idzie w głowę.

Pours with amazing frothy head and has a bit hazy orange color and yeast particles in it. Complex aroma, mostly yeast, floral and citrus. No alcohol aroma on the front. Very lively carbonation and med/full body with long finish. 
Celebrating my new car with it. Cheers

33cl 07/04.17 Pours like a blond ale - cloudy blond with soapy frothy head. Strong aroma of everything in moderation. ABV is noticeable on all frontiers. Quite thin. I remember it to be much better, thicker. Aroma, palate and taste are all well balanced. Carbonation is enjoyable. Not my favourite from Abbey Tripel - I love my tripel rather flat, and malty. P.S. Big bottle is totally different.
Bottle - clear pale amber with thick white head . Strong citrus aroma and high carbonation - ting on tongue and in mouth. Taste overpowered by strong alcohol - too overpowering for me.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2015 resin, citrus, banana, pale, golden, lightly bitter, 
Convenient bitter in the tast, slightly touch of citrus. Taste keeps hanging in the mouth.
Bardzo jasne, piana wysoka, sztywna. W aromacie guma do żucia, biszkopt, przyprawy, korzenie - Belgia. W smaku lekkie owoce, marcepan. Goryczka niska, alkohol w ogóle niewyczuwalny.
Bottle at trollekelder. Pours pale yellow orange, nose is fruity, banana, caramel, taste is dry, sugary, toffee, fruit.

Loin dêtre ma préférée, mais extrêmement intéressante et surtout incontournable.
Nez commun, on sent quil y a du corps mais rien de remarquable.
Première bouche riche voire agressive : pas mal dalcool, beaucoup deffervescence, amertume (céréalière) plutôt écoeurante en fin de gorgée.
En deuxième bouche, on perçoit déjà des notes plus florales en attaque (alcool et corps malté toujours présent). En longueur, superbes arômes herbaux et de pin.
Bière riche !
En yderst spændende trappistøl. De er altid af høj kvalitet. Høj alkoholprocent - som gør den en anelse tyk og sød. Ellers en flot god øl.
Pale gold pour. Big white head. Plenty of lacing. Sugary aroma and taste. Notes of hops, but very faint. Too sweet and boozy.
pale, golden, hazy, white foam, herbs, resin, floral, full body, sticky, bitter, medium sweetness, very bitter,
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Goblet. Supplier: Intermarché (Lézignan). Rich and strong with warm depth and lemon hints.

(1 year old, bottled 7/2014)
Slightly hazy yellow/amber, persistent white head.
Nose: Very pronounced smell of dried grass. Then barn, wheat, yeast, hint of apples.
Taste: Medium fruitiness. Strong but balanced. Pronounced hops bitterness from the middle of the taste curve.
Huge rocky persistent white head. Great lacing. Fairly clear, light gold colour. Spice, white wine, citrus, slight banana aroma. Matching flavours, with pear, apple, slight heat, malty sweet.

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with sediment and a huge, long lasting white head that laces. Fruity aroma with spice and yeast. Spicy flavour with banana, yeast, mild caramel, warming alcohol and a dry, bitter finish. Full body with a smooth, creamy texture and soft carbonation. Complex and nicely balanced. An excellent triple.
Bottle . Golden colour with big head.Sadly no proper glassware was available.Spices malt and fruits(orange zest).Creamy full body.Will try it again.
Pours hazy golden with a perfect head nice carbonation starts off sherry with prune nice alcohol mellow and good cracking

Pours a huge frothy white head and has a hazy golden appearance. Very thick lacing. Lively carbonation. Aromas are mostly yeast, malts and orange peel. Flavours are big yeasty and spice notes. Also lots of citrusy and some hints of herbal hops. Full bodied mouthfeel. Quite a lot of bitterness on the palate. Good stuff.

Bottle at home. Hazy yellow beer, firm white head. Nose grain / grass, some citrus, yeast. Taste bitter fruits, hint of banana, mildly sour citrus, spices, grain, bitter hops. Mouthful somewhat creamy, medium to full bodied, long bitter and fresh aftertaste. Great tripel, easy to drink.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2015 New bottle bought in Belgium. Poured into a regular beer glass. Slightly cloudy golden with a big foamy head, that stays around. Fruity aromas and a bit of sweetness, that is countered by the somewhat bitter finish and a good bit of boozyness. My favorite tripel so far ( tried all the belgian trappist offerings plus a few more) ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle:
Cloudy orange.....a lot of floating particulates....large, foamy white head.
Yeast, yellow-apple, citrus aroma.
Taste is sweet, apple, apple-peel, Belgian yeast, peppery spice.....
A little bit of alcohol warmth....
Very good.

Poured into a trappist glass. Golden color with a frothy white head. Sweet aroma to it, getting lots of the yeast fruitiness, banana, stone fruit, some raisins, herbs. Tasted sweet and malty, also here lots of fruity flavours, bit of marzipan and a bit of bubblegum. Medium full body and slick texure, soft carbonation. A fantastic tripel!

330 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Hazy orange body with an ample white head. Smell is strong yeast manifesting as banana and light spice. Alcohol as well. Taste is less sweet that I would have expected based on the aroma. Hefty banana taste with some sugariness, but it quickly drops off leaving a bitter yeasty finish. Very dry finish. Seems like high carbonation because of how quickly it drops off. Deceptively light tasting, but the alcohol never subsides. Tripels are not my style, but this is about as good as it gets from a tripel.
330ml bottle. Hazy deep gold with a foamy white head. Flavors are dough, lemon, vanilla, honey, bubblegum, spices and alcohol. Medium to full body, good carbonation, smooth texture.

330ml bottle. Light hazy pale golden color with white head. Aroma is yeasty spicy, dusty, citrusy fruity, banana. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma with malty notes. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.

330ml bottle. Pours a slightly opaque golden orange with a two finger, bubbly white head and carbonation streaming from the center of the glass. Aroma is fantastic. Spice, Belgian yeast, and non-sweet candy sugar. Taste is balanced. Candy sugar and bubble gum to start, then into spice, banana, and darker sugar, then a warm, spicy ending. Very nice. Medium-full body with a high carbonation. Slightly syrupy in the mouth with a dry finish. Overall a great tripel. Lots of spicy yeast, and candy sugar.

I gave it try and tried open my mind
but I dont get it.
This one is not for me.
Chems,soap,diesel and strong alcohol with a finish of old school kids medicine.
Perhaps if you have the history and exposure youll get it.

The foam is nice white, rich and persistent. It has a nice fermented aroma with clear traces of coriander and citrus fruit (both orange and lemon). Coriander and citrus predominate in the spicy taste. Palate is very large and also has a pleasant sweetness that stands in nice contrast to the spicy / sour. The finish is long, soft and rounded without too much bitterness. The alcohol should probably be assumed to be aggressive, but to spicy dishes, I think it will be great good.

In a long string of Belgian ales, Ive finally had one that comes from, well, Belgium. While I wouldnt go so far as to say the Belgian ales have a superior taste, its hard to argue against their physical beauty. Westmalles Tripel is sublime in the looks department. Golden body with pure white suds. Some lovely aromas here, too. Fruit, earth, malt, candy, and booze. Sound fantastic, right? It is. Banana, grass, malt sugar, clove, citrus - lots of highly palatable complexity. Mouthfeel is velvety smooth. Is it weird to say this beer feels good in your mouth? Because it does. Whatever. Im not ashamed. If you love the lighter-colored, brighter Belgian exports, get yourself this one.
yummy tripel with all the right characteristics of the tripel style. I find it too boozy however.

Beautiful, deep and mighty aroma, full of malts nad fruity notes. Its slightly hazy, golden color beer with nice white head. Its full body, very smooth and highly carbonated beer. But this carbonation feels great, there is a lot of micro bubbles which are fizzing on the tongue. In taste full malty flavour, with great fruity notes and pleasant bitterness in the aftertaste. Alcohol is noticeable. Great classic. Must try.

Bottle @deTolly, Taru. Pours hazy yellow with medium thick white head. Aroma is sweet, fruity, yeasty, oranges, candy, Taste is sweet and sour, alcohol, malty, yeasty, some spicyness.Not a fan of tripples, but OK beer.
This is a good tripel. Easy to drink, good appearance. However, personally, I do prefer beers with hops more evident.
Bottle 330 ml. Golden-straw color with good foam. Aroma: malt, fruits, citrus, white port wine, spicy, floral hop. Taste: warming, white port, malty, citrus and other fruits, well balanced.

330mL bottle. Pours hazy blonde with a thick cap of white head. Nose is loaded with fruit; apple, banana, juicy fruit gum, candied orange. Lots of candy floss, honeyed malt, chamomile and woodsy hop. Sweet up front with plenty of spice and a bit of bitterness on the back end. Full bodied and full textured with a creamy mouthfeel. A hallmark, lovely.

Bottle at The Holy Inadequate, Etruria. Pours a hazy golden colour with a fizzy white head. Aroma of bread, some Belgian yeast, cereal, slight banana, subtle cloves, a little apricot, herbs and lots of spice. Taste is similar of bread, some Belgian yeast, banana, subtle cloves, slight vanilla, pepper, lemon, a little apricot and spice. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dry, slightly tart, citrusy hop bitterness in the finish. A great example of a Belgian tripel. Fruity, spicy and the unmistakeable Belgian banana, clove yeast flavours. Great.

Bottle. Orange-gold with white head and substantial lacing. Subtle fruity yeast aroma. Yeasty citrus upfront with mild plum and subtle clove in the finish. Full, mouthcoating. Exceptionally long finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not my favorite Aroma. But it is good. Lots of cereal, citrus, fruity and hoppy aroma. Normal Foam, is a bit more carbonatated than I would wanted. I felt it very dry.
Bottle from Belgium deep cloudy golden nose is fruity and yeasty aroma flavour is fruity yeasty some light sourness but also sweet notes creamy alcohol mouthfeel

Golden color, cloudy liquid and medium head.
Hoppy aroma (floral) and alcohol.
Taste - Biiter, sweet and sour in the end.
On the palate, it has a fizzy carbonation and nice body.
Very good tripel.

Bottle. Havent had one of these since I started rating. Yeasty and honeyish nose, orange peel, spice, and some fumes. Hazy medium orange/gold color, big fluffy white head which diminishes to a fairly constant 1-cm or so, exceptional lace. A liquid grenade of condensed fruit, candi sugar, small citrus notes, light pepper, and very evident alcohol. Geez! Feels both fresh and matured. Kick ass stuff.

Líquido levemente turvo,coloração dourada/alaranjada,espuma cremosa,volumosa e duradoura;aroma e sabor com boa complexidade,frutados,adocicados no início e finalizando com notas cítricas e condimentadas,álcool notado mas interagindo bem com maltes e lúpulos,boa carbonatação,bom corpo,equilibradíssima,uma Tripel harmônica , fácil de beber e se apaixonar,ótima cerveja.
Very spicy, very herbal, bitter finish with some noble alcohol touch. Classic tripel.

Pours hazy yellow with small yeast sediments and a huge white head. Spiced, slight acidic and yeasty aroma. Smooth, spiced, slight acidic note, mild caramel malt and that yummy mellow Westmalle yeast note. All in a complex yet smooth blend - with a light bite towards the finish, just telling you that this is a 9.5% alcohol beer. Fantastic.

Dorata pallida, velata dai lieviti in sospensione, schiuma bianca di media persistenza che lascia il classico merletto di Bruxelles sul bordo del bicchiere.
Aroma di chiodi di garofano, pepe, banana matura, leggero lievito belga.
Al palato attacca con una nota dolce maltata per poi ripresentare le stesse caratteristiche aromatiche, per poi finire con una bella cosa amara erbacea e con il warming etilico proprio di questo tipo di birra.
Retrolfatto di banana matura, lievito , leggeri chiodi di garofano e leggero erbaceo.
Corpo medio, mediamente carbonata.

Poured from bottle. Aroma of citrus. Pours a hazy golden with white head. Taste is light sour. Body is medium, with creamy texture and lively carbonation. Has a slight bitter and spicy finish. A complex brew, the quintessential tripel.
Golden and thick white foam. Sting alcohol. Syrup, apples, gooseberries, some banana and cloves and a dry Finnish

Прекрас& оформле& долго держал, выжидал момента. Однако не пришлос& по вкусу. Обалден& аромат, однако дофига высокая карбони& и какие-то налеты лагера, где бельгий& тело как-то спрятан& на заднем плане.

Golden-orange colour with white fluffy foam. Aroma: lots of yeast, spices, citrus fruits. Taste: yeast, citrus fruits, spices, strong alcohol presence. Medium sweet, finishes dry. High carbonation. A fantastic tripel

Ambar claro. 3 dedos de espuma muy burbujeante (se oye). Aroma complejo muy especiado y frutal. En boca primero frutal, fuerte a piel de naranja y quizá melocotón, menos, que se pega al paladar, para dejar un final sequísimo, largo y amargo. Muy buena.

Zapach: delikatny, owocowy, bardzo przyjemny miękki zapach

Wygląd: piękny lacing, piękna piana, niestety niezbyt apetycznie wyglądające drobinki, piekna świeżo, jasno pomarańczowa barwa

Smak: pierwszy kontakt jest zabójczo alkoholowy, by po kilku łykach zmienić się w wyraźny, cholernie bogaty pijalny smak. Długi świetny finisz, pozostawiający w ustach posmak jabłek. Aromat podchodzący aż do nosa jest nieinwazyjny, balansujący na granicy wyczuwalnego alkoholu, czuć że to piwo ma swoje procenty ale na pewno nie aż tyle! Świetna robota

Hazy golden color with high head. Aroma of banana, pepper, alcohol. Taste is a mixture of sweet, bitter and spicies. Quite well balanced. I dont taste much alcohol though the taste is strong, which is good.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2016 Bottle from Tanakaya. Poured into a Duvel glass. Pours a slightly hazy golden straw color with a medium-sized soapy white head. Clove, banana and apple stand out on the nose with a very nice saison-like aroma that persists throughout. Slightly sticky mothfeel, medium body with lively carbonation. Great complex palate with some sweetness, spiciness and bitterness. Great peppery and bitter finish with the hops noticeable near the finish. A wonderfully complex tripel that is quite like a saison on steroids. Still magnificent after all these years.

Pours a hazy light yellow with a small white head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of yellow fruits with floral and peppery alcohol. Taste is of pears, sugar, soft alcohol and moderately bitter. Lightly sweet and far from cloying. Peppery alcohol again but all in a classy manner. Body is medium, carbonation high and mouthfeel sticky and lightly boozy. Overall a fine tripel, this is pretty much a benchmark for the style I guess and extremely enjoyable.

Très chargée au nez! Ça sent les épices et la rondeur légendaire des tripels transparait. Une belle mousse est également de la partie. En bouche, cest vivant et étonnement léger. Je mattendais à quelque chose de plus corsé en me basant sur lodeur... Une fois la mini surprise passée, cest quand même vraiment très bon. Cest riche et complexe. On décèle le miel et les épices. Lalcool est dissimulé dune manière prodigieuse et fait de ce liquide lexemple parfait dune "bière dangereuse". Jaime les choses dangereuses!

Bottle @ home. Pours with a light orange hazy colour, medium rocky white head. Aroma is medium malty, slightly hoppy; very "belgian", with complex notes of fruit, citrus especially; distinct notes of hay and basement aromas coming from the yeast. Taste is medium sweet, slightly bitter, medium salty, slightly sour. Medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation.

Heerlijk niet te moeilijk bier. Een favoriet.
  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Plonk with Drew, thanks! Golden pour, small white head, a bit of sediment floating around and cloudy. high carbonation giving a very full mouthfeel. Fruity yeast esters, sweet initial impression but dry finish and solid bitterness, a little hop aroma coming through. Very complex. Superb.
Delicious honey crisp cereal. Terrific tripel. Long finish of fruit and dry hops. A really good example of the style. Seems like all others are doing something based on this one. Must try!
UPDATED: JUN 8, 2015 Strong and spicy Belgian Ale. Creamy head, golden, fruity and hoppy. Excellent

9.5% ABV

Pours with a nice thick head. Color is a dark honey, light amber. Has a very pleasant wheaty nose. Very wholeseome and pleasing. Nice sharp alcoholic first mouthful. Very pleasing malty, beery flavor that vanishes all too quickly into a cloud of ethanol. There are pleasing highlights of surprisingly herbaceous hoppy notes. 

It is a trippel after all and I personally am beginning to think that anything more than a dubbel has too much alcohol to facilitate a proper enjoyment of the complexity of the beer or the finer tasting notes. I would like to have tasted the toasted wheat or the nice clean hops. Its just my palate I guess.

S:
-pepper,coriander,caramel,honey,banana
T:
-m hop bitterniss
F:
-fairly alcoholic
O:
Not as nicely balanced as other Tripels
UPDATED: MAR 27, 2016 Strong, spicy and good taste, i love it. If you love strong beer, you should try it...

On parle ici de finesse. Autant elle est facile à boire quelle est complexe. Je devrai passé plus de temps à la déguster, mais je me souviens dune bière avec les éléments suivants: fruité, sec, gomme balloune, franche, douce et trop bonne, Sur cinq tripel dans une dégustation à laveugle, cétait ma favorite.

An honest beer brewed from prime ingredients.
More than eighty years after its creation by the famous master brewer Hendrik Verlinden (1866-1940) Westmalle Tripel is still one of the best tripel beers ever.
By far my favourite Trappist beer, IMHO much better than Westvleteren.
Sterke triple met een bittere smaak. Naar mijn mening overheerst dit bittere te veel en daarom een matige triple.

Yellow clear color little foam slowly disappearing het a little scent from it mostly malts flavor intens bitter dry on aftertaste peppery hops Nice tingling sensation in my mouth remains one of my favorites

Gelb orange leicht opal mit schönem weißen Schaum. Geruch säuerlich fruchtig, wie Cidre. Sehr herb, bitter. Auch geschmacklich erinnert das Bier an trockenen Apfelwein. 
Gut!

Bottiglia. Colore dorato, pallido, con abbondante schiuma bianca di media persistenza. Aroma eccezionale, frutta dolce, banana. Gusto mediamente dolce e straordinariamente appagante, ben equilibrato con la leggera amarezza comunque presente. Finale duraturo, che lascia in bocca unottima sensazione. Alcol molto ben nascosto. Fantastica.

Foam: nice white with lingering.
Colour: hazy golden.
Aroma: yeasty, spicy, phenols like banana, clove, flowery, citrusy.
Taste: sweet, with green pepper and phenols, grassy, herbal, orange, hoppy, bitter, alcohol but well hidden, full body, medium to high carbonation, one of the best triple I have ever had.

Dorée pâle non trouble, une bouche sur amertume prononcée, avec une pointe sèche, un ensemble assez costaud pour une très bonne bière. Peut être un alcool un peu trop pesant sur la longueur. Trouvable dans certaines grandes surfaces et chez Léon de Bruxelles en France.

Even out of a goblet, there was much aroma. Maybe it was too cold. The appearance was as expected. It looked like an unfiltered pils or original hefewiezen. The taste had a lot of similarities to a pils, with the bitterness of the hops. The finish was beyond the DIPA bitterness. I didnt really enjoy that, but that is this beer. The palate was nice. It had a heaviness and creaminess to it. I know many people rate this beer excellent. I will definitely drink it again, just not that often.
Uma trappist sensacional. Apesar da cor clara, que lembra mais uma lager, tem sabor forte e marcante.

Une bière vraiment succulente. Une couleurs très claire par rapport au degré dalcool, une amertume assez forte sur une base pure mais enrichie par le travail dune souche de levure de haute qualité. Un classique!!
@special event. A great tripel. Lots of caramel, sugar and spice, some nice alcoholic aftertaste. Definitely good.

Pours a hazy gold with a foamy head and lots of lacing. It has a great aroma of biscuit, coriander, and other spices. The flavor is spices and citrus with a bready backbone and strong, dry finish over a light-medium body

Golden hazy color, with good head that kept a lace till the end. Medium do low carbonation. Full bodied, creamy texture. Aroma is yeast, malt, spicy and some orange/citrus. Taste is malt, caramel, coriander, orange peel and slightly acidic. Alcohol becomes more present near to the end, when also body becomes more thin. Aftertaste is sweet but also dry.
On tap at 2 be, Brugge. Cant believe Ive not rated this before. Dark brown and biting alcohol bitterness. Lacking depth of flavour though or the creamy moorishness of, say, a Rochefort.

Shared bottled with Jeppe.
Aroma of sweety fruits and hops. Hazy golden amber with white head, long lasting. Medium sweetness, light+ bitterness. full body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitterswee finish. Some alcohol sweetness.
In my opinion the benchmark of all Tripels. One of the best beers I have had the pleasure of drinking. Plenty of spice and fruit flavor with a powerful aftertaste.

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 05/01/17 Pours cloudy straw to golden liquid, big frothy stable white head, Aroma: Belgian phenols, spicy, apricots, candied fruits, sweets, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour, fruits, spicy, Belgian phenols, apricots, very tasty, Palate: medium to full body, creamy to sticky texture, lively to fizzy carbonation, long candied aftertaste, quite drinkable, Overall: very good, enjoyed.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2015 Compra: www.cervezasespeciales.com
Ingesta: Jugando a kings bounty dark side
Opinión: No esta entre las mejores trapenses. Sabor aburrido.

Bottle. Nice golden-orange colour with white fluffy foam. Aroma: lots of yeast, spices, citrus fruits. Taste: yeast, citrus fruits, spices, strong alcohol presence. Medium sweet, finishes dry. High carbonation. A fantastic tripel!

Golden color almost clear beer with big white head. Aroma of fruit esters (sweet yellow fruits), a little bit of malts, this belgian yeasts spicy aroma, pretty nice. Medium sweetnes, dry, high carbonation, realy drinkable. Perfectly hidden alcohol. 
Overall: Perfect tripel, beware of drinkability with this abv!

Bottle. Yellow, slightly cloudy comour. Medium white head. Spicy aroma, belgium yeast, some fruits. Flavour of bread. More spices and yeast. The alcohol is present too. Nice mouthfeel. Medium body and carbo. A really hood triple.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Gold pour, white head. Unfiltered, lots of remnants in suspension. Touch of hay and citrus aroma. Strong carbonation, slightly bitter, almost sour. Dry leathery aftertaste.
330ml bottle from Bochka in Moscow. Pours clear gold with a large white frothy head. Aroma is spice, citrus and yeast. Taste is medium bitter.
From bottle. Zero head. Yellow color typical of tripels. Sweet aroma. Fine carbonation gives it a great mouth feel. Sweet but ends with a grassy bitterness.
A dry and refreshing beer with a fantastic depth and complexity in aroma and taste. Beware of the high ABV though!
Easy to get belgian tripel. One of my favourites, great taste, nice foam head, nice colour.

Bottle. Pours almost clear, orange in colour, with big, white, stable head. In aroma malt, bread, apples, grapes, herbs. In taste bread, fruits, herbal and earthy bitterness. The beer is medium sweet with low bitter ending. Fizzy carbonated with well hidden alcohol. Nice tripel.
Old rating. Standard delicious abbey tripel. Dark gold pour, Belgian yeast and spice, fruit, bubblegum, alcohol warmth, dry bitter finish.
33cl bottle. Pours yellow-golden color with medium head and almost no lacing. Strong fruity aroma. Yeasty taste with strong alcohol presence. Long, bitterish aftertaste.
Pours a hazy golden color. Aroma and taste are sweet with citrus, malts, and Trappist goodness.
Het bier is heerlijk zacht in de mond. Mooie stevige schuimkraag erop. Het bier heeft iets citrusachtig in de smaak zitten wat me erg bevalt.

The 33cl bottle had a best before date of 23rd July 2016 and was poured into a Chimay goblet. It poured a hazy golden straw colour with a white head that dissipates fairly quickly leaving thin soapy like lacing. There were aromas of bready malts, caramelised banana, candied sugar, slight bubblegum ending with lemon sour? Tastes were of sweet bready malts, orange, pear maybe some lingering banana ending with some slight alcohol. It was medium bodied with nice carbonation, creamy and also somewhat sticky. Overall this was a decent tripel. The best thing about it was its look especially the thin soapy lacing. The taste itself was decent, but nothing too special either.

Robe blonde et opaque. Pas de mousse.
Saveurs de malt, fruits jaunes et épices.
Carbonatation fine, texture épaisse.
Très longue en bouche.
Une excellente triple.

베스트말레-트& 9.5% ABV 시메이와 더불어 가장 유명한 벨기에 수사들의 맥주. 과일향의 강렬한 어텍, 부드럽고 크리미한 질감 사이로 뚜벅뚜벅 걸어들어오는 힘찬 홉의 아로마와 강한 단맛의 알코올기운. 
https://twitter.com/MaekJuBot
A far better Westmalle than the Double. Great fruity taste and long-lasting aftertaste.

Pours very hazy golden with stuff floating around a a rich white head. A spicy aroma with some bubble gum and alcohol. A long-lasting dry taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2015 I used to like this very much but the more I drink other things, the more I find this style overly sweet, too yeasty, boozy and cloying. Nethertheless this beer is a benchmak in belgian tripels.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Golden reddish colour. Aroma of fruits, hops, some herbs. The same is flavour, with malty notes and bitter - dry finish and aftertaste. Very good brew, but it is not convince me as Dubbel.

Piana śnieżnobiała, bardzo obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa. Barwa głęboka, złota. Piwo delikatnie zmętnione. Aromat delikatnie chlebowy i lekko alkoholowy. W smaku alkoholowy, choć nie aż tak, jak mogłyby wskazywać procenty. Goryczka delikatna. Czuć drożdże. Piwo trochę zalega. Wysycenie dość wysokie, gryzące.
375 ml bottle poured into a tulip glass..yellow/gold with a thin white head..aroma of bananas,bread,spices..dry taste with banana,bread and spices..very good.
Narancsos barnás szín közepes nagyságú fehér habbal. Édes malátás f?szeres és éleszt?s illat. Mézes éleszt?s íz. Testes gyorsan üt a 9,5%-val.
For me, this is the best beer of the Westmalle Trappist Abbey! I like it the best.

Cloudy pale yellow, with a very thick and lasting head.
Intense aromas of banana, bread, figue leaf, lemon curd, and a hint of cookies. A clear balsamic note, reminiscent of mint.
Lively, pungent, markedly developing its way through the mouth. Long-lasting end. Great.

Pours a hazy gold with a foamy head and lots of lacing. It has a great aroma of biscuit, coriander, and other spices. The flavor is spices and citrus with a bready backbone and strong, dry finish over a light-medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Goede smaak vol aroma. Vast schuim mooi parellend. In zeer mooi glas geserveerd. Top!

De couleur blonde plutôt claire et mi opaque.Sans col avec un petit anneau de mousse.Son effervescence est moyenne.Au nez se sont les levures belges,le pain frais et les épices douces.Au goût, les bulles frappe nos lèvres et le palais à lentrée.Une tripel franche et vrais avec une finale quelque-peut épicée qui demeure en bouche.

Shared bottle. Hazy golden with medium persistent white head. Aroma is spicy, lot of malts, yeast, grapes, peach. Taste is moderate bitter, medium sweet, lots of yeast on tongue, very boozy. Dry, full body, light bitter finish.

33cl bottle, cloudy golden color with really big, creamy and persistent head,
aroma with hoppy sensation, in mouth is dry, floral hoppy notes and one hint of sweetness, good carbonation, dry and hopped aftertaste

Blonde paille, grosse carbo, collet epais et persistant. 
Aromes de pain beurre, fruits verts, amandes. Ronde, finale sur les fruits et la frangipane. Bonne amertume longue.

Appearance: hazy,golden with a good frothy head (allmost 3 fingers) that leaves some nice lacing.
Aroma: bread, apples , yeast, herbs, cloves
Taste: medium sweetness, light bitterness,. Clove, yeast, hay, yelow fruit, grass with some earthy bitterness in the finish, which lasts quite long.

Palate: full body, creamy, lively carbonation, 

Clearly one of the best Belgian Triples out there.
Poured from bottle into snifter. Pours a clear gold with a 3 finger head of medium sized bubbles. Aroma - spicy and citrus notes are dominant. Taste - fairly dry and crisp, spicy.

NOTA DE CATA:
- Aspecto: Trapense de color amarillo, con reflejos dorados. 
- Aroma: Un olor suave, algo cítrico y atrigado. 
- Cuerpo/sabor: Al paladar, se percibe su carácter sedoso y aterciopelado así como una nota de amargura apoyada por los aromas afrutados, se va suavizando y se torna en un sabor a trigo suave, aunque su toque alcohólico la hace diferenciarse de las cervezas de trigo.

8.1.2014. Vaalea ja kirkas. Tuoksussa jotain trooppista hedelmää ja raikkautta, tarkemmin nuuskiessa tulee myös hieman belgihiivaa ja humalaa. Maussa kypsiä hedelmiä, luumua (?), belgihiiva. Melko hiilihappoinen suutuntuma. Alkoholi ei suoranaisesti puske läpi, mutta jotenkin ikävästi tuntuu.
Bottle. Really enjoy this tripel. Pours Orange/gold with a grat white head. at the aroma is yeasty, herbs and earthy. very balanced for the ABV that it has. Ill drink this really often.
Excellente bière blonde, son goût est subtil et presque rafraîchissant, mais on est loin d'une bière de soif. Elle se déguste !

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2016 Bottle from Whole Foods Market Fair Lakes

Aroma: bread, apples
Appearance: hazy, golden, frothy head, 
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate: full body, creamy, lively carbonation, long finish
Overall: excellent tripel, would recommend
Gewoon prima tripel, lekker sterk. Geur van alcohol en graan. Smaak ook. Licht zoetje.
Bottle at Frites Wanchai. Rich dry apricot, brioche, peppery yeast, warming alcohol, clean finish. Lovely classic tripel.

Laakea lasi, aromista ei oikein saanut kiinni. Suutuntuma hyökkäävän voimakas, intensiivinen kitalaessa. Alkoholia mukana mukavasti positiivisessa mielessä. Perus haalean vehnän väristä. Suussasulavan vaahtoava suutuntuma, pieni raikkaus ja kirpeus. Todella hyvää.

Bottle 0.33 l, Carrefour, Wrocław, Poland.
Jasnozłote, mętne piwo o obfitej, puszystej, sztywnej i trwałej pianie oraz lekko biszkoptowym z leśnymi nutami oraz zdecydowanie cytrusowym aromacie. W smaku wytrawne, złożone lekko biszkoptowe i zbożowe z wyraźnymi, lekko kwaskowymi nutami cytrusowymi i rozgrzewającym, chmielowym, grejpfrutowo goryczkowym finiszem.
33 cl bottle @ Mondada, Gent. Very sweet, fruity aroma, mildly bitter aftertase. Good trappist beer.
kolor bardzo jasny,wrecz bialozolty,piana biala,opada blyskawicznie oblepiajac kufel,w zapachu cytrusy,slod,w smaku rowniez cytrusy,dosc dobrze czuc chmielowa goryczke,

12oz into chalice. Pours a very slightly opaque golden colour, thick fluffy white head, lively carbonation, some sediment. Light hop and moderately fruity aroma; tangy flavour of light citrus, slight bitter astringency in the finish. Not as stellar as I remember, but still a very pleasant beer.
Bottle at work. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is fruity, boozy, citrusy, bit sourish. Taste is medium sweet, malty, caramel, fruity, spicy, alcohol is present.

Botte from Hop City. Pours transparent orange with white head. Lots of chunky bits floating around. Aroma of booze and citrus. Tastes of citrus, booze, floral hops and lots of carbonation. I liked it.

Overall one of my favorite tripel beers. Deep yellow color with white foam. A little bit fruity and malty smell. Rounded, creamy tast, but strong. Leves the sweet and a little bit fruity taste. Strong but drinkable

Bottle dewsbury train station. Clear yellow, huge white head. Aroma is large leafy and grassy, a bit fruity. Taste is sweet and tangy, quite strong with a hum of alcohol. Medium body and carbonation. Good stuff.

Hazy amber gold with big fluffy head that sticks around and leaves nice lace. Perhaps as a result, the aroma is not pronounced, with grain and yeast predominating.
Up front bitterness relaxes into nice balance of bitter, yeast, sweet, bready and slight banana notes. Each take their solos without competing. Slight alcohol heat and bitterness returns for lingering finish. Medium body with creaminess.
This is how to showcase hops as bittering agents balanced with the other elements, not to beat your palate into submission. US brewers could learn a lot.
Appearance: pale, clear, frothy withe head, dissapears fast. Aroma: alcohol, some sweetness. Taste bitter, alcohol, medium sweet. Palate:medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter,

How: Bottle.
Where: Pressklubben.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a large white head.
Aroma: Fruit, malt, yeast, spices.
Body: Medium to full body, lively carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, spices, alcohol, malt.
I like belgian ones, this is very strong as for me. Good that this bottle is small!

Bottle - very hazy golden with a large clean rocky white head which lasts a good while. Good lacing. Aroma of cloves, yeast, lemon and orange. Taste of marzipan, clove, yeast and hay with a little earth and bitterness in the finish. Some light sourness to complement. Medium body, low carbonation.
Really nice amber colored beer with white foam. Tastes really flower-like, not too strong bit really nice.
Golden color with huge white head. Aroma is citrus, biscuity and booze. Taste is heavily sweet, dough and fruity. A very boozy finish. High carbonation. A Tripel on steroids.
Mijn favoriete tripel. Smaken perfect in balans : lichtzoete toetsen met perfect bittere afdronk. Bijhorend glas is het perfecte trappistenglas.
Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with generous head. Aroma of yellow fruits, cereal and a bit grassy. Taste is more of the same, but really well balanced, exquisite.

Hazy golden, big white fluffy head dissipates slowly leaving lots of lacings. Full aroma of grains, bread, yeast, slight sweetness. Taste is medium bitter with a perfect balance between yeastiness, bitterness, sweetness, some gum and banana, slight alcohol touch. Lingering finish. Medium body, low carbo with sharp bubbles. In terms of availability, prize and quality, this is hard to beat.

Great trappist beer. The last time this beer was extremely mouth twisting bitter. I dont know why, but this time it was great. The bitternes was perfectly in balance with the sweetness. Maybe this is because of the Corsendonk abbey Cheese I just had with extensive amounts of Dijon mustard. A great combo with bitter beers, I must say (the mustard). The beer is beautifully golden, clear and fizzy. Very nice tongue sensation. The foam is thick and perfectly white. The thick layer of foam disappears rather quick. A thin layer of foam remains till the last drop. The beer can surely be recommended to every lover of bitter high quality beers.

Bottle 330ml. Hazy golden-yellow with big bubbly off-white head. Sweetish fruity aroma (peach, apricot, citrus), yeasty with notes of candy. Sweet-sour flavor, fruity (peach, citrus), some spiciness, notes of black pepper, light bitterness, yeasty and very boozy. Lively carbonation, medium-bodied.

Barwa żółto-złota, mętna, spory osad drożdżowy na dnie butelki. Piana sycząca, sporych rozmiarów pęcherzyki, szybko opada do kożuszka. W aromacie przewaga owoców spod znaku brzoskwiń, moreli, jabłka, są nuty kwiatowe i dzikie, stajenne. Ogólnie dość intensywny, świeży i przyjemny aromat. Smak ściśle współgra z zapachem, wyraźna owocowość, ziołowość, lekka słodycz pochodząca od słodów, fajna kontra ziołowo-pieprznej goryczki, minimalna cierpkość. Czuć też alkohol, nie jest on jakiś nieprzyjemny, ale wyczuwalny, kojarzący się z winem. 
Tripel prima sort. Przede wszystkim bardzo zbalansowany, dość treściwy, mocny, jednak zdecydowana owocowość i stosunkowo wysokie nagazowanie nadaje mu fajnej pijalności. Piwo warte swojej renomy.

Tippling a Tripel is totally a treat but this one, although tasty, was not a favourite. Rather a pretty fair blonde with yeast in suspension, the meringue-like peaks remind you where they have been the whole way down. Heavy scents of honey, hay, white wine, coriander and black pepper take shape in the taste as well. A strong boozy flavour, propelled by the dry body and feisty carbnation, is very present, not entirely unwelcome but ever noticeable. This beers strength lies in the crisp, spiced fruit notes that forgive the alcohol heat.
UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 Super lækker trappist-øl fra Westmalle. Dejlig smag. Flot og fyldig.God aroma.

A great trappist tripel. Hazy, rusty orange pour with a white fizzy head that didn?t last too long. Has a very sharp aroma of yeast. Initial flavour is bitter with alcohol heat, which fades into earthy flavours of yeast, orange & lemon zest, bananas, coriander, spices, herbs, bread, and some grassy, almost hay-like notes.
Gran aroma, espuma muy consistente, una cerveza de sabor intenso a la vez que refrescante una cerveza altamente recomendable
bread, hay, citrus, herbs,banana, pale, golden, hazy, frothy, lightly bitter, full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

WYGLĄD: Barwa złote, klarowne z niewielkimi "drobinkami". Piana obfita, wysoka, trwała i drobna, zdobi szkło (lacing)
AROMAT: Uderzenie słodkich dojrzałych bananów, morela, rodzynki, guma balonowa, rześkie chmielowe aromaty, ziołowość, przyprawy (laski wanilii).
SMAK: Przede wszystkim dużo ziół i przypraw z przewagą tych pierwszych. Bardzo dobra kontra słodowa łagodzi smak. Na finiszu wyczuwam gumę balonową i "chleb". Goryczka alkoholowa - średnia do wysokiej, zalegająca.
OGÓLNIE: Znakomicie ułożone, pomimo, że to konkretne piwo jest stosunkowo "młode". Na uznanie właściwie zasługuję w tym piwie wszystko, od aromatu, przez smak, aż po wygląd (świetna piana) Powiem krótko: znają się na rzeczy! <!UWAGA! nalewane bez osadu z dna butelki>

Le birre trappiste sono imperdibili, e le Westmalle, prodotte nellomonima abbazia belga, lo sono senza dubbio. Questa tripel può tranquillamente fare da portabandiera allo stile. Si presenta biondo scuro, vicino allarancio, abbastanza torbida e con una bella schiuma bianca di media persistenza e compattezza. I malti la fanno da padrona, riempendo il naso di splendidi odori. Le spezie sono più evidenti assaggiandola, accompagnando il dolce, con punte di caramello e un perfetto finale più amaro e composto a chiudere un grande equilibrio. Lalcool è ben evidente.

Hazy gold with THICK head.
Smell of banana strong, citrus light.
Medium bodied but very malty.
Sweet and bitter palate.

Bottle. Golden hazy with three fingers of thick white head. Aroma is lemon, light sweetness, and green apple. Taste is spices, lemon, and light bitterness, finishes dry and bitter with a lingering spice aftertaste. Really nice, very well balanced with a nice amount of spice and light citrus bitterness, no hint from the booze either.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2015 Pours a clear pale golden with a frothy white head that has great retention. Aroma is dry and floral with straw, ripe apples, sourdough and yeast. Medium body, creamy feel, medium carbonation. Taste starts off soft but quickly freshens up with citrus, clove and grains. Long lasting astringent finish.

Pours a slightly hazy pale golden color, topped with a very generous white frothy head. Malty aroma, quite fruity with some spices present. A bit yeasty as well. Malty and fruity at first, strong taste and noticeable alcohol. Theres some yeast to be picked up as well. Bittery finish. Not for me.

Aroma is citric, bready, dry. With aromas of pineapple, peach, lemongrass. Flavor is amazing. Dry and effervescent, lemon, orangepeel, bread. In the finish i get some slight herbal notes as well as the candisugar. This is one hell of a beer. Amazingly well balanced. No boozyness what so ever, even though its 9,5%.

2/3 - Monks Pub (Downtown Chicago). I enjoyed this bottled beer, but I typically prefer draft beer. The look and smell were somewhat neutral. I like the taste, not as heavy or strong as I expected, but a pleasant beer to drink. I like this beer and would like to find a draft version at some point down the road.

Bottle. Yellow, slight haze, large head. Aroma: Spices, banana, yeast, alcohol, fruity esters. The taste is very nice, some spicyness and a slight hint of banana, definitely fruity touch with a nicely balanced dry finish. Very well balanced. Its extremely drinkable, even a little refreshing, for such a strong beer.
Bottle. Very nice trippel. pale, golden, minimal head. Very fresh taste. Flowers and sunny meadow. Very Well
Does drink every bit as strong as its ABV suggest. Spicy on the tip of the tongue from alcohol strength. Bottle conditioned so keep upright if youre not a yeast eater. Distinctively Belgian.
It pours pale, with a soft balanced white head which remains for long. Also, it smells citric and sweet, with a nice soft taste. Good trappist.

Ibeer with a fruity smell and a beautiful, nuanced hop scent. It is soft and creamy in the mouth, with a bitter touch carried by the fruit aroma. An exceptional beer, with lots of finesse and elegance. And with a lovely long finish.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2015 Smell of lemon and honey (8/10), deep golden colour with LOT of foam (4/5), Strong taste, bitter (8/10), strong body, with a bitter creamy ending (4/5). Even if the whole story about the Trappists beers can probably affect my judgment, it is a fantastic beer, those monks know what theyre doing.
330ml bottle. Pours hazy, straw yellow with a light white head. Yeasty, banana aroma. Smooth, fruity taste with a surprising tart finish
Cloudy golden color with tall white head, aromas of fruit (banana) and spices. In mouth, creamy feel, taste of fruit and pepper. The alcohol is also dominant in mouth. Good beer.
Bardzo przyjemny s?odowo kwiatowy aromat. Mocno nagazowane co przykrywa alkohol. Po ogrzaniu do g?osu dochodz? nuty typowo belgijskie.
330ml bottle brought by hand (bike!) to Germany from Belgium by work colleagues (thanks!). Been a while since Ive had this one. Creamy and spicy, Lots of fruitiness.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2015 Served in a trappist glass. Yellow with a big persistent white head. Aroma is yeast, syrup, bubblegum, bananas, peaches and apricot. Taste is yeast, strong alcohol presence, peaches, bananas, bubblegum and bread. Sweet, spicy and alcoholic finish, with a strange resinous bitterness. Not so good.

In bottle. White, frothy head. Persistent. Golden yellow, fairly cloudy. Fairly intense and persistent at nose. Honey, yellow fruit, fruit in syrup, candy sugar, a hint of clove, Full body, alcool at nose and in the mouth. Sweet entry, a balancing bitter lingers.

Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist Westmalle glass; from the fridge.

Good beer, with a nice deep aroma and taste, as well as a very good palate. The trappist yeast doesnt overhelmed the taste, which is more like bitter-sweet.

Great beer !
Amarelo dourado. Turva e boa carbonatação. Aroma de frutas brancas, abacaxi, banana, alcoólica, noz moscada. Médio amargor, com aftertaste seco e picante. Uma das melhores trapistas.
How: Bottle Appearance: hazy golden, medium head Aroma: fruits, spice, citrus, honey. Palate: medium body, lively carbonation, bittersweet finish.

11/01/2015 - 33cl bottle @ family reunion.
Clear yellow with white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, spices, yeast. Taste is tropical fruits, spices, some sweetness, alcohol.

Hazy yellow with a few flakes of sediment floating around in suspension. Hint of orange. An inch of off-white head, moderate coarseness, moderate rate of decay. Aroma is gooey bakers dough, light banana and apple, touch of sugar, and toasted scone. Body is medium-to-medium-light, slightly syrupy, Medium-heavy carbonation that fills the mouth like a big cotton ball. Flavor is white wheat, apple, hint of banana and blackberry. Hint of honey. Hint of lemon, light herbal brush on a hot day, and a medium-light leafy bitterness that actually lingers a surprising amount given that this is a Belgian style. Biscuit. Slight candy as well. A very nice Trappist. The aroma is delicious, the flavor very good. The body s bit syrupy and a carbonation which suffocates a bit. Biscuit flavors bloom as it warms. The finish is OK. Nice tripel. I wish it was a bit more crisp.

Pours a light golden color with a white head. Fruit, spice, yeast, clove and malt aroma. Spice, pear, apple, clove, wheat, yeast and malt flavors. Light body and lively carbonation. Fruit and spice finish.

Pours a cloudy golden yellow with an abundant foamy white head. Aroma is white bread/sourdough, cereal grain, banana, apricot candy, lemon, clove, green apple, and soft floral. Great fruity complexity. Taste is bread, a bit of cereal, bubblegum, yeast, medium bitterness, a bit floral, some fruit (soft stone fruit - apricot?), and some clove. Specific flavors of the fruitiness are more vague than in the aroma. Foamy, fizzy, mouth filling carbonation, medium body. Finishes dry.

Robe or, reflets ambrés. Nez puissant sur des notes de houblon, de levure, de malt et dépices. Bouche à lattaque ample, très belle bulle crémeuse, et très longue finale droite et nette sur un belle amertume de houblon. Un bière dune longueur impressionnante.

Hazy yellow pour, some particles, nice white head with some lace. Nose is tropical fruit, Belgian yeast, light roasted grain. Bitter. Middle is abundant; creamy/chewy light roasted grain, earthy hops, slight alcohol, candi sugar, perfectly ripe honeydew. Finish is bittersweet, with a slightly hoppy flourish. Yum.

This is the best of the Trappists beers that Ive tried. It is very consistent. This amber brown mixture is generously heady and sparkling with just the right amount of fizz- not all punk-like but rather solid and mellow. I find the texture quite smooth and the taste lightly sweet with a medium hint of caramel. What is surprising it that the brew ebbs away from the other characteristics of Trappists beers with their certain presence of bitter hops. I appreciate that this brew is refreshing, and lovely in its essence. The slightly caramel and apricot taste on my tongue feels great.

Bottle - pours a highly carbonated copper with medium head. Nose if yeast and roasted malt. Taste is syrupy malt, spice, and yeast. Solid beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bottle. Fizzy, effervescent golden. Aroma is raisin, plum, light yeast, and candi sugar. Taste is similar to aroma, but with some light spice, prune, fig, and a touch of booze. Sparkly mouthfeel and lingering sweet warming and a hint of bitterness.

Hazy golden color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, hops, clove, & spice; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, fruit, hops, spice, and some citrus; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced & complex; Excellent tripel.

Bottle with BBE 1/2016. Pours clear yellow with a lively carbonation and a small white head. Nose has apple, citrus and the familiar belgian yeasty aroma. Licorice, spices and a bit of herbal hops with a bitter and sour taste. Overall a superb trappist that is certainly better at 1 year than fresh.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 (przeprowadzka z excela: 2014-08-04, Butelka). Zasadnicza rozniaca (wieksza niz w innych piwach) w kontekscie temperatury. Zimne (pewnie z 8C) bardzo nijakie zarowno w aromacie jak i w smaku. Po lekkim ogrzaniu w aromacie fajne slody, owoce (glownie banany, brzoskwinie). W smaku bardzo triplowato. Update 13 marca - pod mosteczkiem - w dobrej temperaturze zaserwowane, duzo bogatsze niz wynikaloby z wczesniejszego wpisu, brzoskwinie, banany, morele - bardzo owocowe - przyprawowosc delikatna, guma balonowa... wyczuwalne drozdze, sa tez nuty ziolowe stosunkowo intensywne... skomponowany ten bukiet i smak super.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
11.2 Fl OZ ($5.29) a bit too much alcohol in the nose and taste but still a great beer. this one lets you know youre gonna be drunk.
@ Kadinsky Café in Amsterdam. Pours haxy amber with rocky white head. Aroma is fruity. Notes of bread, citrus, and hops, finishes dry. Great tripel!
It is my Friend on Sunday night... Gold color, intense taste , a perfect drinking experience

Bottle from Katsuragawa Aeon. Cloudy pale gold with a frothy white head. Aroma is full of apple and spice with some peach and citrus. Carbonated mouthfeel with sweet apple balanced with yeast and a touch of spice. Unbelievable that its 9.5%.

Ljust halmgul med från början stor sedan liten ihållande krona. Aromen mycket frisk frukt med "Champis"-känsla. Smaken frukt, koriander, kryddor med lite banan. Eftersmaken tämligen torr med ihållande frukt- och jästsmak. Lugnt kolsyrad.

Pours a bright amber, rather opaque, with a thin white head that dissipates into a ring. Aromas of apple, grape and citrus. Rather sour hoppy taste, with nuances of alcohol peeking through. Low-medium carbonation. Quite nice.

750ml bootle with good aroma and flavour.
Nice head but not lasting longer.
Great taste without any alcohol feeling.
Classy beer with perfect balance.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2015 Westmalle tripel uitgeschonken in 25cl Westmalle Trappist bierglas. Mooie licht mistige goudgele kleur, met stevige witte schuimkraag. Veel kleine belletjes in het bierglas, ziet er smakelijk uit! De geur is Belgische gist en licht fruitig. De smaak is krachtig met tonen van gerstemout, banaan en kruidnagel, met aangenaam bittere hop smaak. Deze Westmalle is minder kruidig en zoet dan veel andere Belgische tripels. Het alcohol percentage van 9,5% is telkens duidelijk aanwezig in deze Westmalle tripel. De smaak wordt sterk gedragen door de gerstemout, en de hopbellen. De afdronk is lang en aangenaam droog en bitter. Door de eenvoud en krachtige smaak is de Westmalle tripel zeker een van de beste Belgische tripel bieren, een echte klassieker!

Ambrée orangée, légèrement voilée. Mousse blanche bien persistante, lacings.
Aromatique citrus, petite acidité perceptible. Sucrée-caramel. Levures belges. Epicée coriandre. 
En bouche gros caractère de levures, avec petite acidité. Sinon belle balance caramel-amertume. Alcool peu perceptible. Fin de bouche épicée et légèrement amère. Alcool toujours très peu perceptible.
Gros corps avec une petite carbonatation. 
Bière très complexe, grosse longueur. Mon Abbey Tripel préférée je dirais pour linstant... :)

Bottle. Hazy amber-yellow colour with a persistent white head. The aroma is spicy, yeasty, almost more saison-like. The flavour, however, is entirely Tripel--a wonderful mix of spice and yeast, caramel, fudge, delicate honey. Smooth with a distinct bitter and yeast final.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2015 Westmalle makes great ales.  The tripel is readily available and of high quality.  Appearance is exceptional -2 or 3 finger head with tight carbonation and long lasting.  Aroma is distinctly hoppy with some sweet notes.  As you get down the glass hops fade and other flavors dominate.  Taste is complex, because it is a mix of many subtle flavors.  A bit of malt, but more hops, citrus.  As i get into it i also get sweetness of what i think is banana.  Very dry and bitter aftertaste. palate is creamy ans very smooth-  no burn what so ever even at 9.5%abv.   Overall its a great ale-  not my favorite as its a bit hoppy in smell and taste gor my liking,  but it is an accomplished beer for sure.

35 cl bottle. Cloudy yellow color with a big rocky solid white head, lots of lacing.
Quiet nose, hints of white wine. Aroma is white grapes, wine (spumante/champagne), apple, cider with spicy belgian yeast. Resins maybe, while yeast has a major role, other fruity esters as it warms uo. Taste is moderately bitter, crisp. Texture is dusty, sustained carbonation Finish is extra dry, spiced, fairly long, warming. High ABV gives a grappa-like aftertaste
Not a fan of appleysh beers, this is a solid tripel.
Deilig, kompleks og sammensatt aroma av honning og banan. Herlig, kremete og fyldig munnfølelse med god sødme og friskhet. Lang, smaksrik ettersmak. Super til pinnekjøtt.
0.33 flaske. Gyllen uklar med flott hvit skum. Aroma fruktig og gjær. Smak av gjær frukt antydning til krydder. Frisk. Medium co2
Cerveja Trapista clássica, sabor marcante, boa drincabilidade. Ótima pedida pra quem quer saborear uma autentica trapista!!
33cl bottle. 不透明的金黃
Bottle shared with Hakesnap, hazy cloudy orange pour with thin white head, fruity aroma, taste taste is nice clean good belgium
No the most profound of the Trappists but still a very enjoyable tripel. Lots of fruit in the nose, taste is well balanced with a long buttery finish. Good beer to drink once in a while.
Somehow common taste but none the less very enjoyable, lacks a bit of body maybe, will drink again.

11.2 oz. bottle from Party Time in Spearfish. Appearance: 2 fingers white head that lasts only as a film, straw gold to orange gold, cloudy. Aroma: fruity esters, light leather, Palate: medium body, average carbonation, light alcoholic warming, sort of thin alcoholic texture. Taste: sweet fruitiness, into a nicer, fuller malty sweetness, with some alcoholic notes towards the end. Overall, amazing tripel, love the balance, tastes are really nice, very good.
Well belanced aroma and taste with mature yellow fruit, gentle caramel malts and passito.
UPDATED: DEC 18, 2014 0,33 cl bottle pours a troubled yellow beer. Yeasty sour sweet taste and a alcohol feeling. Westmalle does it again! Yea yaw!
Mooi blond biertje, uitdagende geur. Smaak is mooi zacht, lekkere ronde zoete smaak zonder dat het een te zoete ondertoon heeft. Heerlijk !

Bottle. Golden color with a thick white head. Aroma has yeast, sour fruits, spices and some hops. Taste is a bit sour with very long nice aftertaste. High carbonated. Flavors of spices, fruits, hops, yeast and some alcohol warmth in the end. Smooth and strong nice beer.

Poured from bottle into tulip glass. Medium head, cloudy pale yellow in color. Very slight fruity scent. Smooth finish belies the potent 9.5% ABV content. Deliciously deceptive.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

1pt 9.4oz corked bottle. Golden yellow cloudy color with frilly lace head that reduces quickly. Strong aroma of alcohol, slight sweetness and hops. Full mouthfeel and sting bitter aftertaste that clears quickly. High alcohol content (since it's a tripel) means your tongue will go numb but you won't care cause it's so tasty. You could say it's like the IPA of Belgian tripels.
Slightly cloudy with a good creamy head. Sweet tasting with a bitter after taste. Nice lacing around the glass as the beer went down.

Second beer with dinner at the only real steakhouse in Nieuw Vennep. Wet and slightly spicy. Big and sneaky. But not too sneaky. Went very well with the beef sirloin. For a beer so big, it truly is subtle. I had to be careful decending the tight spiral stairs from the old mill after finishing desert.
UPDATED: DEC 14, 2014 330cc bottle. Pours golden and cloudy with a foamy white head. It is a bit hoppy but mostly fruity and spicy. You can taste the alcohol. Fills nicely the mouth. Great beer.
Gold pour, nice foamy white head. Aroma is bananas, cloves and yeast. Flavor is banana, yeast, dates, raisins, and alcohol.
Hazy yellow color, small white head. Sweet bubblegum aroma. Medium sourness and sweetness. Medium body, average carbonation. Sweet finish. Heavily overrated, if you ask me. (Svije Piva 0,33l bottle)

APPEARANCE - Clear golden with a 2-finger head that dissipates. Great lacing.

AROMA/SCENT - A little sweet, herbaceous.

TASTE - A balance of bitter and sweet, herbaceous notes. Floral. Not overly boozy.

MOUTHFEEL/PALATE/TEXTURE - Good carbonation. Light, not gooey.

VALUE - A bit high.

OVERALL/DRINKABILITY - Nice beer, goes down easy.

First short-lived bubblegum aroma escaping upon opening the bottle. When poured in a stemmed glass it boasts its abundant white top. This head is made of rather large bubbles. Nose is filled by its malt slash bubblegum aroma. Smart tip: men, (or elderly women), grow a moustache and enjoy its fizzy embrace when those bubbles pass away in a last good bye kiss. This is probably the beer Ive ordered most frequently during the last decade. Its been consistent with its taste. Always delivering this strong flavor. I guess its thanks to this beer and a couple others that I got into beers.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2014 A very good tripel trappist. Nothing to say about it, but to me it lacks some complexity, its a very strong, straightforward beer. The colour is a quite golden and is very clear, it is very sparkling and well balanced, maybe a bit heavy on the alcohol content "realfeel".

The Belgian-style Tripel Ale is one of my favorite beer styles, and believe it or not, I actually have never had Westmalle Tripel before now. It receives rave reviews and many consider it the best of the style. I wouldnt go that far, though I can definitely see how people would come to that consensus. Its classic Trappist all the way and definitely epitomizes the style. It is not quite the best-ever example of it, however.

I poured an 11.2oz bottle into a Trappist chalice. It had a best before date of 12/12/15 and cost $6.29 ($0.56 per ounce).

Appearance: Pale orange/golden hue over a hazy body. Spastic carbonation is visible and it never settles down. Pours to a two-finger, white, soapy head which never dissipates and leaves plenty of lacing.

Smell: Potent aroma of white grape, or even white wine per se. Not much in the way of spice or banana, though.

Taste: You know youre drinking an authentic Trappist brew when the beer lights up your tongue with a spicy sensation immediately. Though it smells of white grape, Westmalle Tripel tastes more of pepper, flaked maize, and a hint of banana (though none of those ingredients are actually in there  its all yeast esters). A slight juicy sensation through the middle, followed by candy-like sensation of butterscotch and caramel (and no, its not diacetyl). I was hoping for banana and citrus flavors, but they didnt seem to appear. Its not so much bitter per se as it is spicy, though its a pleasant despite being rather intense. Id be curious to try a fresher vintage since this style doesnt usually improve with age. An older bottle, at the very least, is still going to deliver for the style, though.

Drinkability: If you want a beer with a truly intense carbonation mouthfeel, youll find it in a Trappist brew. Westmalle Tripel doesnt have a viscous mouthfeel, though it has enough intense micro carbonation to really give it some presence on the tongue. At 9.5% ABV theres some mild warming sensation, though its easily tolerable. Its one of the driest beers I can recall, as the peppery character seems to suck all the moisture out of the mouth as it goes down. Some carbonation tends to get caught in the throat, but thats to be expected.

Very hazy yellow colour. Aroma...not very specific, light fruits, more pear than citrus. My bottle had (maybe) proteins released (or quite big yeast pieces?). Bought 8 months before best before date...I do not know the production date = how fresh this bottle is. Full body taste. Fruits and malts. Not bitter. Alcohol well hidden.
white longlasting head. golden color, light haziness. fruity sour smell. smells of alcohol, banana and bitter almond. taste is bitter, (warming) alcohol apparent, has a light tobacco taste.
UPDATED: APR 15, 2015 Bottle. Big white head, stays nice on the glass. In aroma herbs, yeast, bananas,  fruits and alcohol. In taste wheat malt and warming alcohol. Great beer.
Orange im Glas, viel weißer Schaum, fruchtig alkoholisch in der Nase, süßlich malziger Geschmack, leicht sauer, schön wärmend
Lovely tripel. Yeasty, spicy, esthery, refreshing and fullfililng. Classic.
Not a spectaculair Tripel but a descent one. Can advise this one to anyone that wants to try out a Tripel but not a really 'heavy' one

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2015 11-month old 330 ml bottle best before 30-01-2015. Pours a cloudy golden colour with lots of particulate matter floating in the glass. Tight white head. Nose is grapefruit and fresh orange juice with a bit of peppery hops and funk. Taste is yeasty, bitter grapefruit, herbal/spicy hops and a slightly tart finish. Where is the booze?

Update: enjoying a 2-year old bottle and seems to have more of a bready malt character which I am not  loving. Prefer fresh.

330 ml bottle. Hazy yellow golden with big fluffy white head. Smell is yeast, alcohol, banana and spices. Taste is spicy with banana and coriander, a little wheat malt taste and a warm alcohol finish. Semi sweet with low bitterness and medium carbonation.

Rich head, clear golden colour.
slightly yeasty nose, rich spicy, notes of pepper, yeast, a lasting finish 
A true classic.
Bottle. Very good,stable white head. In aroma fruits, herbs, some alcoholic notes. In taste is fruity, alcoholic, creamy. Nice golden colour.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2015 Westmalle triple! Definitely one of the best beers in the world! Golden appearance with pure, earthy, grainy taste. This is a truly legendary beer which ensures lots of pleasure for every consumer!
330ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours hazy golden with a thin white head. Aroma is earthy, spicy, bread, yeast and fruit. Sweet finish with warming alcohol. Great stuff.
Pours beautiful sparkling gold with good fluffy head. Fruity nose. Smooth and creamy with high carbonation. Spicy flavour followed up by lingering bitterness. Slight warm alcohol flavours. Very good
330ml bottle from Congress, Longton. Pours amber with white froth. Spicy with a good hop presence. Easy drinking for its strength. It has the "feel".
Una triple molto ben equilibrata. Alcolica al punto giusto, gradevole alla vista, ottima al palato come pure al naso
Yellowish, mildly cloudy, nice white head. Banana, toffee, in the aroma. Malt, caramel, banana, fruit with a sweet caramel bitterness in the aftertaste. A really nice beer.

0,33 bottle from Svijet Piva. Pours cloudy yellow with small white head. Yeasty aroma with some spices, some fruit. Medium carbonated. A bit sourish at first, but looses it til the end. I understand this is high quality beer, but it doesnt suit me as good.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2016 0.33l bottle. Cloudy golden color with lasting white head. Aroma of yeast, fruits, somewhat perfumy and spices. Alcohol is present, but it fits beautifully. Taste is sweet and little bitter. Alcohol stays in finish and it is really pleasant.

Bottle from Torst, Brooklyn. Pours a hazy yellow with a creamy white head that lasts. Superb lacing clinging to the glass. Nose has Belgium yeast, spices, cloves and some booze. Smells like a big beer. Taste is plums, raisins, cloves and spices. Creamy mouthfeel and low carbonation. Alcohol creeps as it warms. Overall a pretty solid beer.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with huge lasting cramy white head. Aroma is loads of Belgian yeast. Both spicy and very estery. Some ripe fruites, but some alcohol. Taste is sweet and yeasty. Creamy carbonation, medium body and long spicy finish. Sadly there is a present warming alcohol on the back tongue.
Art in a bottle! A broad range of fruity character here with a nice spicy edge to it. Hops present in character of this beer. Alcohol is present but well integrated. Always a pleasure, this one!

Best abbey tripel IMO. Poors hazy with a golden-orange colour. White head. Lovely aroma of hops, spicy and citrus. Beautiful complex, but perfectly balanced taste: spicy, sweet malts, plum, raison, orange, cream. Dry subtle bitterness - alcohol perfectly hidden. - Worldclass tripel

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2014 0,33 l bottle from Westmalle chalice at "De Pannekoekenbakker" in Maaseik, B. Clear yellow-golden with white head which fades quickly. Spicy aroma of banana and vanilla. Fruity taste of banana, vanilla, caramel and lemon. Creamy mouthfeel, low carbonation, medium-bodied. Nice hoppy aftertaste. Overall a really nice beer which is amongst the best in its style. I still prefer the Dubbel.

Trappists just seems to not be my table at all. Both aroma and taste is filled with bubblegum and esters reminding me of hefe weizens, but without the smoothness that style has. It´s just to sweet and complex for me i guess.
Bottle from SB.

Beautiful hazy orange color, medium-sized white head. Aroma of hops, grapefruit, ginger, Tokaji 3-puttonyos. You can feel the alcohol in the taste, but in a really beautiful way, it puts itself forward sweetly, then hits you with some sour overnotes and leaves a mildly bitter feeling on the palate. Lots of ginger, lime and white bread on the palate. Realy a fantastic beer, I just love Belgian tripels.

Bottle. Pours cloudy Amber with a rich White head. Spicy yeasty character. Peppery with a bit of wheaty banana and a pretty pronounced wack of booze. Decent wedge of sweet maltiness. Pretty high grade tripel. Its good that its so readily available.
Very strong brew with a hop-forward profile and complex but mild aromas and flavors. Not for the faint of heart as alcohol presence is strong, yet never tasted. Intriguing.
Gulbrun tåkete med lavt hvitt skum. Lukter korn og syrlige epler. Bitter besk smak, gjær og blomster. Medium kullsyre. Sitter igjen med bitter smak i munnen.

bottle from mane liquor. Pours a pale cloudy yellow, with a prominent white head. Ripe stonefruit and raisin backed up by a big hit of booze and a lingering lolly banana taste. Booze hangs around in the back like rolf harris at a school assembly.
Pours cloudy gold with low head. Great lacing. Aromas of tropical fruit with sweet taste. Beautiful.

Poured from bottle, pale hazy gold with low head. Aroma light with notes of spices and herbs. Taste is wonderfully complex, full with notes of dried fruit, spices and honey, ending in sweet bitterness. Great beer!
Full of flavour. Smooth. A hint of bitterness in the finish. This is without doubt a memorable beer. A world classic.

Fľaa. Tmavia zlatá farba, biela pena, rýchlo padla. Vôňa medu, citrusových plodov, jemne pikantnosť, korenie. V chuti sa najskôr miea sladkosť medu, s citrusovými tónmi. Neskôr cítiť jemnú horkosť a kyselkavosť. Táto chuť trvá veľmi dlho. Telo má veľmi hutné, s vyou nasýtenosťou. Cítiť dosť aj alkohol.

330ml bottle, pours clear golden, well carbonated with a large foamy white head. Caramel malt, sweet to start, spicy, banana, bubblegum, floral & grassy hop flavour leading into a deep and long bitter finish. medium sweetness, very bitter, light body, thin feel, lively carbonation.

"looked fairly typical for the style...effervescent, yellow...foamed heavily upon oppening as well. the aroma was spicy and alcoholic, and the flavor was also spicy and a little astringent - it could be that it got a bit oxidized, but the dubble foamed too, and was just not as harsh in the nose or on the palate. champagne like body with a spicy yeast, dry finish. ive had better. weakest (least liked) beer of the night."

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2014 330ml bottle served in its own chalice.
A: Pale yellow hazy color. Huge white fluffy head with good retention and many many lacing left. Many particles floating around and in bottom of the glass. 
S: Complex. Very spicy and citrus. Orange zest, honey, vanilla, apples. Sweet with light notes of alcohol. Classic bready Belgian yeasts. Bubblegum! Sweet malts and flowery hops
T: Complex as the nose. Very spicy. Sweet malts upfront followed by a stingy hops bitterness. BTW, wonderful bitterness. Fresh malts and citrus hops. Orange zest, vanilla and liquor. In overall, despite of the fruity and sweet upfront, its taste is quite dry and bitter. Just perfect
M: Heavy creamy body and low carbonation. Dry bitter aftertaste and presence of alcohol
O: A world class beer, no more, no less. Expected Trappist quality. Mandatory to beer lovers
[ BA Review @ 1/19/2010 ]

Alcoholpercentage van 9,5%
Uitgeschonken in Westmalle glas

Uiterlijk: goudoranje kleurig met redelijke schuimkraag

Westmalle produces a great beer. Clean and easy to drink. Love this brewery!
Not familiar with Trappes beers. Great flavour dont notice the high alcohol content.
Mocne wyrazisty browar o mętnej barwie zbliżonejdo piw przenicznych. Bogactwo naturalnych armoantów i smaków.
Licht geel bier met schuim. Smaak is krachtig, licht zuur en licht bitter, fruit en banaan. Erg goed.
33 cl från klostret. Drack denna hemma hos Anneli och Robin. Blev inte helt imponerad mest pågrund av jäst smaken.

Piana biała, średnio pęcherzykowa, zostawia obrączkę na szkle. Barwa jasnego złota, mocno zmętnione. W aromacie to czego już chwilę chciałem spróbować. Dzikie drożdże :D oprócz tego aromat świeżo ściętego zboża i ziół. W smaku słód, drożdże, lekki miód i pieprz. Po chwili pokazuje się wyraźny i mocny alkohol który jednak nie przeszkadza a uzupełnia tamte smaki. Lekka ziołowa goryczka. Lekko wysycone.
Bottle, The Butterfly, Brussels. Bitter-sweet, malty, hints of fresh bread (yeast). Full-bodied, quite corresponding with the high ABV (9.5%). Leaves lingering, pleasant hoppy after-taste.

33CL bottle at Cirio, Brussels. Lovely blonde colour as would be expected from a tripel, theres a very strong spicyness to this beer (probably cloves) mixed with orange which is not to my taste but not a bad beer.

Bottle BBE: 21/12/13 (Aged for 3+ years). Lightly chilled. Hazy golden body with an impressive, rigid, tight white head. Vinous aromas of plum, ripe cherry and raisin. Remarkably complex with the merest hint of sweetness. Dry, but only a gentle bitterness. Bit of an alcohol kick, but no burn. Full, creamy body, with low-medium carbonation. Incredibly long lasting herbal and spicy finish.
Bottle 0.33l at Hard Rock Cafe Brussels Belgium.Pour it hazy yellow color with medium white head.Taste of malt, tropical fruits, floral and Belgian yeast.Perfect what to say.Excellent.
UPDATED: FEB 5, 2015 Consistent, creamy head. Golden. Fruity aroma. Lightly hopped taste but without bitterness. This is the real deal.
Large head, nice light yellow color. Aroma of banana. Fully body, lively carbonation. Bitter, rich taste.
Pours pale golden brown with a medium big white foam. Nose is cytrus, alcohol  and hops. Taste is hoppy with a bitter finish and some yeast.

Robe d'un blond doré intense et mousse abondante
Complexe et oscillant entre arômes de houblon et de levure

Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en El Corte Ingles. Color ambar claro. Sabor a levadura, dulce, afrutado, ligeramente a malta, alcohol.

This rich but light with an orange zest aroma, strong clove taste & long bitter finish. Strong white head to the end.

Smooth creamy taste. Complex and hoppy with Carmel flavor. Great beer would recommend

Hazy orange colour, with an off-white head.
This beer has got to have the best smell out of any beer Ive tasted, with lovely complex aromas of marzipan, raisins, dough and vanilla. Taste isnt as good as the smell, I would rather say watery, with some fruit and spices. Medium body, medium carbonation.
750 ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with a nice white head. Aromas of Belgian yeast, banana, spice, light herbal. Medium bodied, complex and delicious
33cl bottle. Hazy golden color with quickly vanishing head. Spices and slight banana aroma. Taste is more spices. Warm finish. Hides the alcohol well. Nice beer.
Bottle from SuperBest Amar Foodmarket, Copenhagen - golden coloured pour with medium white head. Aroma and taste is medium sweet grassy and yeasty, citric lemon, nice spices.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours unclear, hazy orange with quickly vanishing off-white head. Bit disappointed at this point, but... Wonderful rich aroma of wheat, yeast, rich and intriguing spiciness. Dried fruits, hay, grass, juicelike apples and pears, lemon acidity and herbal notes. Taste, oh well, yeasty, fruity and citrus dominated. In-between of spices, malts, banana, apples, pears, apricot, cloves, hops. Warms as the booze, alcoholic middle and end kicks in. Full body, warm alcoholic, medium-high lively carbonated.

Bottiglia, colore ambrato chiaro abbastanza torbido con una schiuma fine e persistente. Aroma molto fruttato con un accenno di malto. Al palato è davvero ottima, apre dolce con malto e frutta per finire poi con una nota amara mai fastidiosa. Corpo medio con una carbonazione media. Ottima tripel insomma.
Smells wonderful. Very smooth. Raisins, vanilla, light booze. Finishes well on the palate. Very good.

firmly boozy, great and complex, bread, hay, cereal, nuts, floral, citrus, herbs, grass, resin, dough, cheese, alcohol, cooked vegetables, banana, clove, ginger, woody, golden, cloudy, rocky head, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, spicy, full body, creamy,

Clear yellow beer with a medium white head, medium carbonation, creamy texture
Smells fruity.
Taste is fruity with a nice bitter, yeast, warm alcoholic feeling.
Fruity bitter aftertaste, good Trapist triple.

Clear pale yellow with a rocky white foam. Spicy aroma with some lemon acidity and herbal notes. Nice sweet taste with some bitterness in the aftertaste. Lively carbonation with a slick mouth feel, nice body. The mother of them all still has it today
Cerveja saborosa ms com 9.5% de teor alcoolico. Forte mas não amarga. Saborosa e intensa.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 Trappist tripel. Orange, hazy with small and short head
Fruity aroma with some spicy notes.A slight vanilla and creamy hints are also felt.
In mouth, intense taste. It is sweet but with a goof bitterness which compensate it. The best of this beer.
Full body and warm alcoholic feeling. Lively carbonation with a fizzy feeling at the end.
Intense but nothing special.

Pours a nice golden color with an average head. Aroma is spicy, wheat, booze, rich toffee, dried fruit, hay, grass, pear. Taste is warm booze, banana, apple, caramel, grass, pear, apricot, clove. The flavors ride on the booze train. Overall a great beer, warmer in the booze than most but still fantastic.
UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Spicy white pepper, coriander and belgian yeast. Lemony lightness with a slight wheaty malt. Quite creamy and extremely tiny bubbles, lemony esters with white pepper character.
Rich bookeh of tastes, the right balance with hoops and taste. Perfect to taste in every situations. Strong after half glass.

From a bomber. West mallet pours a hazy golden body and makes a frothy, foamy head, so pour w caution! Not much on the aroma, perhaps a bit of citrus. Wonderfully bubbly! Tastes of lemon and yeast and malty goodness. A bit of bitter hop on the backside.
