Single bottle from W&M Mansfield. Poured into a tulip glass. A light honey color brew with a huge white head that stays around forever. Light sweet citrus-fruit and bready aromas. Flavor is wonderfully complex yet very easy drinking. Great yeast profile. Some fruity-citrus notes, some spice. Lingering dry finish. This is one of the standards - indeed!

Al heel veel jaren 1 van mijn favoriete trappisten. Mooi goudgeel bier met een witte kraag. Heerlijke frisse zoet-bittere smaak met wat citrus op de achtergrond. Drinkt heerlijk soepel, met een fruitige bittere nasmaak. Deze trappist kunnen ze mij altijd schenken!

330ml bottle @ home. Was in the mood for a classic and realised I hadnt rated yet. Fancy that. During my days in France I had at least one of these every weekend. It was pretty much the one beer I had all week, and the only beer I needed. Beautiful, classic tripel flavours with a warming bitterness on the finish. An outright classic.
Bottle 33 cl. Pours hazy golden with medium white head. Notes of spices, yeast, citrus, corriander. Dry spicy fruity finish. Very nice.
UPDATED: JAN 9, 2015 330ml bottle. Coudy pale amber colour with a small white head. Light malty aroma. Taste has spices, fruit and sweetness, with a bitter finish.

Bottle. Orange, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, white head. Aroma of yeast, must, grains, spices, dried fruits, candy, honey, alcohol. Taste with about the same aromas, great balance between sweet, spicy, bitter and dry. Mouthfeel is medium, creamy, with a strong carbonation and it finishes medium bitter, spicy, fruity and alcohol warming. Great! One of the best Tripels Ive ever had, totally worth the ratings! Perfectly balanced and although the alcohol is noticeable it still is very quaffable.

Heerlijk bier. De verfijnde en uitgebalanceerde smaak en het bouquet van fruitsmaken laten zich het best omschrijven met een dichtregel van Hiëronymus van Alphen: 'Jantje zag eens pruimen hangen, o! als eieren zo groot'
UPDATED: AUG 25, 2014 Dit is voor mij de cocaïne onder de bieren. Kick in the head. Niets meer, niets minder. Wel meer voor wat guurder weer. Mooie fles en volvette kruidige smaak.

Excellent Complex Trappist Ale, fruity aroma with hints of a grainy bread, poured a golden colour with a large white head lasted the whole drink hugging the glass, spicy fruity flavour with a lasting bitter aftertaste

Botella de 33 cl de el c. Ingles tomada en agosto de 1996 con fecha de cons pref para 01-06-1997. de las primeras belgas de compra, toda una sorpresa de sabores maltosos con cierto dulzor ligeros tonos afrutados y de especias para aquellos comienzos. Cuerpo medio con 9 vol que se notan en todo momento. Tomada varias veces mas, merece la pena darle otra oportunidad en cualquier momento. Bastante buena.
Dit is echt zoals een tripel hoort te zijn, een bier met een goede, uitgesproken smaak
Slightly hazy yellow/golden. Lots of spice (coriander?) with some pepper (seeds of paradise?). Light bodied. Dry finish. Great example of style.

Its taken me a while to get into tripels - my loss, I think. This is really good - cloudy amber with a good white head. Medium bodied and creamy. Not much aroma, and the initial taste is of spices mingling with the alcohol. Then peaches, golden syrup, pepper and more spice, with moderate bitter finish. Excellent.
Aroma wasnt there. Note of fruity spicy hops. Long lasting bitter sweet finish. good complex beer.

Bottle. Aroma is fresh baked white bread with hints of fruits and spices. Flavour is dry with a spicy bitterness, bready notes, soft citrus. Drier, spicier and less yeasty than most tripels. A top-notch Tripel and something a little different.
Bready and hopy beer. Good taste not the same aroma. Foam is very thin. The body is not as it was expected.

0,33 bottle purchased in Skopje (FYROM) and consumed in Kosovo in its original glass. Very cloudy golden color, frothy foamy head...white and creamy. The foam amazingly lasts very long, keeping its consistency. Some sediments in the bottle (very small) pour into the glass. The nose is delicate but complex: Belgian yeast all around, Sicilian citrus, floral notes. The first sip strikes the mouth with massiveness of cereals. Later on the Belgian yeast wraps up the palate until the final bitterness cleans the entire mouth up leaving a pleasant feel of dry, right on time to let the alcohol hit (it feels nice). A great tripel, which stays a step above many others of the same style.

This is one of the best Trappist! Excellent bouquet aroma, the color disturbed by the light, inviting foaminess on top. This beer is to be enjoyed by light fish sushi. It makes you think to convert to a Belgian monk!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A solid, airy head and a mild aroma, followed by a full, creamy taste and pleasantly bitter aftertaste. Quite complex beer that grows on me as the glass empties...

Comparing to other abbey tripels this one is sweeter and more malty. Wet grains on aroma and taste. Strong - 9,5% alc. Classic peachy honey flavours and bice warm alcohol feel on tongue. A bit darker (amber) than other tripels. Im not a big fan of this one.
Bottle. Bright golden cloudy with a big white head. Fruity, a lot of banana and some tropical fruit. Big strong taste bitter sweet that enda with a long bitterness.

Pale blonde color and cloudy. Aroma of citrus, hops, wheat, pine and banana. Funky taste. Fruity flavor balances out the bite of the hop, as well as the yeast from the alcohol. Another well disguised nearly double digit brew. Some sediment that freaked me out a bit. Biggest Ive ever seen. Hope it wasnt dirt from my glass...?

Bottle pour. Cloudy golden with large foamy white head. Bread and banana aroma. Thick and creamy. Sweet bread taste with a hoppy spice aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smells of spicy citrus. High carbonation. Very intriguing tripel Taste. Great for one glass before or after dinner. Fish would be great. High sugar

Bottle, 330 ml. Pours a cloudy straw colour with a small amount of soapy white head. Somewhat smokey initial hit on the nose, followed up by bready malts and then a big load of fruity notes, of which banana and citrus are most notable. Small floral hop presence too. Fruity notes hit first in the taste, the citrus coming through strongest over a wholemeal bread base, followed up by some unexpectedly potent floral and herbal hop notes, bringing quite a high degree of bitterness. Alcohol is well masked in both taste and smell. Texture is creamy enough but the carbonation is a bit too high and the body could be fuller, so this could have been a bit kinder on the palate, but the taste is most pleasant.

Rätt okej. Inte lika bra som en dubbel men denna slinker ner ganska lätt ändå 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Trappiste blonde à la superbe robe dorée. Un subtile équilibre entre amertume, arômes de fruits et de malt et de houblon en font un breuvage subtile adapté à toutes les circonstances.
Tot i que és una cervesa molt fàcil de empassar em va defraudar. Pot ser jo mesperava massa.

Sunset yellow, lots of white foam. Lovely citrus with a hint of yeast on the nose. Medium body. Fairly crispy carbonation. Just a little sweet and sour with some balanced grassy bitterness. Also notes of pepper and honey.
Bottle. hazy gold pour with a thin white head. Fruit, particularly banana, spice, Belgian yeast and alcohol in the aroma and taste. Delicious tripel.

Pours orange with a frothy, average lasting white head. Aroma is citrusy, with hints of bread and banana. Full bodied, creamy thick mouthfeel. Amazing alcohol masking. very carbonated, as usual in its style. Taste is deep, complex, amazingly balanced. Spices, yeast, orange, cookies. Ends with a mellowly sweet finish.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2015 33cl bottle poured in a De Dolle glass. Pours a cloudy, medium blonde colour with a generous cascading, white head. Aroma is powerfully fruity and yeast. Taste is more of the same with spiciness and slightly medicinally dry. A real classic and my favourite tripel that is true to the style. Fantastic.

Una grande birra, ma devo dire che mi aspettavo di più, data forse la sua fama. Laspetto è decisamente meraviglioso. Giallo oro torbido dalla schiuma bianchissima e persistente. Laroma è misto: si percepisce il maltato,il fruttato, ma anche un piacevole e delicato floreale. In bocca è un capolavoro...ma solo i primi sorsi. Si avvertono vari gusti, tutti in armonia tra loro: il maltato, il miele, il fruttato, ma anche del buono e inaspettato luppolo che li da molta classe e particolarità. Il guaio è che, man mano che la bevi, senti sempre più solo un sapore (quello del luppolo); un buon sapore, certo, ma mi è molto dispiaciuto che quella sinfonia si sapori iniziali scomparisse in questo modo. Anche il retrogusto cambia: man mano che la bevi diventa sempre più amaro. Il corpo è decisamente strutturato. Lalcool non lo senti durante la bevuta, ma alla fine ti presenta il conto. Peccato per questa involuzione: se avesse continuato (come fanno altre birre) ad avere lo stesso sapore dei primi sorsi, sicuramente le avrei dato un bel 5.

750ml bottle, bottled November 2011, aged into wine cellar at 12-14 degrees celcius, poured into Westmalle chalice! Pours a nice golden with minimal head. Aromas are of cookie dough, bananas, honey/litchi, and a bit of alcohol to some degree. Taste is rather sweet (medium). Body is medium-full, with a slick/creamy texture, and carbo is pretty low. Aftertaste just a tad bitter. Overall, this 2011 Tripel is outstanding. Im totally amazed; I had one (330 bottle though) that was young, and it was a whole other animal. Most likely the best tripel Ive ever had. Let it warm up a bit and enjoy.

Bottle 33cl. Hazy yellow with a lasting white top. Although it is available everywhere this beer is sheer quality. Lovely taste and bitterness and brilliant beer to drink when youre thirsty. Aroma is somewhat flat. One of my favourites.

Great golden color with bubbly foamy head. The aroma is fresh and citric, with a Classic Belgian baseline. The taste is light and fresh, almost impossible to detect the high alcohol level. A great beer overall, must be one of my favorite Belgians!
Pours cloudy gold with a medium white head. Aroma is yeast, earthy, floral, dough and banana. Taste is sweet with light bitters. Medium bodied, exceptionally smooth with alcohol well hidden.

Pours a hazed yellow color with an enormous white head. Aromas of dry banana peel, lemongrass and basically the whole spice cabinet. Taste is spicy and very dry. Flavors - Im getting a bit of dingy malt in there, perhaps some wet cardboard, along with all the aromas I described. A touch of alcohol as well. Very ester heavy. Finishes crackling dry with sharp carbonation and an alcoholic kick. Pretty good.
Pours a hazy straw color with thick white head. Citrus/fruity and spice aromas.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2017 The mother of tripels, the archetype of this genre since the fifties with roots dating back to the thirties, easily available in even the most depressing of night shops or train station bars, in my view one of the most classical of Belgian ales. Off-white, sticky, stable lacing, colour deep golden blonde, misty after adding the fond. Malty, yeasty and fruity, warming aroma of grapefruit, apple cake, old cheese, gin, mango, banana, unripe pear, cloves, dried lemon peel, sour cream, white pepper; taste begins fruity in a dryish way, clear presence of curaçao, quite vivid carbonisation resulting in a dry effect, malty (honeyish, pilsener, caramel), supple and rich, aftertaste peppery hops with a lingering bitter as well as jenever-like, warming alcohol, not disturbing. I do prefer the 75 cl version, however, which is notably softer and more elegant.

A mid golden yellow coloured beer with a front white head. A light fruity aroma, tropical fruit, lychee, mango, plus a hint of dusty malt. Medium-dry mouthfeel. The taste starts off with a tart, tropical fruit flavour, with some sour yeasty flavours coming through. Then a sweeter, slightly cloying malt taste appears giving the all-round taste of boiled sweets! The finish is fruity.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUL 14, 2014 Hazy pale straw colour. Fantastic dense and persistent white head. Aroma of banana, lime and spices. Similar taste. Long aftertaste with some pepper. Very complex.
Bottle. Hazy yellow/golden pour with lots of sedimentation and small white head. Aroma has sweet malt and yeast. Taste is sweet and very balanced. Lots of tasty notes but to sweet for my taste.
Tap @ Lilla Puben, Kalmar. Spicy and yeasty with some acidic and fruity notes, banana, bitter, some alcohol notes. The finish is dry and bitter with spicy and yeasty notes.

Pours a cloudy straw colour with a beautiful 3 finger white head. Aromas of belgian yeast, honey, spiced bread and tropical fruit. Taste includes lemon, malts, honey, spices. The fantastic yeast is very prominent straight up with the dry hops and peppery finish taking over the back end. A little booziness. Fairly full bodied. Excellent tripel.

From 33 cl bottle. Yellow-golden hazy colour with thick head. Fruity and spicy nose with esther notes. Sweet apple pie and oranges. Strong alcoholic, spicy taste. Belgian yeast and complex fruit flavours. Long bitter finish. Great mouthfeel! Excellent triple!

Bottle. Orange hazy color with huge head. Aroma of fruits and yeast. Taste is complex with different notes. Full-bodied with the alcohol in the main role. Then goes bitter aftertaste. Not the fan of strong beer, but this one is definitely worth trying.

Cerveza de color anaranjado con una muy buena formación de espuma y estabilidad. Compleja en aromas y sabores, destaca principalmente la malta que porporciona aromas afrutados (plátano, ciruela, orejones) y florales. Su sabor a malta es intenso, notas de bizcocho y pan están presentes seguidas de las notas frutales. Su alto contenido alcohólico está bien integrado y apenas se nota en el gusto. Muy encorpada, en el retrogusto nos deja malta y un suave dulzor residual. (Botella 330 ml)
Bottle. Pours bright golden with big white head. Nose is bananas, orange and brown sugar. Lots of carbonation and alcohol. Great tripel.
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 Bottle 33cl. Brussel. Pours a hazy/cloudy yellow gold color with a medium sized white head. Fruity and yeasty aroma. My favorite tripel.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Very beautiful appearance; hazy orange beer with a thick, creamy, white head. A bit alcoholic aroma has orange fruit and yeast. Alcohol is unfortunately the main player in the flavour as well but also orange fruit peel, hops and spices. Dry and quite complex. Good despite the holicness.
Pours hazy gold with thick white head. Fruity aroma. Tastes bitter sweet. No strong sign of alcohol

Világos színű főzet erőteljes komlós, kissé gyantás illattal, melyekhez aztán csatlakozik egy élesztős, gabonás jellegzetesség. Kóstolása után elégedetten nyugtázzuk, hogy ez a főzet a belga tripelek minden jóságát felvonultatja, a megszokottnál azonban némileg intenzívebb formában. Ízvilágában a keserédesség mesterien eltalált harmóniája a meghatározó a komló és egy kevés banános-vaníliás zamat formájában. A kategória egyik legnagyobb királya.

DAA; Pours hazy yellow with a lasting, leaving lacings white to off-white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, sour, citrus and sweet fruit adding spice. Taste is moderate fruity sweet, balancing bitter and acid citrus, spice and bitter lasting. Balanced, complex and warming. Body is medium to full, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft to avarage.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2014 Mooi gekleurde tripel, aangenaam zacht fruitig aroma (banaan, vanille). Pittig van smaak met een vol bruisend karakter. Bitter en droog in de afdronk. Complex en fel. Klassieke tripel.

A nice surprise - I'm not a fan of strong beers but this tripel got all that's needed for a great experience. Looks and aroma are a bit bland, but the taste is great and the aftertaste even more so. Serving temperature should be in the 10/12 celsius ballpark to get the best out of it.

33cl bottle from Bierbistro. Toronto, ON. Alc./Vol. 9.5% Pours a hazy deep golden colour with a lasting thick white foamy head. Beatiful lacing clinging to the side of the glass. Aroma of nice fruity, citrusy aroma with a tiny bit of spice.
Taste: Traditional belgan malt sweetness balanced with some spice. It also has notes of banana.Lively carbonation.

Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of ripe pears and faint cereal and floral. Taste is sweetness and slightly bitter. Lively carbonation. Medium body. Dry finish. No obvious sign of the alcohol. Superb.

33cl bottle with a best by date of 6/8/2015. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma consists of pears, lemon grass, apple skin, candied apple, cloves and slight banana. Taste is more candied apple and pears, barely detectable malty sweetness and slightly bitter with floral character. Quite a spicy yeast component as well. Body is medium as is quite effervescent. Finish is dry, with a fruity bitterness that stays. Very complex beer.

Pours a slight hazy blonde colour without a huge deal of sediment. Some alcohol prickle on the nose, some light coloured bread, citrus and a slight wiff of mold (but nothing offensive). Only a trace of alcohol on the palate, full bodied with hints of crisp bread and citrus. Long finish with some bitterness.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 Bottle. Pours a nice golden color, slightly hazy. Nice frothy foam head, strong as well. Beautiful. Aromas are nice and complex, multi-layered: citrus, pines, sourness from yeast that resembles ripened cheese (French brie), slight basement funk, brandy. Taste is fresh sourness, pines, little bitterness. Robust development of both tastes, nice tandem evolution, mellow dissipation (that gets a little creamy). Hint of sweet bubblegum. As good as it gets.

750 bottle. Pours hazy golden color. Nice head on pour that has good retention. Taste of banana, malt, pear, lemon, bit of sweetness, slight alcohol and yeast. Classic triple. Really enjoyed it.

Intense golden color with compact and highly durable creamy white foam. Very fruity aroma, with citrus, herbs, floral, long hops, malts and wheat. Fruity taste, with peach, orange, spices and sugar candy. Long finish full of floral and spice.
Bottle at home, 31st May 14. Nice Belgian, taste of almonds and soaked fruit. Palate, fairly lively, suits the style, easy drinking

330 ml. bottle poured in a Westmalle chalice glass. Good nice head with a lace that seems to last forever. Smell of frutis, lemon grass , alcohol, sherry wine. Spicy. Good carbonation, thick and creamy palate. Taste of fruits, maybe apricots, hints of tropical fruits, some citrus,almonds, spicy. Long dry finish. 0,33 l bottle at home. Fruity sourish herb on the nose. Herb fruity taste, pleasant sweetness. Easy to drink. Do you want more?

Couleur jaune un peu trouble, leger col blanc. Nez de fruits jaunes , note de levure et epices. Gout épicé et acidulé avec note de levure . Petite petillance. Fin amère et et zeste dorange. On sent qd meme lalcool.

This is one of the finest beers that I have had in my opinion. The body has slightly hazy appearance with a bright golden yellow color. Also there is some nice visible carbonation and lots of little bits of floating yeast in the body. On top sits a tall, stiff, white head that has great retention and make lots of slick lacing that coats the glass before slowly sliding down the sides of the glass. The nose is full of fruity and funky yeast, sweet malt and fresh wet hay. There is mild sweetness from the malt and fruity/funky yeast. There are notes of apple, pineapple, golden raisin and lemon zest that are wrapped up in a mild warming alcohol. Hops are very light and the finish gets slightly tart and dry with just a hint of hop bitterness. The body is about medium to full with a smooth rounded feel and the carbonation is in perfect balance to cleanse the palate for the next sip.

Aroma is bananas perfume orange and white spiciness. It's heavy with esters and light hop with light malt. Appearance is cloudy with a tall white Rocky head moderate potential. Flavor is spicy hops that is heavy with alcohol. Heavy phenolic in spicy aftertaste. It is dry with some malt character. It is heavily carbonated in the alcohol is a little hot with a medium mouth feel.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2014 Pours a medium/large foamy head, which settles to a quite dense 1 cm layer. Colour is an opaque slighlty hazy golden/yellow. Aroma is floral, and typical belgian yeast: resin, citrus, dough, and bit of alcohol, almost cheesy, but also with a malty, sweet hint . Taste is actually very balanced, a nice mix of all aromas, mainly hoppy, with a touch of alcohol, and an always present classic yeast flavour: spicy, citrusy, yeasty, fruity but also with a nice smaller component of malt sweetness too. Great balance between hops and sour/sweet. Medium carbonation, slightly oily palate, with a long lasting spiced finish, definitely more on the bitter side (overall quite bitter compared to many other tripels). A very rich, really well balanced and quite complex beer. The definition of tripel

Bottle 33cl. A clear golden beer with a huge frothy head. As the dubbel, it has a mild aroma that I cant describe. This beer has a strong alcohol taste, but well-balanced. It is a beer with a well defined character that I will definitely try again.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours a clear golden colour with a creamy, frothy offwhite head. Very sweet aroma, with some grainy earthiness, and citric notes dominating. Heavy and very complex, incredibly sweet yet perfectly balanced. Strong bitter andf alcohol finish. A magnificent ale.

Bottle. Pours opaque pale yellow with huge white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, apples, yeast, banana, cinnamon, red berries and yoghurt. Taste is light sweet, light to medium bitter and light acidic. Body is light oily with fizzy carbonation. Finish is long and balanced bitter/sweet with notes of fruit, berries, lemon, caramel, sugar, syrup, yeast, yoghurt, wine and a nice warmth from the alcohol.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance started out closer to a 3 finger white foamy head that quickly settled to a one and a half finger head and held adequately for a good "tripel." It had a good hazy yellow/golden orange colored body with a fair amount of stringy lacing a bit all over the place.
The smell had some slight wheat, nice fruity (probably closer to a "pear" aroma), and a bit of yeast.
The taste was a wheaty maltiness with a slightly yeasty iciness I get when I normally do most tripels, yeasty wheat aftertaste, dry finish.
On the palate, it sat super dry, wow, never had a dry tripel, but ok, no worries, honestly really doesnt affect much in my opinion, but probably about a medium in body, fairly sessionable. Carbonation seems good for the style and for me.
Overall, this was kinda wheaty for a tripel, but hey whos complainin, good tripel that I would have again, get it if you see it.

Bottle. Pours light golden with a large white head. Aroma: citrus, floral, herbs, ginger, slightly alcoholic. Taste: grass, herbs and spices, apple, almond/marzipan sweetness, banana. Medium body, lively carbonation, light - medium sweet, medium bitter, slightly sour, fairly short dry finish (white grapes)

Bottle from Tipples. Pours cloudy yellow with a huge fluffy white head that pokes out of the top of my tulip glass. Aroma of dry hay, yeasty banana esters, a bit of grassy hop, light spice. Flavor is hay, banana, yeast, lots of spices, dry grassy finish. Very much on the dry spicy side of the style, and I like it. Full bodied but finishes dry with high carbonation. Overall solid as expected, though not my favorite in the style.

Color oro pálido con densa espuma blanca. Aromas de frutas verdes, con una presencia evidente de levadura. Densidad media con inicio dulce y afrutado al que se suman los toques ácidos y el final amargo equilibrado y seco. Muy rica.

Une excellente Tripel Trappist. Une mousse bien onctueuse, une couleur magnifique, une rondeur bien équilibrée un dépôt qui amène réellement un petit qqch. Bref : une légende vivante qui mérite sa réputation
In fles van 33cl. Goud/geel van kleur met een matige schuimkop. Mooie afstemming van de hop en gerst met een aangename knisper. Erg lekkere tripel.

33 cl, flaske, 9,5 % ABV, 50 years-present fra Værste Fætter og Anne - tak! 18. april 2014.
Ufiltreret belgisk Trappist Tripel, honning-farvet, med stor hvid skumtop, medium boblende, 3-4 cm. 
Klar humleduft og noter af krydderier.
Smagen er krydret og varm. God balance mellem det bitre og det søde med overvægt på førstnævnte. Her er altså ikke tale om at gå for sødt i byen. Masser af god humlesmag uden at være alt for bitter. Smagen starter bittert og krydret og går så over i samspil med lidt sødme, og slutter dernæst krydret af. God lang eftersmag. 
Ret højt indhold af kuldioxid, som giver gid friskhed i munden. 
Denne Tripel bliver jeg slet ikke træt af, og den har en klar idé om, hvad den vil.

Hazy golden color with a frim foamy head. High Carbonation. Yeast and alcohol in the aroma. Citrus fruityness in the taste that turns into the slightly bitter and dry aftertaste. The alcohol i there but you wouldnt say its a 9,5% beer. A triple like a triple should be.

This beer that original of this style of beer. So its a classic taste or rather taste of basic indeed. However, it has become a good finish, and too much to drink carelessly. Because it is a taste of strictness rather, it might be nice to drink on a hot day.

Aroma is of belgian yeast and clove. A bit of alcohol can be picked up. Taste is a fruity one with a bitter/warm alcohol finish. The taste is pleasant but not very complex. The bitterness and alcohol tastes linger beyond end.Body is lightly clouded and gold. Pearl head retains very well.
A classic tripel. A highly carbonated, zesty, citrusy and delicious beverage. A full bodied and smooth beer. Very good!

This beer is a little strong but easy to drink, Fruity and nutty flavor with a slight bitterness. It has a sort of creaminess to it but with a nice punch of a real beer. Not a real fan of triples, but this one is a good choice if youre looking for one.

Pours a cloudy yellow color with a fruity aroma to it. Taste is dry with a light spicy flavor. A tinge of lemon zest that masks the alcohol flavor. A creamy mouth feel that lasts through the swallow. A nice beer for the style...

11.2 oz bottle into a tulip glass.

A: Pours a hazy golden amber color with lots of carbonation. The head - at one finger high, with a barely off-white shade - features excellent retention, a frothy texture, and great lacing.

S: Wow, this smells like a fantastic pilsner...except its an ale...and its 9.5%...and its a year old. Aside from the surprisingly sturdy level of noble hopping, it also has a wonderful black pepper tone. There isnt much in the way of fruity esters, though - maybe theres a wisp of white grape here and there. Like many trappist ales, its hard to really fathom why it works...and yet, it works so damn brilliantly.

T: It opens up with some notes of apple skin and white grape, while the finish is peppery and slightly hoppy. Occasionally a touch of cherry will appear. While I think the flavors are damn good, theres a reason thats all I wrote about the flavor profile...because it lacks some complexity. Its not dead simple though - and it definitely improves while sitting in the glass - but you dont get the typical twists and turns you do with, say, Rochefort 10.

M: The feel is heavy yet fizzy. And like a good tripel, theres nothing to suggest its 9.5%. Given the fact that its dry as shit and very well attenuated, this goes down with ridiculous ease.

O: I kind of wanted more depth, but as a means of creating an easy drinker without much palpable booze, its a roaring success. I think the fact that Im not a huge tripel fan has something to do with me not giving this some score well over 4+ (like Im wont to do with anything made by monks in Belgium). Id also love to compare it side-by-side with La Fin Du Monde.

First try of this "mother of all tripels", recipe unchanged since the 1950s, alledgedly. Light golden, plenty of carb, white fluffy head, a good bit of sediment from the secondary fermentation. Bubblegum and sweet biscuit aroma. Note the alcohol, but nothing like 9.5. Thicky and creamy in the middle, some warming. Smooth. Particularly as the carbonation subsides.
Bottle 750 ml, at Pivkan, Zagreb. Pours hazy orange with large white head. Spicy, citrusy aroma. Lively carbonation. Full bodied. Smooth, fruity, spicy, malty flavor. Great beer.

Aroma is belgian yeast, some spice, citrus and some banana undertones. Clear golden appearance with a good two fingers of head. Spicy, fruity with a little sweetness taste. Complex and very good. Heavy carbonation out of the bottle.

Mijn favoriete tripel en één van mijn favoriete trappisten. Heerlijk vol in de mond met lekker kruidige afdronk en warm gevoel in de keel. Troebel (bij koudere temperatuur) goudgeel bier met mooie schuimkraag. Kan zowel fris gedronken worden als op kamertemperatuur. Absoluut een topbier !!
Bottle. Nice round and full bodied flavour yet surprisingly refreshing for a tripel. Easily my favourite common tripel
Very balanced spicy and fruity, some sweetness to it. Aromas of banana, citrus and honey.

Pours maize with very clean, white and biillowing head. At least three-fingers and fades slowly. Some impressive lacing. Great looking beer. 
Aroma is belgian yeast, marzipan, some spice, citrus and some under-ripe banana. 
Creamy body with fairly high carbonation. Some hop bitterness on front palate before yeast and spice devours it. ABV is concealed well. Clean finish with some gentle warmth. Well crafted beer.

750ml bottle poured into a shaker pint. Yellow-orange and hazy the beer is topped by a three finger rocky white head that settles to an uneven finger high foam. Lots of lacing. Aroma is spicy, green apple, young grapes, citrus, grass, and bread. Flavor is fruity yeast and spicy bitterness. Some grape juice sweetness, citrus zest, and alcohol which comes on the swallow. A solid medium-plus body thats lightened up by active carbonation, creamy texture, on the semi-sweet side of dry on the finish.
Light color with a big head, this ale has a complex malt flavor and a balanced hops flavoring. The taste is delicious, with a deep but difficult to describe flavor. Excellent.

Fra fat. Søt fyldig lukt, banan og krydder. Samme nyansene i smaken, men balansert med en fin bitterhet. Lang og fin ettersmak, som bare gir lyst på mer...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Lys gylden, slow gusher, lite karbonert, tynt skumlag. Smaker gjær, lys frukt, aprikos,hvitvin/champagne. En øl med relativt mye frukt.smaker ikke mye alkohol selv om den er ovet 9 %. En svært god triple

First review may as well be about my favorite beer. Thick, rich, malty and delicious.

Huge dark fruit aromas

Can be a little murky, but is normally lustrous deep amber/brown

Big burst of malty sweetness and fruity esters that linger and morph during the course of the sip. 

Full body and light carbonation.

Amazing.

Cloudy, golden color with a creamy, thick head. Nothing unique in the aroma, typical (or maybe this one sets the standard) for Belgian Tripels. Personally, I thought the alcohol came across stronger than the 9.5% stated but it was still smooth and balanced. Viscosity was a bit thicker leaving an obvious coating on the roof of my mouth. It didnt last long and the aftertaste was earthy and a bit fruity. I love Belgian Tripels so it is rare that I can score one average or lower.

Aroma: vanilla, caramel malts, some yeasts. Appearance: light gold, medium white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: sweets continue, very light bitters appear towards the long dry finish. Overall: OK Abbey Triple, could be more pronounced in taste an palate. Bottle at the Dovetail, London.

Pours a hazy golden color with big active head. Retention is very good and lacing is excellent.
Sweeter than I expected, I get caramel and dried apricots with peppercorn and spicy phenols. The beer remains fairly dry, but maintains a sweetness that is great for the style.
A great tripel. A nice sweetness with great spiciness that remains balanced and complex.
One of my favourite beers. Strong taste, not for everyone as it has a bitter after taste, and also high alcohol %. Very good beer.
Bottle @ home. Haze yellow. Two finger foam. Fruity. Spicy peppery notes ams flavours. Intens alcoholic mouthfeel. Some bitter sharpness in the aftertaste.

Subtle smell. Quite fruity. Clear golden colour. Pungent fruity taste. Very bitter and lingering aftertaste. Strong tasting. Quite a bit of sediment. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a golden clear beer. Aroma is lemon and orange. You can smell the alcohol. Taste is a bit sweet with alcohol and a medium bitter. Overall a good beer

Bottle. Hazy yellow with big, nice head. Aroma is orange peel, lemon, spices, honey with hints of dough. Ligth, perfumy alcohol note. Rahter dry with some light sweetness and bitter finish. Finish is a bit phenolic with some refreshing sourness.. Nice aftertaste with notes of spices. Body medium-low. Nice, warming alcohol. Drinkable, rich, aromatic tripel. Very good beer.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a hazy light yellow with thick rocky white head. Aroma is sweet with citrus and tropical fruit, spices, and perfume. Taste is a very nice balance of sweetness and bitter hops. Flavors of banana, belgian yeast and spices. Smooth well carbonated with clingy sweet mouthfeel. Medium bodied. Excellent tripel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from bottle: golden, sunlike translucent coloring in glass. Smelled sweet, almost like a confectionery, with some yeast. More bitter than most triples, with notes of sweet grass.
Bright yellow color with a clear white head. Not much aroma little fruity and hop. Little bitter, but doesnt last very long. Fruity taste, alcohol well hidden.

Bottle 0.33l. Pours a hazy pale yellow with large white head. Aroma is yeasty, spicy, doughy, citrus. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium bitter, slightly sour, citrus. Aftertaste is quite bitter, strong carbonation. Alcohol is well hidden. Really good Triple with a good balance.
2012 bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with thick white head. Smells sweet, of oranges, banana, and bread. Taste is similar, with some spice and a mild alcohol burn.

Tåget gullig. Aroma: citrus, ananas. Kraftig smag, overraskende i forhold til aroma. Frugtig, men krydret, næsten pebret. Tør. Prikkende carb, varmende alkohol. Bitterhed og en smule syre i lang eftersmag.

Pours a cloudy pale yellow brew with a huge white head with regular to good retention, aroma is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with citrics, banana, spices and peach, medium bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy aweet and moderate bitter with a bittersweet finish.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2014 330ml bottle, poured into a Westmalle Trappist glass. Appearance is cloudy straw colored with some floaties, and a large slightly off-white head that reduced quickly and left no lacing. Aroma of orange and lemon peels, pear, banana and herbs. Flavour of orange peels, wheat bread, spices, apricots and a hint of alcohol.  Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, smooth texture and average carbonation. A spicy first-class Abbey Tripel with a notable warmth from the alcohol.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2014 Bottle : 33cL Versus 75cL. Home. In the beginning, 75cL version had much caracter and fruity taste. 10 later, its a tie game. A clear golden yellow-brown beer with an orange tint. Bubble storm. Long lasting thin white foam. Fruity aroma (grapes), alcohol, spices, herbs. Heavy warming sweet and medium bitter. Full body, silky texture. Lively carbonation. Lasting spicy warming finish. Sharp bitter note. Ahh... Great beer ! Silky texture, warming, delicious !

8-4-7-4-16 : 39        1/26/2014
Caramel-y. Strong beer with smooth flavour. Not as heavy as a stout but still good.

Im glad for this beer to be my first rating. The westmalle tripel really is the mother of all tripels. Great fruity aroma and a complex but nicely balanced beer. Although its a quite strong beer, the alcohol isnt too noticeable .
Bottle. Golden with a white head. Aroma is quite peppery, musty, citrus and banana. Taste is similar, quite balance. Crisp finiah. Quite nice
Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a frothy white head. Aroma is yeast, citrus, grains, floral and spicy. Taste is moderate bitter and light sweet. Full bodied, probably my favourite trappist.
From a bottle. A good combination of sweet and sour. Only slight hints of alcohol. Has a good hazy yellow look.
cereal, floral, basement aromas, banana, pale, clear, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, average carbonation, soft carbonation,

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy amber with big full white head and lots of carbonation. Aromas of bananas, floral esters, and a hint of coriander. Flavors of dried stoned fruit, resin, and spicy hops. Very good but generally over-rated.
Hazy light orange, full on aroma, sweet, fruity and yeast. Very light on the palate, with a complex taste, initially bubbly spice, with a dry kick to finish.

Smell the bananas! A full bodied masterpiece everyone should try. Gold with a firm top and good carbonation. Bitters and fruit in perfect balance, alcohol is well hidden in between. A long slightly dry and bitter after taste remains

Appearance: hazy yellow, with two finger head, lots of carbonation. Beautiful in the glass.

Aroma: bready, spice and fruits with a slight alcohol presents.

Taste: very nice and well balanced. Floral tastes with fruity notes. Perfect bitterness, not too much not too little. Perfectly amount of spice tastes as well.

Overall: another excellent Belgian tripel. I have really gotten into Belgian style lately and this is another excellent example.

Great tripel! Sweet, but not too. Nice, clear golden hue. Long and powerful aftertaste. Spicy. Banana, hops. Great stuff.

Bottle from Carrefour near Bruges. Has a massive big head, and a golden yellow color.

Great aroma of wheat, yeast and a refreshing bitterness.

Has a beautiful balance of wheat, sugar and some bitter hoppy notes. Perfect smooth mouthfeel with a dry ending supported by the carbonation which is present but not distracting, adds freshness to the beer. No spices present, but a nice bitterness at the end, which goes along with an overall sweet character, lovely combination. Bitterness never grows too present.

Bière blonde légèrement trouble. Mousse épaisse et irrégulière. Bonne persistance. Nez fortement alcoolisé et épicé. Entrée de bouche du tonnerre qui ravive les papilles. Fin de bouche qui assèche. Ronde, forte avec une très bonne amertume, la Westmalle est une valeur sûre que lon trouve fort heureusement partout.

Deze "Trappist" is een genot om te drinken. Het uitzicht is een mooi blond bier met een mooie volle schuimkraag. De geur is zeer uitgesproken, De Tripel van westmalle ruikt zeer fruitig en nodigt uit om te drinken. En last but not least, de smaak. De smaak ligt volledig in het verlengde van de geur want ook hier is er een aangename fruitigheid aanwezig, vooral de banaantoetsen komen goed door maar ook een aangename bitterheid is aanwezig. Deze "Trappist" is zeker een aanrader!

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2014 Cuestión de gustos. Rubia y con espuma blanca, con un poco de efervescencia que hace que desaparezca en buena parte al poco tiempo. Aroma y sabor "sour", agrio y ácido al mismo tiempo, con un toque dulce. Es un poco... asidrada. A mí no me gusta nada pero es una referencia en su estilo.
Golden color and a very stable head. Some alcohol smell. Taste reminds on champagne with quite a bitterness. Interesting beer.

Medium gold, slight haze, fluffy white head. Aroma: dry, crackerlike malt, earthy spice, a little pepper, light citrus. Flavor: soft, bready, and somewhat dry malt with peppery phenols, earthy spice, some light fruity notes of apple, dry finish is peppery. High carb contributes to dry finish. Very drinkable.
Drank this with L. at Cafe Van Zanten, Meent. Rotterdam. It tastes very good

En väldigt vacker öl. Ljusgul grumlig med stort vit fluffigt huvud. Doften är klassik belgisk alejäst med viss fruktighet. Smaken är mycket fyllig med bra kropp och tydlig väl avvägd beska. Är normalt inget stort fan av trappistöl, men denna var riktigt bra.

11.2 oz bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks decent; clouds up quite a bit towards the second half of the pour though. Orange with foamy white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells semi-sweet and spicy with notes of Belgian yeast and dry white wine. Tastes like it smells with a pleasant mouthfeel. Drinks smoothly for the abv too. Not my favorite style, but a good example of it that I enjoyed.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2014 Bottle into a Westmalle glass. Looks very light and hazy, a small white head forms which remains for the duration. Aroma of yeast, spice, a little bit of wheat, hints of lemon. Taste is of malt and zest, very full bodied, notes of pine and lemon coming through. Refreshingly long finish. An excellent tripel.
A bit cloudy, pale yellow color with a big fluffy white head. Well carbonated. Aroma and taste is a little sweet and of yeast. Medium body.
Light golden, cloudy with small white cap. Mild sweety taste, after staying for a while in the glass some sharper spirit notes (but very minimal)

Masse skum. Fyldig og god smak. Bitter ettersmak og fyller munnen med glede. Dette er på min "må ha liste".

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma com notas cítricas e canela. Aparência pálida que lembra uma wheat beer. Sabor forte e refrescante com toques de madeira. No paladar, fortes traços de amargor. No geral, recomendadíssima.

Best before Aug 31, 2011, poured to NB globe.

A: Pours a grain golden ale with excellent clarity. There are plenty of little yeasty floaters in there. Four finger thick head falls back down and remains a single finger of thick, fine foam. Foam is burnt cream in color. Continuous carbonation evident from ribbons. Lacing is persistent.

S: Sweet, tart, residual sugars are excellently played out here. White grapes (think naked chardonnay, savignon blanc). The very slightest of metallic nose at the finish. really, quite pleasant.

T: yeasty, grainy, peppery. Very nice bready flavor. Surprising bitter tones help me pick out the sweet, raw sugar, belgian yeast, woody, earthy, reggiano flavors. Obviously a profile to be paired with fine cheeses, dry salames, cured veggies. Damn fine.

M: Heavy. Almost like an american Impy Stout in body to me. Fine, tenuous carbonation. After the burn of the carbonation ignites my palates interest and I swallow, the leftover slicking gives a new portrait of the previous experience. Excellent.

D: This beer far exceeds my expectations. Anybody wanting to try an easily accessed, high quality Trappist Tripel, should be sent here for a prime example. One is enough, but nonetheless, and excellent offering.

Serving type: bottle

02-23-2011

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2015 Color amarillo algo turbio con buena cabeza de espuma que perdura largo tiempo en copa; en nariz aromas a levadura, clavo, flores y alcohol; en boca entrada potente con amargor moderado; notas a miel y especias; cuerpo medio-alto con carbónico moderado; retrogusto largo con notas florales y un tanto seco; el alcohol está presente aunque se bebe bien; buena cerveza trapense; está botella fue tomada siete meses después de la fecha de consumo preferente, mejorando mucho si se toma recien embotellada.

Bu en bouteille de 33cl, une très belle couleur, et une superbe mousse dense. Au niveau goût, citron et Orange prédomine, un goût qui donne envie d y revenir. A recommander cette biere belge trappist des familles.......

Un must en bière belge. Corpulente sans être trop forte, de la finesse dans les arômes et les saveurs (citron, levures, certains à la table y ont senti de la banane). Une dégustation toujours très agréable.

Rich continental style aroma and pours yellow with a visciously bubbly thick white foam head. Incredibly rich, sweet flavour of the lager malts. Fills the mouth with rich, clean cereal flavours which complement the high alcohol taste.

Aroma a frutas, apariencia amarillo oro, sabor amargo, deja en el paladar sabor a madera.
Hay tripeles mejores pero no es mala
Aroma a banana y citricos. Apatiencia clara con poca espuma. Sabor entre amarho y dulce.

Slightly hazy light golden, nice white head with good lacing. Tropical fruits, bit yeasty, sweet malts, nice bitter finish from the yeast and a touch of hops. Not very outspoken, but more complex and interesting then most in this style. I used to drink this a lot, but havent for a while. Just forgot how great this is.

Poured from 330 ml bottle at Quarry House Tavern in Silver Spring, MD.

Very hazy, golden color with a small off-white head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of peach, citrus, banana, biscuit malt, coriander and mild spices. 

Taste of biscuit malt, coriander, peach, citrus, sweet malts and spices. A nice blend of sweet, bitter, fruit and spice. 

Medium body and medium carbonation with a pleasantly complex mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Un bon classique de la bière Belge. Belle mousse bien compact, couleur doré "foncé". Des arômes de banane et de céréales, avec un léger goût de miel. On ne sent que très peu les 9,5 degrés dalcool. Toujours un plaisir !
Bottle. Golden with a small white head. Aroma of banana, some sweetness, and a hint of spice. Medium/light body and high carbonation. Notes of spice, a slight sourness, and a hint of alcohol warmth.
Bottle. Pours clear gold with nice white foam. Light crisp lots of banana in the nose. Fruity a little yeast funk. Mid-light body.

(33 cl bottle from Toft Vin; BBD: June 27th 2015) Pours a hazy golden with medium white head. Good retention and nice lace. Initial aroma has some refreshing green hops, which is rapidly displaced by a more yeast and spice dominated aroma that has strong ester notes with banana and some green fruit shining through. I like the aroma of this tripel pretty well although not as good as the Tripel Karmeliet Id say it is among the best of the tripels that I have tried. Palate experience reinforces the impression as it gives an initial oily almost creamy mouthfeel with lively carbonation and a strong body followed by a long, dry aftertaste caused both by hop bitterness and alcohol. Flavour is largely like the nose with the dominant notes being those of alcohol and hops as it should be. Nicely done!

Intense spicy (I guess coriander) and yeasty, quite fruity mostly orange, moderate maltiness, bit alco, bit honeyish. Sweet, bittersweet with notes of sour. Really great balance. Very refreshing and highly drinkable for quite complex brew.

Yellow/golden in color with a small white head. Noses of yeast, bit citrus and floral. Offers a full body and surprisingly watery and yet chewy in some respect. Light sweet and some salty hints. Finish is medium-long.
Color yellow amber. Solid head and remains. Aroma ir appealing but not intense. Too much alcohol in aroma and in taste as well.

Bottle: dark-ish golden color with banana yellow edges. Cloudy & opaque, topped with a super volatile, huge cloud-like, white head. Unabashedly sweet aroma with notes of candied bananas, residual sugar, Belgian yeast, clove, orange peel, mint (?), various other spices, mild phenol, musky hops, & a very slight, pickled/vinegar aroma. Taste is like sweet salt water taffy, banana flavors with other notes of Candi sugar, rotten mangoes, cloves, musty leaves, fresh baked bread, & brown sugar coated plums. Alcohol is hidden well at first, but becomes quite a contender with warmth - probably my largest complain about this beer. Good balance of malty sweet & a light, finishing hop bitterness.
Pours a golden cloudy beer with a nice and firm head. Aroma is yeast and orange. Full body and a warm alcohol feeling. A nice long bitterness and some dryness at the end. Well balanced!

75cl bottle, kept in my cellar for two years. - The powerful, dry bitterness that shocked me when I first tried this beer many years ago has mellowed considerably. The beer is full and creamy, with aromatic pale malts, notes of bitter orange and aniseed and a hint of vanilla. The finish is dry, bitter and fruity (orange peel). Actually, its complex aromas are nearly impossible to describe... - A truly great beer which after so many years still manages to surprise me.

Bottle 33cl. Cloudy, orange-golden liquid, sparkling, frothy head. Aroma: Yeast, floral, spice. Taste is bitter-sweet, some yeast, caramel, spices, sour fruit. Full body, very lively carbonation, astringent finish. Cant feel the alcohol at all! This is a great tripel, one of the better ones out there. Very rich and complex.
UPDATED: MAY 30, 2014 33cl fles. Lichtgeel van kleur en de schuimkraag is wit. Heerlijke blonde tripel! Smaakimpressie: caramel, lichte gist, kruidig.
Very nice triple but s little too dry. Could do with being a little sweeter. A little high on carbonation...
Pours light yellow, tons of carb. Aroma is light sweet malt and spice. Taste is lively spice with a nice dry finish

Una buona birra che aspettavo decisamente migliore. Invece, odori non complessissimi, con un bellaspetto ma con un sapore inasprito troppo da una carbonatazione eccessiva. bello il corpo, sbiadito il retrogusto troppo in linea con un sapore in generale decisamente amarognolo. Non la mia tripel preferita, ma comunque una birra buona, da provare almeno una volta.

Que dire sur ce grand classique brassicole ... 
Une mousse blanche bien capitonnée surmonte un liquide blond un peu doré avec une bonne effervescence. Des flaveurs complexes, mais très bien balancées dépices, de poivre, de bananes et de céréales camouflent à merveille le taux élevé dalcool. Une légère amertume vient redonner un second souffle en finale. Un vrai petit bijou!

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste belgian yeast, sweet, spicy. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

Overall a great tasting belgium triple. Nice level or carbonation that one expects from a triple. A bit sweet but not too much so. Enjoyed it greatly.

From a bottle. Clear pale yellow, thin white head. Strong spicy, well balanced tripel. Very nice.

One of the great Belgian strong blonds. Easy drinking not too sweet, strong and a lot of Belgian yeast. At first it seems a bit one dimensional but you will find there is more going on. A classic that never disappoints. I always have some in my stash.

Its very good, but to be honest I couldnt get blown away by it (maybe I have a bit of a cold, cant detect the full subtle awesomeness of the aroma, etc). Its predominantly alcohol and spice, there is richness beneath the surface, but not at all layered or blended--far sharper than expected. The double is preferable

Best by date of 04/2012. Pours a pretty gold color with a slight haze and a lofty white head. The smell is caramel, light fruit, yeast, spice. The taste is as it smells with a touch of must. and ending dry and a bit crisp. Medium body with some slickness with average, tight carbonation.

From bottle, hazy yellow beer, large white head. Nose is banana, bread, slightly spicey. Immediately sweet and fruity, good carbonation. Dry slightly fullnky finish, slight bitterness. Drinkabile and delicious, best triple Ive had.

Very nice colour, ranges from bright yellow to darker orange/oker. Head is aggressive and tall. Getting yeasty and very fruity aromas, smelling bread and florals with some spices. Nice, small/medium bubbles. Taste is pretty spicy and a pefectly balanced bitter/sweet, weighing a bit more to the bitter/spicy side. Palate is a medium to light. Carbonation is lively and fizzy, as expected.

My best beer experience until now. Beautiful golden colour, thick foam. Impressive aroma with lots of ripe banana. Mighty mouthfeel, perfect balance of lots of sweetness and bitterness. Long lasting aftertaste. Very complex and warming.
Impressionant Tripel Ale. Sense cap mena de dubte, de les millors del seu estil. Rica en aromes i fresca al paladar

Average beer. Looks ordinary. The smell is fine, fresh. The taste however is not deep enough and even a bit watery.
One of the best Tripels you can find in the United States. Great to taste if you already had the Trappist Rochefort #8.
Ser utmerket ut i glasset, uklar gylden med høyt fluffy skum. Lukter gjær, kjeks, milde blomster og mild banan. Smaker gjær, mildt blomsteraktig og kjeks. Meget tørr.

33 cl flesje . Mooie dikke schuimkraag . Iets wat wrange smaak van citrus en alcohol . Een van de beste trappisten bieren van België maar mag van mij iets meer fruitig zijn.

Hazy yellow golden pour with super large bubbly foamy white head that doesn?t go for a while. Faint aroma. Nice bitter hops, not overwhelmingly sweet. Mild toffee and burnt sugar. Alcoholic warmth as it goes down. Full thick syrup like body with pretty big amount of carbonation. Powerful Trappist beer with perfectly bounded alcohol. Nice hop bitterness. Very complex aroma with hints of grapefruit, herbs and liquorice. 
Enjoy it not too cold for the finest taste, keep it out of the refrig. Best at 12-14 degrees C, store it at the same temperature for at least several weeks for a quiet, 100% bright amber tinted beer free of yeast.
One of the great Belgian beers.

Colour: Pale gold with a firm white head.
Nose: Spices, citrus, lemon and a hint of candy sugar. Slightly toast (wheat).
Flavours: Bitter, dry and aromatic with hints of spices, orange peel. Later on, more sugary sweetness and hints of licorice.
Finish: Long, bittersweet, floral and intense.
Verdict: A very intense, strong but exceptionally well-made Trappist.
Sans doute la meilleure bière que jai eu loccasion de boire! Amertume parfaite! Couleur divine! A boire sans hésiter!!
UPDATED: DEC 13, 2013 A very interessant tripel with a characteristic taste (hey! I drink a Westmalle). A few sour at the end but good choice!

Cloudy straw color with a beautiful fluffy white head and amazing champagne like carbonation. Aromas of biscuit, sourdough bread, stone fruit, apples. Taste is like the aroma and amazing. Drinks really easily for the ABV. This world class.

Westmalle Tripel
