UPDATED: JAN 15, 2015  Delicious and complex blend of fruit, yeast, malt, and alcohol, with a body and palate that hold up perfectly. A gorgeous offering.

Pours a beautiful opaque golden color. 

Has a nice dry, clean taste to it. A spice that lingers throughout. A little spice, a little bit of lemon, has a slightly malty sweetness on the back end that fades away quickly.
bottle. Hazy golden colour, mid-sized white head. Malty base, slightly hoppy finish, quite alcoholic.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow-orange with a huge bubbly head. Aroma of citrus, yeast, spices and alcohol. Bitter-sweet with spicy and fruity notes, alcohol is pretty noticeable. Medium-bodied, soft carbonation, dry finish. Solid Tripel.

0,33 l bottle from öllepood Tartu. Hazy blonde with xxl eggwhite head. Orange peel, spices and some yeasty aroma. Sour bitter taste. High carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great tripel, packs a punch, kind of strong and sadly too sour in the aftertaste.

For cap collectors: yellow cap with the imprint "TRAPPIST WESTMALLE.TRIPEL" and the logo in the center.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2013 75cl bottle. One of my favorite tripels, greatly balanced beer with nice fruitiness and just enough sweetness and bitterness to make it a superb beer. Top notch. --- Rated by Victor
Not bad for a trappist beer. A little too blunt with the yeast flavor. Hard to catch any fruity notes to it. Pretty crisp and yeasty. Good color with a thick white head.

330ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours a hazy blonde with good, long-lasting white head. High carbonation. Nose has honey, floral hops, light spice and candied sugar. Some yeastiness. Taste has more of the same, lots going on. Very full-bodied and rich, with a clean finish that leaves you wanting more. Excellent.
Sorry ¨not my kind of beardhghjfgjdzgsfhfdhcvbvbvcbcvbxcvdsghfbxcvcxbncv

Bottle from Voldby. Light yellow colour with a big white head. Yeasty and fruity aroma. Taste of malt, yeast, fruits, hints of banana. a complex well balanced beer. Nice bittersweet finish. Great tripel.
Crisp, strong presence in the mouth. I didnt notice any sentiment in the bottle or an overly yeasty taste. Alcohol percentage is just at the point where I prefer to slip slowly.
12oz bottle at Matteo's. Pours a pale golden color with a bit of fine head. Fruity belgian yeast flavors. So easy going.

Rated from beer log during 2009 Belgium trip... Light orange in color, slight amount of sediment floating in the beer, light thin foamy white head... Aroma is slightly sour, tart, kind of funky... Flavor is slightly sweet, but yeasty like a trippel.... Pretty well balanced, not too sweet, light and crisp... Bitter finish, very refreshing 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Citrus, Grass, Cumin, Cloves, fairly bitter, not much malt.
Appearance: Pale, clear straw colour with a strong white head. Leaves nearly no lacing.
Taste: Bitter with a hint of sweetness, and a slight saltiness.
Palate: Slick with a slightly fizzy carbonation, very clean finish.

Excellent hoppy blonde beer. A delight.
 
 
 
 
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Big white head when poured into a Westmalle glass, candy sugar sweetness, very smooth, yeasty, hoppy finish. Delicious. A World classic.
Deeeelishus! !! Sorry for the spelling. This is indeed a delicious Belgian tripel. Mmmmmmm
Good belgian triple with a soft body..smell and taste bothe wheat an malts little herbs... botlle drank at buitenlust..
Would have to be the benchmark of the style. A complex but balanced brew that encompasses all that is good about Belgian beers.
Une expérience rare, un goût riche porté beaucoup sur la banane, une richesse à chaque dégustation qui te fait redécouvrir cette fantastique trappiste (pléonasme)
Grain and banana aroma with hints of caramel. Taste of raisins, vanilla sweet bread, marmalade, and peppermint candy cane. Well-balanced bitterness in the aftertaste.

Bright yellow with a long lasting big white head. 
Aroma is spicy and fruity (maybe citrus) with some alcohol.
Flavor is pretty sweet, spicy, fruity (white grape), light sourness and some bitterness. Great dry/sweet finish.
Very good tripel.

Slightly sweet, honey like aroma. Rich, full, slightly hoppy flavor. Almost a combination of a Belgian Tripel and an IPA. Thoroughly delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 33cl. This beer looks great due to the bright colour and good head. Aftertaste is bitter and the taste of alcohol is a bit penetrating.

Pale yellow, cloudy, modest frothy head. Fruits, especially banana and citrus, herbs. Dry, medium bitterness. Surprisingly hoppy for a triple. Alcohol comes through pretty strongly. Complex and interesting, good for slow beer enjoyment.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2014 Bottle, aged for a few months. Gold pour with a nice head. Aroma is banana, apricot, alcohol, yeast and sourness. Taste is banana, ripe fruits, apricot and a smooth rounded finish with some alcohol warmth and pleasant carbonation. Really nice

330ml bottle. Clear golden amber colour, thick foam white head and aroma of fruity banana, lemon citrus, spice, yeast. Taste is malt, spicy, with fruity notes, some bitterness and alcohol. Foamy mouth feel, medium bodied, well carbonated, warming dry earthy bitter finish. Very drinkable.
Wouldnt think twice about having another. Enjoyed it thoroughly. For a true Belgian tripel, its a tough one to beat

Been looking forward to this all day. Bottle into a Westmalle chalice, given a swirl to add that extra bit of yeasty goodness. Yours a lovely cloudy orange with a fluffy head that dissipates down to a lacing. Sweet nose, citrus, banana. Flavour is BELGIAN in six foot high letters; ripe fruit, biscuit, light spice, rich feel on the tongue and ending with an orange-rind bitterness that is not at all unpleasant. A very nice Tripel indeed.
Has a light yellow pour. A light lemon and yeast aroma. It is a very heavy beer, despite its color, and is heavy in malt, yeast and wheat. Some lemon flavor.
UPDATED: MAY 13, 2017 It is one of the best trappist beers in belgium. You can find in the bottle shop. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Source : SAQ
Appearance : Golden with a large foam.
Aroma : A bit fruity and lots of yeast.
Taste : Medium sweetness, lots of yeast and a moderate bitterness finish.
Palate : Medium body and lively.
Overall : Very good.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2017 Aroma of ripe fruits, yeast, bready malts, citrus, some banana, spicy yeast, hoppy notes. Flavour is medium sweet with a moderate bitter finish. Alcohol content is potent at 9.5%, but not overtly noticeable. Carbonation is bubbly. Still the best and most distinctive Tripel ever made. A great beer.
Gyllen lys farve med lyst skum. Lukt av malt og frukt. Smak av malt, frukt og karamell. Vinmonopolet.
Fin duft av aprikos og plomme. Fin lys gyllen farge. tynt dekkende skum. Fin smak av aprikos.

Very nice beer ! Beatiful golden color, intense bubbling and lot of foam.
Very smooth and slightly bitter.
Excellent beer

330ml bottle, poured into La Chouffe tulip.

A: Amber, hazy, small head that disappeared quickly. Not much lacing.

S: Phenol, fairly hoppy.

T: Clove, hoppy bitterness, some banana, bitter finish, slight boozy burn.

M: Smoothish, heavy thick texture, moderate carbonation.

O: Ive sampled a few other tripels and this didnt really stand out as being great. It hid the booze quite well but as with Westmalle Dubbel I couldnt say I was impressed.

This is a blond beer for real! When it is not poured into a glass in one time, the yeast swims around in the glass. Besides that, it is a clear yellow beer and it has a firm layer of foam. The aroma reminds of red wine on the moment of the bottle has been opened. A red wine like taste, and a smooth aftertaste of licorice.

Met recht een blond bier. Indien niet in één keer uitgeschonken dwarrelt het gist in het glas, maar verder een geel, helder bier met een volle kraag. Het aroma van rode wijn komt al tegemoet op het moment dat de fles geopend word. Zurige smaak als in rode wijn, en de nasmaak gaat over in de smaak van drop.

Reviewed 8-22-10

I had this in a bottle in Occoquan, Virginia at a new Belgian restaurant call "Cock and Bull." Belgian beer and waffles - gotta love it!

A: After pouring into a Westmalle chalice, I noticed intense bubbles right away. The color was a cloudy, burnt orange with about 1/2 inch head.

S: Fruity, with mild caramel notes. I detected the characteristic Belgian yeast with plum and citrus.

T: VERY smooth, with a slight but comfortable alcohol burn. Dark fruit a plenty in this one!

M: Carbonation is bubbly, almost champagne-like. There is no offensive sticky residue in the mouth and I would definitely describe this as a very "clean" beer.

D: I am simply in love with the mouthfeel in particular with this one! Also,the nutty and fruity taste of the Westmalle is addictive. Amazing stuff!
Very nice. Lots of fruit, floral and Belgian aromas going on here. Very smooth beer. Slightly bitter on the finish but not overly so. Very nice beer.
Bottle 33 cl from Systembolaget. Hazy golden with white head. Generic citrus, lemon, banana, slight candy sweetness. Light body, well carbonated, sweet finish. Its quite nice.

33 cl bottle from systemet.
Banana and compost in the aroma. To much banana overall and Im not particulary fond of the compost aroma, works in some sour beers but not for a trappist. Also too carbonated. Not much of finish except some lingering banana and some sweetness.

smells like wine! ...at first, then theres yeast, candied citrus, fresh bread. pours pretty standard, flavours of yeast, sweet straw, banana fritter, palate is beautifully light but with great length too and some bitterness. A touch high on the carbonation perhaps. Still, brilliant
Hazy golden color, nutty nose, full mouth. Citrus flavors with medium hops bitterness. Nice dry and bitter finish. A solid trappist and maybe one of the better trippels

A tasty Trappist ale, I like it better than westmalle dubbel. Have a try, it's delicious!!

The Derricks 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Quite a striker. Esters, fruits, alcohol and belgian yeast in aroma, gold, hazy appearance, although poured from above the yeast sediment. The first thing that hits you when tasting is alcohol not really counter balanced with anything in the glass, maybe carbonation is one of these things, but not too successful I would say. Whats also there is the full range of belgian yeast flavors - fireworks of fruitness, herbs and vanilla. The head at first is quite large bubbled and quickly disappears but stays as minimal layer to the end of the glass. Surprisingly the beer has significant bitter finish, quite unusal for tripels, but I do really enjoyed it as it was smooth, by no means overwhelming. A very good tripel, worth coming back to it.

Aroma: The smell is mainly sour, lemon and sour milk, fruity - bananas and pears. Some yeast,Appearance: A light golden beer, cloudy, a firm white head, leaving nearly no lacing.Taste: The taste has a rather clean sweetness, a rhubarb sourness, some alcohol and a good bitter finish.Palate: High carbonation, almost foamy, complex body, a bit oily.Overall: A good beer, warm and refreshing!Note: Bottle, beer tasting at de Klomp. Reviewed 2010-07-10.

Liquide orangé un peu voilé, avec quelques particules en suspension ; un nez en pêches et en abricots. Bien maltée en bouche, sucrée mais pas à lexcès, elle laisse une petite amertume en finale, qui vient tranquillement trancher les saveurs très fruitées. Alcool bien contenu. Le tout est extrêmement savoureux, remarquablement facile à boire, relativement simple et parfaitement balancé. Un classique.

Appearance is typical trippel. Huge aroma of fruit, alcohol, floral and belgian yeast. Medium mouthfeel and carbonation. aftertaste is super smooth with alot of fruit and alcohol. Overall: my favourite trippel.

750 ml bottle into chalice, bottled on 11/26/2012. Pours lightly cloudy golden amber color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big pear, apple, grape, lemon, pepper, clove, banana, bread, candi sugar, floral, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great balance and complexity of malt and fruity/spicy esters; with good strength. Taste of pear, apple, lemon, banana, clove, pepper, bread, candi sugar, floral, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of light fruits, banana, clove, pepper, bread, candi sugar, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Incredible balance and complexity of malt and yeast ester notes; with an outstanding malt/spiciness balance with spiciness being over malt; and zero cloying flavors after the finish. High carbonation and medium bodied; with a lightly slick, crisp, and prickly mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely incredible tripel as expected. All around awesome complexity and balance of malt and fruity/spicy yeast flavors; and very smooth and crisp to sip on. Completely outstanding.

Bottle at home. Has a clear straw colour with a white and medium head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, pale malt, hay and some citrus and alcohol. The flavour is a sweet mix of the same and is balanced and nice. Slick mouth feel and light bitterness. A rich and and balanced abbey tripel.

clear gold, white head with moderate retention. banana, funk, caramel, tropical fruit, slight alcohol. heavy sweet. medium body, slick feel, fizzy carb. one of the best tripels ive had, and im not much of a fan of the style.

Yellow-gold, big uneven frothy head, looks very well carbonated; flowery, yeasty aroma; taste is sugar sweet and has a bubblegum yeastiness and prickly, fizzy spice (too prickly for me); I didnt find it especially dry, bitter or hoppy; I may be a bit Belgianed-out, but this seemed too sweet and one-dimensional to rate at anything more than average.

Pours cloudy golden with a medium-sized dense white head. Aroma of ripe fruitiness, Belgian style yeastiness and some surprisingly sweet notes for a tripel. Aroma is fruity, spicy and, as the aroma suggested, fairly sweet. Maltiness provides the background where the flavours such as honey, raisin and cherries add depth. Hoppiness is pretty mild. Full bodied palate with a delightfully soft carbonation. Richly fruity in flavour and a smooth palate, very nice.

Muddy Hazy Unfiltered Brown. Lots of Floaters at the bottom of the bottle. Barely Any Head, Little Spotty Head. Strong Belgian Yeast Aroma, Slightly Remands me of Champagne. Taste: sweet and sour, dominated by Belgian Yeast, Rather Smooth, easy to drink. It has been a long day and one bottle was enough to waste me... I liked it.

Pours a hazy golden with a big foamy head that disappears quickly. Yeasty nose with hints of banana. Flavour is very sweet with a good level of bitterness, banana, citrus, a little spicy, very deep. Has a nice long finish, holds the bitterness, the sweetness feels a little artificial to me. Overall a decent triple.

Cloudy dark yellow, with a good white head. Aroma of autumn resin. Great taste, perfectly balanced between sweet and bitter. You can feel all of the 9,6 % of alcohol. A little strong on the palate, but really a great Belgian Tripel. Very good.

(Flasche) Es hat eine fast zitronengelbe Farbe, ist trüb mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist säuerlich-zitronig, fruchtig, süßlich, wie frisch gepflückte Äpfel. Der Geschmack ist leicht erdig, angenehm alkoholisch, samtig und ein klein bisschen karamellig .Bittere gibt es eigentlich nicht.
Ljus alkohol stark öl! Vet inte riktig om jag gillar belgisk öl!? Inte så god som omdömena! ! Överhypad!

Big head, which quickly dissipates. Balanced aromas of Belgian yeast, candi sugar, banana, apple and spices. While I expected it to be semi-sweet, the palate is thankful not cloyingly sweet or contrived. Flavors of overripe apple, pear, banana, sweet florals, spice and Belgian yeast linger elegantly on the palate. Well balanced for style.. Good, creamy mouthfeel, semi-sweet mid-palate, with a bit of bitterness that drys out on the finish. Not the absolute best, though close to the top. Obviously though, there is really no need to review this historical beer for you.. This review is simply for my memory.

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

A big, tasty and cloudy head. Coriander, orange and typical belgian "softness" in the taste and aroma. Not fantastic, but ok enough, Pretty refreshing, so I guess summer time is the best time to enjoy this.
What a great ale. Light color and somewhat fizzy but rich taste with bananas and citrus on yeasty body.

Bottle. Hazy orange with a huge, frothy, mostly lasting white head. High carbonation. Aroma is citrus, yeast, banana, coriander, acidic, spicy. Flavor is heavy sweet and light bitter, candy sugar, spicy, touch of alcohol (well hidden btw). Finish is slightly bitter, dry, spicy, peppery, fruity.

Pours cloudy pale yellow, big frothy top, minimal lasing. Aroma - pure sweet malt and champagne yeast, fruity esters, mild not sharp alcohol pungent. Taste is dominant yeast oriented with sweet malt backbone, good fermentation level, deep indeed, light dry mouthfeel although, flouty-thick-slicky texture, lively carbonated. Astringent it is lightly. O.A. - well cause it is deeply fermented and gained too much flavor of yeast in all beer aspects, it has become too acid, too monolitic. Malt profile what shoud be overall is gone. So, absolutely no to this as a Tripel. on bottle- best before 15.01.2015.
from bottle. pours a hazy golden/yellow colour with a medium white head. taste of malts, verry dry beer, hay and grains, some cirtrus, yeast. and hints of honey
Bottle. Hazy golden pour with a big head. Raisin, floral, spice, caramel. Big carbonation and silky bubbles that balance out the alcohol and sweetness . Slightly bitter finish. Very nice
An all-time favorite, the classic and archetypical example of the Belgian tripel. Little bitter, little fruity, a friend to all. Never ceases to bring enjoyment.

The more I drink ipa the more I have moved away from trappist beer. This though is good. Pours golden with strong bubbles on hitting the glass. Nice foamy head. Aroma of alcohol with wood finish. Carbonation reduces but still strong. Creamy texture. Strong alcohol taste with bitter finish. This is not a hindrance to the enjoyment of it.

De Tripel van Westmalle is mij nog niet zo lang bekend, maar sinds ik dit bier een eerste keer dronk één van mijn absolute top favorieten. De brouwerij ligt op een steenworp van mijn woonplaats en het geeft mee toch wel met enige trots dat ik streekbier maar al te vaak bestel op café of op mijn boodschappenlijst zet. Het aroma is zacht bitter met en subtiele toets van banaan en citroen. Het bier is goud blond en in het bijpassend glas komt de onregelmatige en volle schuimkraag compleet tot zijn recht.Het mondgevoel is vol en licht klevend in de keel, maar toch ook sprankelend fris op de tong. Het bruisende bier zoekt zich vlot een weg door de mond en zorgt voor en optimale verdeling van de unieke smaak. De smaak sluit naadloos aan bij het aroma en de geur die je tegemoet komt. Deze valt het beste te omschrijven als fris doch vol, met en fruitige toets van citrus en een subtiele tint van banaan afkomstig van de hoge gisting. De afdronk ligt in het verlengde van elke slok en ebt zachtjes weg tegen de volgende slok of het nieuwe glas.Blijft voor mij één van de beste trappisten bieren, daarenboven vlot verkrijgbaar en een gevestigde waarde op de drank kaart van menig restaurant en café. Top!

From bottle at a tasting at Bar & Cigar. Pours almost clear golden with a large, white head. Mildly fruity with the classical Belgian yeast influences, malt and hints of spices and hops. Medium+ body with a slightly soft carbonation. Medium sweet and quite flavourful with a light acidity and bitterness in the finish. Very well balanced and quite delicious.

Dark hazy gold pour with big white head. Aroma equal parts banana yeast, tart, roasty barleywine like. Starts with a wave of acetate alcohol flavor, rolling into a strong yeast and finishing with significant hop flavor and bitters more so than most other tripels. Some pleasant creamy mouthfeel, but also significant drying alcohol. Im probably being a bit harsh here with a low rating, but this beer is a bit harsh.

One of the very best beers in the world and a flawless trappist. Very strong, in alcohol and taste, it is perfectly rounded, with no overbearing single flavor. Beware that this beer is bottle conditioned; one bottle tastes slightly different from the next and older beer tastes differenly from a more recently bottled batch. Also note that the 75cl bottles develop markedly differently from the 33cl ones.

Bottle @ home. Pours golden with a huge white head, loads of lively bubbles. Aroma of malt, yeast, honey, fruit, candy sugar. Flavor is malt, yeast, sweet, canday sugar and honey, fruit, light citrus, light booze. Medium body, lively carbonation, bordering overcarbonated. 210713
This Trappist have a nice golden color to it. A low head. The round full bodied taste is fresh, with an extra ordinary sweetness to it. The aftertaste is a little bitter. A nice summer beer.

Aroma of spice, clove, unripe banana, nice frothy head with great lacing, pale color, some chill haze, medium body, pleasant sweetness, candy, fruit, lively carbonation, slight alcohol, great bitterness

from bottle. pours a clear golden colour with a huge, frothy white head. spicy and yeasty aroma of ripe pears and bananas with a grainy and malty backdrop and a hint of booz and citrus. average carbonation, medium body and creamy texture. mainly sweet and fruity flavours of pear paired with spices and grains. warming alcoholic and slightly bitter finish. pretty good beer but not as good as the dubbel.
Nice head. With lacing. Aroma: pepper, bannana. Flavour: papper,bannana, pears. Aftertaste: mostly papper dry

Bought a bottle at Albert Heijn. Has a golden blond color and a large white creamy head, and is very good carbonated (lots of bubbles). Aroma of fruits, bananas and citrus fruits. Has a delicate sweet taste with the perfect amount carbon dioxide which makes this beer well balanced. Has a delicate bitter aftertaste which stays long. Overall, this tripel is just as good as Karmeliet. The only difference is the bitterness at the end. Bravo!

11.2 fl oz / 330ml bottle into a trappist glass. Served cold.

Aroma: Nice yeast and baking spices. Malty sweetness.

Appearance: Hazy, translucent, light brown/gold body with a creamy, light, white head.

Taste: Pretty boozy. Not very sweet. Spices.

Palate: Long, dry finish.

Overall: Pretty nice. A little too dry for me, but its a good beer.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2015 Mooie troeble citroengele kleur. Mooie volle schuimkraag. Frisse geur van kruiden en hop en mout, iets citroen en banaan. Smaakt fris hoppig, iets zoetig, vanille en honing. Iets te veel koolzuur.
Trevlig både kylskåpskall och när tempen stiger. Kanske inte världens bästa exempel på belgisk öl när man ska hålla föredrag om belgisk bärs men nog finns det där typiska där. Övermogen banan mm.
Slappe geur, misschien te veel schuim, maar smaakt heerlijk! Niet te slap maar zeker ook niet te sterk
Hazy gold pour. Thick foamy head. Aroma is candy sugar,Belgian yeast & a touch of alchohol. Spicy cloves & banana on the tongue. Boozy warm finish.

Bottle, 25. 10.2014. Pours in hazy orange to pale with low head. Aroma is light honey, citrus fruits, grapefruits, also citrus peal. Taste has spicy biterness upfront, with balace coming in later, complex sweetnes from malt and complimented with the fruit after-taste. Body is full with medium carbonation.
Color is a straw yellow with a white head. A very pleasant fruity/spicy aroma. Flavor is fruity and spicy like the aroma with some alcohol at the finish. Very nice ale.
Im am an avid fan of this beer since I worked in a café in Maestricht in the early eighties. Popped a few bottles earlier today !

Bouteille de 330ml meilleure avant le 17/12/14. Un liquide doré parfaitement claire avec une mousse blanche. Un nez de grain mielleux avec des houblons nobles aux fleurs blanches. Une touche danis est perceptible dans ce nez complexe. Une bouche piquante, épicée aux poivres blancs. Une finale piquante, rafraichissante, une peu sucrée. Les moines savent faire de la bière.
Cloudy dark straw appearance with minimal head. Taste like banana and lemon with high malt taste.

Aroma: Horse/hay, light citrus, pear, spice/peppery
Appearance: Hazy pale straw color. Thin, long lasting mousse like head.
Taste: Sweet with a medium bitterness. Pepper, fruity, banana, vanilla, lemon. Dry finish.
Palate: Highly carbonated but very soft/creamy! Slight alcohol warming. Medium light body.
Overall: Wow! This is good! I would try to drink this in large amounts, and fail, but I will try! :)

330 ml bottle, poured.

Bottle 11 - Pours a hazy orange with a frothy, white head with good retention. Smells of pepper and oranges. Taste peppery and oranges. Im not a fan of tripels and this beer doesnt make me want them anymore than before.
Bottle. Hazy orange color with a medium thick head. Aroma of coriander, apricot, wheat and yeast. Medium sour taste, some bitterness in finish. Well balanced.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2014 Poured into chalice glass. A straw color with a hint of cloud. White head and decent lacing. Aroma is yeast, toffee and sweet. Body is thick. Taste is yeast, honey, and earthy, turning banana and dark fruit and gets spicey and warm in the finish. Candi sugar keeps it sweet and syrupy. One of the best.
Westmalle is fantastic. It always my prefered Tripel Beer. Not the sugared, a little hopped, Im loving it.
Golden color, big fluffy head. Sweet fruits, and bitter hops in a nice balance. Malts controlling the flavors, but sweetness coming delicately from under the malts.
hay, citrus, dough, golden, clear, white foam, medium sweetness, medium body, soft carbonation,

Orange-golden body with lasting nice white head. The aroma is full and fruity. Taste of yiest, fruits, peppery with dry finish. Great beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I bought this because its a trappist ale, and I was not disappointed. It pours a hazy colour with a HUGE white head. The aroma was sweet malt, heavily spiced, and some hops. The taste was extremely complex and suited my palate perfectly.

Bottle. Golden orange beer with a residual head. Aroma of spices. Taste has a pronounced alcohol warmth that follows through to the aftertaste. Also spices, orange and yeast. Medium carbonation and warm. Decent but not great.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Poured from a bottle, San Diego. Light, slightly hazy gold with a medium-heavy foamy head. Sweet, yeasty, floral aroma. Not at all overpowering, but delicious and pleasant, with a sweet, fruitiness. Fantastic beer.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013  a) 33cl bottle, BBE was 23. August 2012 
Orange-trübe Farbe, angenehm fruchtig-süßlicher Geruch. Der Antrunk ist mild, bananig, muffig. Zum Hauptteil wird das Bier vollmundiger, schön weich und abgestimmt hefig-mild. Vergorene gelbe Früchte. Leicht muffig, aber rund. Der Nachgeschmack ist lang anhaltend, intensiv. Sehr toll und komplex! Leicht herb.
--> auch etwas älter noch ein tolles Bier!! --> 
13/12/13/13  
 b)  Wie ein Weizen liegt es im Glas, der Schaum ist schön und lange beständig. 
Der Geruch süßlich, fruchtig-frisch. 
Im Antrunk ist es sehr schön weich-vollmundig, zum Hauptteil hin entfaltet sich immer stärker das süffig-süßliche Aroma, das für die 9,5% aber nicht zu dominant wirkt. 
Der Geschmack ist komplex und schwer zu beschreiben. Hefe ist deutlich spürbar und passt sich wunderbar in das Gesamtensemble ein. Der Abgang ist scharf-würzig mit schön lang anhaltender Hefenote. 
Sehr gelungenes Bier!


Test vom 9.1.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,13,13,12,12,13 - 12,70

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2014 0,33l fles diverse malen gedronken. Het is een mooi vol triple bier, geur is zoet met citroen en iets van chloor, smaak is vooral iets zuur, met een gistbittertje. Ook mooie gist en hop tonen te proeven. Toch houdt ik meer van de dubbel.
pris au pub st-alexandre a quebec de couleur rubis ambre des aromes sucre de miel en bouche on goute tout le miel qui rechauffe nos papilles avec des note agrume ca donne un melange divin (rate 92)
UPDATED: JUL 30, 2013 Clear golden colour with a large head. Spicy aroma with hints of yeast and some fruit. Malty taste, some spices, rather dry.

Quelques bouteilles offertes par mon ami Yan.  Mille mercis pour cet or liquide qui montre un col mousseux capable de tisser une superbe dentelle.  Au nez, une exceptionnelle rencontre parfumée.  Je découvre des notes de pain, des fleurs mielleuses, des effluves de fruits qui vont vers la banane en passant par les agrumes et des houblons fabuleusement poivrés.  Sur les papilles, un alcool vaporeux et des fleurs piquantes, des houblons surannés et des malts pâles, du blé tendre, des écorces de citrons et des fruits jaunes et mûrs.  En bouche, un corps fabuleusement souple et crémeux. En finale, une longue sensation chaude, épicée et sèche.  Une bière simplement prodigieuse.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 Hazy orange beer with a huge persistent white head. Aroma has Belgian yeast, pear, banana, sugary sweetness and peppery spiciness. Taste is sugary sweet, pale malty and fruity. The alcohol kicks in on the finish pretty heavily, becoming more and more disturbing towards the end of the glass. Theres a bit of bitterness as well, but not enough to hide the alcohol. Mouthfeel is medium full and pretty carbonated. Finish is medium full. Pouring in the yeast makes the aromas and flavors less intense. The alcohol is the biggest flaw of this tripel or maybe I didnt chill it cold enough. This is the second time I rate it and the points didnt change at all. and the same thing annoys me.
Pours a hazy golden / blonde color with large foamy white head.  Spicy aroma with clove and a touch of banana.  Lively carbonation.  Spicy and dry with intense flavor.  Very good.
Pours hazy yellow golden with enormous head and fine lacing.  taste is bitter and spicy with fruity notes.  alcohol is noticeable but not unplesant . the best trippel imho.

330 ml bottle. Poored in a trappist glass, hazy orange with a cotton head. Aroma is pear, nuts, grape fruits. First sip is extremely delightful, with a caramel taste, a slight bitter near the end. At first its fruity and then it  becomes spicy and changes to a roasty and bittery taste, but Texture is oily, feels light considering the alcohol level. The complexity is here, fantastic and delicious beer!

Westmalle Tripel has a thin, white head and a hazy, bubbly, yellow-gold appearance, with a few tiny, white specks suspended throughout. The aroma is of full, strong, pungent, sweet bread, with a slight sourness. Taste is of stinging yeast, peppery, banana, sweet bread, a good amount of harsh bitterness, and sugar. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy, and one really does pick up the alcohol with this- think brandy. Westmalle Tripel finishes mostly dry, biting, and wonderful. A challenging, outstanding beer. RJT

Bottle. Pours golden, sparkling liquid with stable white head. Aroma is very fruity, namely grapes, pears, apples. Also some bread and hay. Taste starts on honey-like sweetness and continues into very pleasure bitter spices with very alcoholic background. Beer has full body with oily texture. Average carbonation with long dry and spicy finish. Very complex piece from aroma and taste side, memorable experience.

Coloração dourada clara. Aroma floral. Sabor forte. Cerveja densa pela forte presença de álcool.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml served into a Karmeliet tulip
Bottled on 25/08/13

A - Pours honey golden with sediment floating around. Giant 3 finger head thats bone-white in color and is very slow to sink and never dies completely. Chunks of 3D lacing around the top of the glass.

S - Tangy fruity esters. Pears, apples, grapes, taffy, wheat bread, damp hay, banana liquor, pepper, various unknown spices.

T - Spiced yeast, pears, tangy taffy, acidic and grapes, muted stone fruit. It grows spicier toward the middle with pepper and coriander. Thick pilsener malt, grassy with a citrus bite toward the end. Finishes spicy and dry.

M - Moderate prickly carbonation, heavy side of medium, alcohol is evident but welcomed, dry finish.

Super complex nose. The flavor is is very layered as well but does not match the nose.
I know it sounds cliche, but complex is the main word to describe this beer.

Serving type: bottle

05-12-2012

Bottle. Bes before date of May 14. Drank June 13.  Pours with a huge lasting rocky white head and leaves good lace. Very clear with lively bubbles.  The aroma is not so strong but is soft light grain, a little dusty yeast with the slightest funk, not ripe pears, light spice.  The flavor is very dry and bitter with a long bitter clean finish.  The fruits and spices and light sweetness are not dominat but in good balance. The alcohol isnt while there isnt heavy or intrusive.  A phenomenal and highly drinkable big beer. Just perfect.

Color beetwen yellow and orange with a lots of yeasts elements. Medium fluffy head, but quickly disappearing. Aroma of yeasty banana and fruity esters with alcohol on background. Taste is malty and spicy. After that appears dry notes. Nice body. Decent trappist beer.

From bottle to tulip glass.  Dough, bread and spicy aroma.  Sweet grain and nice banana esters.  Hazy deep gold with a big, rocky white head of big bubbles.  Taste is spicy, phenolics with chewy bread yeast/grain flavors.  Alcohol warmth in the back half, and lingering long.  Finishes semi-dry.

Aroma: Yeast, pear, tangerine, lemon cake and white pepper.

Appearance: Hazy orange body with a thick white head .A few small yeast flecks floating around. Lively carbonation. Excellent lacing. 

Taste: Tastes very light for a 9.5% ABV beer. Initial flavour is pear drops, lime and coriander, then the spicy peppery note kicks in. Finish is dry. Absolutely delicious. 

Palate: Medium to full body with a slightly sticky mouthfeel. Soft carbonation fizz. 

Overall: A truly fantastic Abbey Tripel - packed full of flavour and character.

Slow pour down the center of a tulip glass.  Pear, almost orange color liquid.  Gorgeous snow white head; fluffy like a cloud.  Fantastic lacing and alcohol legs.  Smacked with yeast upon the first sip with some light citrus notes.  Instantly knew that this beer was a winner.  Very nice body.  Finish has hints of banana and clove with very light bitters.  Very long lasting finish.  Tons of yeasty and bready notes.  Definite light fruit and bitters linger in the finish.  Excellent trippel.  Wouldja - Yes
Oh so complex and good! One of the beers that really shows how flavors can unfold over a bottle.
Absolutely nice. Very well brewed and nice aroma of BElgian features. NICe aftertaste and looks.

Absurd complexity, a must-have for the belgian beer lovers. Nice cottonish and puffy head with really nice sparkles that tickles fantastically. The colour is glowy as a fresh pale orange around Chernobyl.  I definitely suggest to try without the bottom yeast first. The aroma is a long trip between a sweet italian candy cherry first, then a bitter -anesthetized by big alcohol percentage- hops pops out leaving space for a dry vanilla ice cream ending.

11.2 ounce bottle.  Pours a hazy golden yellow with a four inch white head.  Taste is of yeast, wheat, spice and alcohol.  Similar aroma.  Has a decent body.  Overall, its not bad, but not as good as what I had hoped.

Nice aroma of slight spice, banana, and fruit.  Huge fluffy white head that lasts forever.  Pale yellow in color with lively carbonation.  Nice bold taste of spice, fruity essence, slight alcohol, some yeasty notes, with a dry slighlty bitter finish.

Bottle into a fluted glass. Pours dark amber with a big pillow of cream head. Aroma of candi sugar, plums, raisins, spice, a bit vegetal. Taste is big on the dark fruits and sugar. Definitely a sipper.  Nice and warming.

Pours slightly hazy golden with a massive fluffy head that has superb retention. Smell of sweet caramel and malts, yeasty banana, spices, citrus and honey. Taste starts sweet and earthy, bitter builds up into an extremely long aftertaste. In the meantime, the fruits, citrus, spices and yeast make an appearance. Strong carbonation. Aftertaste is dry, bitter and long. Well balanced. Brilliant trappist beer.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2013 Thank you Bert!  Pours cloudy lemon yellow with a perfect white head of soft foam.  Excellent retention and handsome lace.  This beer glowed in the glass and was perfect to look at.  Nose is banana, apricot, bubblegum, pale malt, lightly yeasty, complex and layered.  Slightly medicinal.  Some floral and hay.  Perfumey with honey and light biscuit.  Theres a quick breath of orange peel and a just enough spice.  Taste follows the nose all the way.  Buoyant on the palate, vivacious, balanced, supple and creamy.  Theres a little clove on the palate that wasnt on the nose as much.  Finishes dry and slightly sticky. This beer is outstanding, cultivated and refined.  Its not assuming but it is assured and significant in its exceptional character.  A well done tripel like this is a sweet delight.

It is slightly different bitter, its Iceland Moss bitter that goes in boiling water to make tea against symptoms for cough. Alcohol doesnt bite, slighty sweet plum or white grapes taste as is the smell but the bitterness really hangs on to every tastebud, it is ok at the beginning, nicer at the end if moss-tea is Your thing.
Blonde claire, pétillance aussi fine que sa mousse. Epicée, florale, un rien fruitée, pétillance persistante, légère astringence sur la fin. Un peu trop de goût dalcool...
33 cl bottle. Hazy yellow with a huge white head. Spiced, slight acidic and yeasty aroma. Taste has caramel, malts and yeast. One of the better tripels out there.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2015 venivo da due settimane troppo devastanti per poter esprimere un giudizio pieno..rimando il tutto ad un secondo assaggio
aspetto sensazionale da tripel..chiara/ambrata con schiuma a grana finissima molto persistente e spessa..aroma maltoso e leggermente ossidato..gusto e corpo pienissimi,biscottosi,con amaro finale leggerissimo ai lati della bocca..frizzantezza media e retrogusto prolungato
assaggiata una versione invecchiata 4 anni..sublime..sapori perfettamente amalgamati..schiuma a grana fine persistente come se fosse nuova..aroma e gusto fruttati e lievemente acidi,miele e biscottato..ancora più spettacolare!!!

Very golden and light colored with a very foamy white head. Smells like dark fruits. Taste follows the smell. Very citrus, dark fruit, and light malt. Cant believe how deceiving the color is from how full the body is. Unbelievable beer, highly recommended, again hats off to the monks
Al naso non esalta come altre triple ma in bocca ha una complessitá eccezionale rimanendo comunque equilibrata. Sentori di pane, erbacea, finale gradevolmente alcolico. Unica.

Excellent Trippel......goes surprisingly well with many foods!  Given its 9.5% strength, this is very much a sipping beer.  Complex and full of flavours, difficult to pin down.  Some Belgian restaurants will serve this as an alternative to wine with a meal, a role it performs admirably, as it keeps flavour well in the glass.  Be sure to acquire the matching glass.....one of the very best!!

Bottle @ home, picked up at Wilburs Fort Collins. Just around a year old. Pours a hazy yellow orange appearance with a big, foamy white head. Fairly pungent floral, spicy bready yeasty, dull citrusy, herbal aroma. Quite tangy, big tangerine citrus fruity, chewy/bready yeasty, mild banana, big bubblegum, very spicy flavor. I should be picking up more of these in the future.

330ml bottle into a goblet.

Pours a hazy straw yellow with a HUGE three finger billowy white head. Absolutely amazing head retention and gobs of lacing once the head finally does fade.

Incredible aroma of yeast and clove along with peaches and some bubblegum. Quite spicy but light and almost tropical at the same time. There is some light bread and vanilla as well. A touch of dark fruit and flowers.

Flavor of clove and peaches along with coriander and orange peel. More vanilla and tropical fruit along with a very light touch of biscuit. More perfume and flowers along with a breath of alcohol leading to a warmth in the chest. Very dry mouthfeel that finishes with just a slight bit of stickyness.

Overall, this is perhaps the benchmark for the Tripel style and an absolutely amazing beer. Truly perfection in every sense of the word and world-class.
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Malty, straw, hay aromas. Straw, honey, yeasty flavors.
great floral aroma, fine foam, golden color,      taste: medium sweetnes, light bitterness,   fizzy palate with a oily texture.   overall a great beer

UPDATED: APR 19, 2015 Golden hazy color with big white head. Aroma of malt, yeast, citrus, cloves, pepper, honey and green apples. Taste is sweet dry, bitter hoppy finish and long aftertaste with pleasant crispy alcohol burn.  Medium body, fizzy carbonation. Nice ale, very enjoyable tripel.

Poured from the bottle it has a typical lager pale yellow color with a large head. Aroma was crisp with apples and pears. Taste was different than most tripels, definitely drier but it had crisp fruit with some yeast. Long finish.

330ml bottle bought at Belgian Beer Intl. in Tsuen Wan.
Cloudy hazy golden honey colour with small trunks of dirt like yeast sediments; Two finger head with lasting white crumpet foams; Very sticky lacing and fizzy carbonation; Very fragrant aroma which can be smelt half a foot away, which includes banana, vanilla, caramel, plum, dark fruit, malt, spices and white wine, and hint of alcohol; Rich and fulfilling sweet taste of banana, caramel, burnt toffee, dark fruit, malt, liquorices, citrus, lime, herbal hops, and warming alcohol; Medium body, rich and creamy palate; Taste profile is dominated by very nice, sweet and hoppy Tripel taste, all in a nicely-managed, warm and  comforting alcoholic background, with a distinctive hop bitterness lingered and rounds out for an enjoyable finish; Pretty dry after taste, easy and tempting to mouth.

Comments: After experienced a few Tripel near misses (Waterloo Tripel 7, Delirium Tremens) and never was (La Trappe Tripel), this one boldly states what an excellent Tripel should be: beautiful colour and looks, great lacing, complex and fragrant aroma, and most importantly, sweet and hoppy enough taste to make me swoon. Words simply fails how nice this Tripel is. I say it has a slight edge over Chimay White, the standard bearer of excellent Tripel. Look no further! :)

.33l bottle @ Tuulensuu Tre
Pours cloudy yellow to copper with low head. Aroma is citrus fruits, hops and wheat. Fruity! Flavor is great! Hops, citrus, wheat and alcohol. Swell!

Bottle. Sweet fruity citrus, spice, and light yeasty aroma. Cloudy straw gold with a huge off-white head, and flocculation. Fruity, spicy black pepper, alcohol, and mildly bitter flavor. Medium creamy body, soft carbonation.

The beer had an aroma of alcohol and a taste that doesn't last very long. Mostly just a strong beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light amber with a frothy white head. Smells fruity and spicy, and it shows up in the beer. Solid Trappist Tripel

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A good tripel. Yellow amber, lively carbonation, white foam. Balanced beer with fruity notes. Sweet and bitter. Decent.
Light golden yellow. The smell has something of a white wine (Chardonnay?). Taste is fresh with a good bitterness.

Bottle at home, february 21st 2013. Light golden body, hazy, with a huge white foamy head. Lively carbonation, but with small bubbles. Aroma of honey, clove, banana, peppers, citrus fruity hops, in a good composition. Clean balanced taste; malts, plenty of yeast notes, from peppery spices to fruit, hops, bittersweet with a high bitterness and more sweetness coming through in the swallow. Light alcohol notes.

Alcohol and phenols on the nose, medium carbonation and big but not fluffy head, what spices there are are drowned out by an almost-band aid characteristic and the hot alcohols, finish is alcohol. Not sure why Im so against the grain here, not awful but doesnt come close to my favourite tripels.
Brood, graan, bloemig, spar, gember, stampoo maar in een positieve zin, alcohol, hooi, fruit en lekkere bitterheid

Head: white, medium, frothy. Colour: golden-amber and clear.

Aroma: fruity in a refreshing way (a minty perhaps?), not as dry as other tripels. Taste: again some refreshing sweetness, like a minty lollipop, a bit of bitterness and just a drop of sour bite in the finish. Maybe some alcohol too. Not too much yeast and phenolics detected.

330ml bottle from a German supermarket.
I wouldve imagined this one to be darker. Yellow/straw colored body, quite clear. Three finger white head with large bubbles in it. Becomes creamy after a couple of minutes.
Aroma of grass, banana, oranges and gentle hops. In the mouth the quite high ABV becomes dominant. Almost liquor-ish in the mouth and down the throat. Tastes like a witbier with a few drops of vodka.
Im a little disappointed, I thought this one would be better balanced.

Golden yellow color with big white head. Aroma of  grass, floral, citrus, honey, coriander, dough. Taste is light sweet, light sour and light bitter and quite dry at the end.Medium body, oily texture, fizzy carbonation. Really nice tripel.
Very nice aroma smooth taste very nicex and siljy on the palate

Bottle. Pours a beautiful cloudy orange color. Big foamy head. Lacey on the sides. Boozy, yeasty and sweet. Very good. I can see why it's been around this long

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JAN 23, 2014 Een lekkere trippel deze Westmalle. Een zacht smaak, wat troebelige kleur en wat bittere nasmaak.

Bottle @ beux viuex temps. La regina delle tripel per complessità del gusto e soddisfazione nella beva. Laroma è intensamente speziato, di sicuro delle bacche di ginepro e del cordiandolo. Aromi secondari dolci di frutta estiva (albicocca, pesca) e di alcol. La schiuma bianca è finissima con una bella persistenza  ( 2 minuti abbondanti)e una consistenza pannosa. Il colore è ambrato. Il gusto è quello che si vuole da una tripel, bel calore alcolico , ancora speziata e una luppolatura leggera ma gustosa che rende il finale secco e breve. Il corpo è mediamente carbonato di consistenza oleosa ed impegna la bocca a dovere

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2013 En lagrad flaska som hade fyra år på nacken (2009). Smak och doft av jäst, äpplen, grönt äppelskal. Fruktig, rund, torr, marmeladkänsla. Riktigt gott.

Flaska (2013) Sötare än 2009, sötare, ciderkaraktär. Väldigt god, lagom besk, lång eftersmak. Krusig.

Pours a clear, light golden colour, with a frothy white head.  Very fragrant the moment out of the bottle.  Aroma of sweet, fruit, some banana, pears, grapes, floral, malt.  Taste is where the spice comes through, nice bitterness.  Good body, and fine carbonation.  Long, bitter finish.  Decent.  Ok.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 330ml bottle. Light yellow body with a thick white head. Fruitu and herbal, with spicy and yeasty notes along with some oranges and sweet fruits. Noticable warming alcohol towards finish, along with a brief but distinct bitterness. High co2.
August 2010. Pours golden color with a white head. Fruity and hoppy notes, some spice. A little bitter on the finish. Excellent beer.
UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 hazy orange colour. White big head. Unfiltered and hazy.. quite thick. Alcohol not too noticeable. Sour and a bit bitter. strange.
(Bottle). Unfiltered golden complexion with long-lasting fluffy white head. Aroma is spicy with Belgian yeast. The flavor is dry with yeast and mild citrus. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaska. Bittermandel, marsipan, banan och jäst doftar det av. Desamma återkommer i smaken, tillsammans med en kryddighet.
Gyllengul dimmig öl med vitt skum. Doft av jäst, kryddighet och en lätt funkighet. Detta återkommer i smaken tillsammans med viss citrussmak och mandelmassa/bittermandel i eftersmaken.

Pours a hazy gold with billowing white head. Nice fruity aroma. Flavors of yeast, malts, fruit, bitter hops and alcohol combine in perfect balance. Crisp and clean on finish.  One of the best beers Ive had.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2013 Pours hazy golden with one finger white head. Aroma is yeasty, spicy. Taste is bitter, yeast, bread, spices, pepper. Medium carbonation, medium to full body. Finish is dry and spicy, peppery.

Bottle from The Offie, Leicester. Cant believe Ive never rated this. But then again it must be ages since I drank it last. Its brilliant. Thick, balanced, drinkable. Warms the chest, yet disguised as a light, hop edged Belgo pale ale. Archetype.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy pale golden with abundant and stable white head. Clear aroma of hops, malt and spices. Dry, hoppy flavour with clear spicy notes and subtle sweetish, flowery touches. Booze in the finish. A very nice Tripel, indeed.

Appearance: Hazy gold with orange tint and a substantial white head.
Aroma: Citrus, beeswax and a bit of skunk.
Flavor: Malt, candy sugar and lots of hoppy bitterness.
Palate: Medium to full body with lots of carbonation.
Overall: Clean (for a Trappists) with an almost parching dry finish - perfect for making you want another sip.

330ml bottle. pours a golden amber colour and white head that lingers for a long time. aroma is of caramel, yeast and bread with alcohol coming through. taste is very good. nice full mouth feel and is both bitter and sweet. again, yeast and alcohol come through.
Syrlig och jästig aroman. Aningen jordig i smaken. Inte alls lika bra som dubblen.
Very nice tripel. One of the better ones. Hazy yellow, a little sweet, but great balance. Excellent.
Pours pale yellow with a ridiculous white head the stubbornly clings to the side of the glass even after the beer is all gone. Quite crisp. Citrus and spice and everything nice.

Aroma of Belgian yeast, some spice, and a little barnyard funk thrown in for good measure. Pours a yellow-orange with a mostly lasting foamy white head and great lacing. The taste is lghtly sweet. Citrus, fruity, and a hint of funk, leading to a dry, crisp finish. There is a lingering bitter aftertaste. Medium-light body with medium carbonation. Overall, an enjoyable Tripel.
Sep 2012 - bit of head, not as much as the Dubbel.  Initial taste - sharp alcohol,  That settles over time, becomes slightly sour, but not in a good way. Overall, a poor example.

March 20, 2013 - bottle from Randalls.  Clear golden pour with huge head that faded to a thin layer that lasted.  Fruity, spicy, alcohol and yeast in aroma.  Taste was consistent with aroma with the spice and alcohol being most prominent.  Medium body and some carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2013 75cl bottle. Aged for 2,5 years (0,5 years over expiration date).
Appearance: little to no head.
Nose: oxidated, caramel, malts, port
Taste: madeira, port, oxidated, ... the beer is over its top, but still very drinkable.
I hope to re rate this soon with a new one, the younger ones are better!


Re-rate on a young sample. 75cl.
Appearance: clear blonde beer, nice stable white head.
Nose: pineapple, oranges, grains, yeast, some hops.
Taste: lots and lots of grain, rather fruity.
Nice beer, but not entirely my taste.
Golden color, big fluffy head. Sweet fruits, and bitter hops in a nice balance. Malts controlling the flavors, but sweetness coming delicately from under the malts.

Lune des meilleures bières du monde probablement.
Robe dorée légèrement trouble. Arôme épicé, légère amertume très agréable. Arrière-bouche chaud et persistant. Un délice.

Odeur mielleuse et épicé, Belle mousse persistante, robe jaune/miel brumeuse.  Gout: Miel!  Un peu, pas trop.  Un peu terreux/cuiré.  Assez petillant en bouche, arrière goût chaud assez plaisant mais par contre ça assèche la bouche et te donne envie de te lêcher les lèvres.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2013 Bottle at Eulogy. Cloudy pale yellow orange pour with a gentle white foam. Expected full chewy malty caramel body but comparatively a dry floral Tripel. Spicy pepper on the tongue. Honeycomb. Lemongrass. Straw. Lavender. Thyme. Sage. Orange pith. Cloves. Watercress. Slight earthy funk. Feels like a reduced complex Saison or Farmhouse. Like the best Trappist Tripels, follows the style but is unique unto itself. Update: Having the new 2013 bottle at Monks. This season the Tripel tastes less sweet and malty and more floral and dry. Very nice.
Nice aroma with notes of citrus, hay and yeast. Color is like honey. Taste is warm with notes of rasins and grass. Very nice, one of my favourites.

Birra eccezionale, corposa ed equilibrata, molto beverina. Schiuma intensa, abbondante e persistente. Aroma  malto e luppolo intenso e piacevole,  ottima carbonazione. Luppolatura perfetta e piacevole. Sapore persistente e piacevole. I gradi alcolici di questa birra quasi non si percepiscono, data la bontà e il bilanciamento dei sapori, il corpo non è duro ed è in armonia con tutta la birra.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2013 Geweldige triple. Lekker sterk. Absoluut een  van mijn favoriete triples om lekker lang van te genieten. Een aanrader voor iedereen!

golden, clear, sparkling, white foam, frothy, medium bitterness, light sweetness, full body, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,
Coup de coeur des trappistes belges et des bières "triples". Une amertume caractéristique parfaitement dosée et une saturation équilibrée.
geweldig aroma goede smaak één van de beste belgische bieren!! ook de westmalle dubbel is een dikke aanrader

Flaska från Systembolaget , jag hade stora förväntningar då jag tycker Westmalle dubbel är fantastiskt god, men jag blev besviken. En stickande bismak drar ned betyget, kanske en dålig flaska, måste pröva igen!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle dated 6/26/12. Strong fruity-spricy aroma as soon as I pop the cork. Pale gold with a thick, creamy white cap of foam. In the glass, aroma is yeasty, spicy, and richly malty. Initial impression is malty, which transitions to a dry sweetness, alcohol, spice and a hint of hops - very nicely balanced. Mouthfeel seems full at first but dries quickly as the carbonation, alcohol, and spicy flavors sweep in. Overall a fantastic balance, and its easy to see why this beer defines the Tripel style.
0,33l bottle. Aroma is yeast, fruits, spices. Taste is similar to aroma, with some alcohol notes. Overall it is very good and interesting beer.

Beautiful beer to pour; golden with a dense head. Slightly hazy (I might have agitated the yeast a little before pouring; a normal pour of this beer is quite clear) but clear enough to see the high carbonation. The head laces beautifully on the glass. Not a strong aroma, certainly no strong hop aromatics. Mouthfeel is very full and creamy, probably from the thick, foamy head. Taste is extremely bitter in the back - too bitter for me. Bitterness along the sides of your tongue which becomes a sour back of the throat after swallowing. Toasty barley, earthy, and green grass flavors over the hard palate. 

If you like hop bitterness or the earthy tones of triple fermentation on sediment, this beer is not to be missed! Also a great choice for American IPA fans who want to experiment. Perhaps the quintessential Belgian Trappist ale.
Te veel koolzuur maakt deze te tintelend in de mond. Ondanks het prettige aroma en uiterlijk geen bijzonder bier qua smaak.

No me gusta, siendo un gran bebedor de las de abadía con esta no puedo.
Alta carbonización y gusto a alcohol muy fuerte.
Fruity ballanced and very complete beer. Not unpleasant, but bitterness lingers maybe a bit too long. Excellent palate! Sweet, dry and bitter in phases.

Bottle.  Best buy 12/13.  Hazy yellow pour with sturdy head.  Some sweetness on the nose, and very very clean and fresh.  A little more doughy than I would expect from a top tripel.  Great beer to have with dinner.
Buen sabor, cerveza tripel clara pero con bastante cuerpo para tomar fresca

0,33 l bottle BB 13. Jun 14  
 karamellig, Butterscotch, harzig, Fichte, Gewürze, alkoholig, dunkle Goldfarbe, haltbarer weißer Schaum, süß,

Giallo dorato, schiuma bianca abb fine e molto persistente, carbonazione evidente. Allolfatto speziato, cereale, pepe, leggero erbaceo, lievito, pane. allassaggio riscontriamo gli stessi sentori con un finale ben bilanciato. alcooll ben nascosto.
Pours hazy yellow/straw with a thin short lived white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma of Pear, lemon, weak orange. Some honey. Taste is surprisingly bitter. Medium bodied.

330ml bottle. Deep, hazy orange-amber with bubbly white head. Doughy yeast, mixed spices, green apple and pear. Bitter and dry with a sweet, slightly sour lingering finish. Lively carbonation and potent flavour profile covers the high alcohol content.
I appreciated this beer although there is some notes of bitterness. in it The good thing is that the high alcohol is almost indiscernible.

2012/02/12 - Pours a hazy golden straw color with a thin white head that laces the glass nicely. Aromas are yeast, citrus, cereal, sweet malts and hints of lemon. Taste is sweet malts, lemon, citrus and light hops. Starts sweet and tart and ends crisp and dry. Thin to medium mouthfeel with lots of carbonation. A very nice tripel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2015 11/2/2013: 33cl bottle (a8 ap5 t6 p4 14)6/8/2013: 33cl bottle BB11/2014 (a7 ap5 t7 p3 13)Goldblond, large white head, lacing, nice sparkling.Citrus, burn, spicy, something overripe, pepper in aroma.Spices, pepper, sweets, honey. Bittersweet finish with a fruitmix and some alcohol.

Corked & Caged 750 ml Bottle. Pours a golden straw color with ample off-white foam and lacing around the glass. Lots of citrus, yeast and malt in the aroma with some fruity esters around the edges. The taste opens up with a strong dose of honey, clove, pear and malt along with some lemon, apple cider and yeast notes in the background. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied with champagne-like carbonation and a mildly sweet and herbal dry finish. Definitely earns its reputation as one of the great Belgian Tripels.

cereal, bubblegum, clove, earthy, pale, golden, clear, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, salty, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, long finish
33cl bottle served (unfortunately) too cold at 1600 Bier Haus, Calgary.  Still pours a straw golden with thick slow rising white foam. Spicy aroma mixed bubble gum from Belgian yeast. This probably muted due to cold temp at pour. Lacing apparent as head slowly collapses. Carbonation is med to low, with a creamy mouthfeel. Taste of spicy pepper along with light sweetness. A medium bitterness takes over and persists well into the next sip.  A very nice beer - the model of the original Tripel?  Will have this one again.
Yellow/golden beer. Small, fluffy white head. Aroma of pepper, banana, lemon, other fruits. Dry taste of lemon, yeast. Light bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2013 Pours golden, 3 finger head, lots of different sized bubbles, murky, alcohol legs streaming up, thick lacing sticks around. Doughy malt, fruity, slight alcohol, estery yeast and noble hop aroma. Big malty, spicy hop, estery yeast,  fruit flavors all last throughout and linger, very little alcohol flavor mid mouth.  Mouth feel is excellent, medium thin body, good amount of carbonation, bit of alcohol heat.  This may be the best beer I?ve had, excellently crafted, tremendous blend of malt, yeast, spice and fruit flavors, DO NOT HESITATE TO BUY THIS, $4.99/ 11.2 oz bottle is a steal for this level of beer
A very good example of the style although I like the Dubbel more than this. I see that the brewery produces 45,000 bottle an hour! Thats what I call doing the Lords work.

Cloudy straw color with a generous rocky head. Peppery yeasty nose with some gentle wheatiness and a touch of herbal hops. Gentle flavor, though very full bodied; easy to drink.  Nice peppery yeasty biscuitiness with some earthy blonde sweetness and a bit of dusty grassy hop.
330 ml bottle. Deep golden with medium white head. Nose: caramel, apple, estery. Taste very yeasty, good body with lots of malt flavor. Low and very pleasant bitterness.

+ ziet er goed uit. Mooi gouden kleur, die troebel is. Je ziet er een soort van drapje in hangen.
- weinig geur, in de verte is van citrus.
1ste smaak - dikke substantie, vol in de mond. 2de smaak - bitter met een gewicht die naar achter op je tong beweegt. 3de smaak - iets scherpere bitter die achter op de zijkanten van je tong beweegt. 4de smaak - de alcohol prikt ligt in je mond.

In zijn geheel een lekker biertje, verfrissend. Zou er alleen maar 1 op een avond kunnen drinken. Dit is geen biertje waarvan je er meer op een avond wilt hebben.

Bottle poured into a snifter. This is one of better tripels Ive ever tried. Upon cracking open the top, this beer smells like fresh baked banana bread that has been fortified with spices and vanilla. Pouring a pale, cloudy gold body, this beer boasts a 1/2 inch white head made up of big, loose bubbles. Overall, this is a very dry tripel that almost drinks as a champagne. The bubbles stay strong throughout each sip, creating a popping effect that lingers down the throat. With a mellow sweetness, there are notes of honeydew, lime and black pepper. Awesome beer.

This is a fabulous beer. Great pour with a big thick head which recedes down to a big ol bubbled film that never leaves you. Beautiful aromas leading to a very drinkable ale that hides the big ABV very well. Belgian spiced, apricots, toasty biscuity peppery flavours abound amongst high perfect carbonation.
Bottle at brewfellas. My first Belgium in a long time. Pours a nice dark yellow with a foam that fills the glass. Aroma is belgium fruity. Not at all as sweet as I expected it to be. Excellent beer.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2014 Nice orange colour, with a thick, white-creamy head, slowly collapsing. Nice smell, fruity and spicy. Taste is bitter and hoppy, but very well balanced, also alcohol is well hidden.
Great tripel.

I just had this beer and i have to accept its absolutely one of the best beers I ever tasted. Only the Sint Bernardus 12 seems to be close. The taste is very full and has a kind of wooden taste. The Westvleteren 8 is absolutely more fruity, but less exceptionnal. 

I absolutely recommend the beer and the website that helped me to get the beer for a good price (even if i dont know if this is allowed in my review: http://westvleteren12.webs.com/ ) 

Enjoye

Bottle 0,33cl. Pours a hazy golden colour, with visisble residue of yeast. A large fluffy white head that goes away after a while. Aroma is dominated by the yeast, but some fruits as well. Mouthfeel is about medium, and a flavour of dry yeast and spices, some fruits, but well hidden alcohol. Its pleasant enough but no fanfare needed.

Bottle. Pours hazy straw blond with a thin head full of tiny bubbles. The aroma is discretely peppery and citrusy. The taste is spicy, bitter and dry. It is quite rustic and devoid of malty sweetness, uncompromising. Its a cult beer perhaps, but not necessarily a tasty one. The Westmalle Tripel was tasted along with Chimay Blanche and La Trappe Tripel and it scored lowest in all categories, losing by far.

Hazy golden color. Thick white head. Bought beer at beer junction west Seattle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home, bb 2014. Almost clear golden color, white head. Aroma of yeast, sweetness, some malts. Balanced sweet taste, yeast, little hops. Nice belgian.

Bit of a stealth beer this.
Almost orangy straw yellow with an easy froth head that goes the distance. Beautiful penetrating nose of lemon rind, candy sugar, dried fruit and yeast.

Dry in the mouth, it always seems more carbonated that I last remembered. Not at all off putting though.More dried fruit on first taste delivering a long warm bitterness with spice and hints of thyme and rosemary. Superb complexity and devlopment over the life of the pour. Just builds and builds as the 9.5% ABV comes into play.Theres a lightness of touch too with finesse and elegance but a penetrating stern strength too.So much balance and restraint. Really kicks the brain heart and palate into action.

As far removed from sessionable as possible. And I like it that way.
33cl bottle.This poured a hazy gold colour with a good looking thick creamy white head.Lovely aroma of fruit,spice and yeast which also all appeared in the taste along with a nice alcohol hit too.

Bottle at Comic Cafe (Brussels, Belgium)
Aroma: Nuts, caramel, grass, spice, and some citrus.
Appearance: A slightly hazy light golden color with a white head.
Taste: A bit sweet, a bit bitter, and slightly spicy.
Palate: Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Smooth, drinkable.

Ambrée claire avec une mousse large qui reste jusqau fin. Un nez de malt et raisins sec avec un peu de fruit. Effervescente et moelleux avec un goût de malt, caramel et fruits avec une finale légérement amer et douce au même temps.

Pours an average white head that mostly diminishes. Body is clear and sparkling. Color is yellow. Aroma contains lemon and orange, dough, banana, cherry, cask wood and spices. Flavor starts off light acidic, to go to sweet and to finish in light astringent bitterness. Body is medium, texture creamy and carbonation soft. A very good tripel, a blueprint for the style.
UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Hazy golden color with a dense with fluffy head. Strong and spicy, a wonderful beer.

Citrus, alcohol smell.  Bitter, spicy with slight sweet aftertaste.  Hops and a slight burn.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hay color that is hazy.  Good head retention and excellent head retention.  Lemon citrus smell with some hops.  Citrus taste with  moderate hoppiness and spicy alcohol.  Great beer.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kaatuu lasiin vaaleankeltaisena ja runsaalla vaahdolla, joka ei heti katoakaan. Haju on raikkaan hedelmäinen, mutta myös alkoholi haisee hieman. Hieman luumua ja puumaisuutta löytyy joukosta. Maku on hedelmäinen, mutta alkoholimainen. Dubbelmaista mausteisuutta ja luumua on myös joukossa. Lämmetessä alkoholi tuli selvemmin läpi. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen ja tasainen. Kokonaisuutena mukava tripel, mutta alkoholisuus hieman haittaa nautintoa.
Hazy golden colour with thick creamy white head and good lacing. Lovely yeasty aroma. Fruit and spices. Nice dry taste. Satisfying body with alcohol adding some punch. Clean bittered finish.
Bouteille de 330ml,robe dorée opaque, arôme de levure, goût de levure également et de fruits séchés.

Bottle. Yellow hazy. Pale malts, spicy esters. Some wheatish- style notes. Body is fullish. Loads of flavours. Yeast esters, malts. A bit of coriander, some alc after it warms. Probably my favourite tripel.-- bb/h

Bottle at The Libertijn, Den Haag. Poured a cloudy yellow pour with a thick white head. The aroma is yeasty and a little malty. The taste is alcohol bitter with Belgian yeast and a bitter burning sensation in the aftertaste. This has never been one of my favourite beers and nothing has changed. The Dubbel is awesome though!

Giallo dorato, con abbondante schiuma bianca. Velata. Aromi tenui ed eleganti di malto, zucchero candito, fiori, spezie, con sentori di alcol e lievito. Gusto dolce, pieno, equilibrato da una buona acidità e da un amaro medio. Sapida, con un corpo ben strutturato. Alcol mascherato.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2014 33cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazy yellow with white head. 
Aroma spice, yeast, banana, citrus, malts. 
Taste banana sweets, spicy bitter. 
Mouthfeel creamy, medium carbo. 
Sparkling tripel.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2014 Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours hazy golden with a large frothy white head. Aroma is spicy, fruity and sweet, hay,  some alcohol, yeast. Taste is crispy sweet at first, than some bitterness together with some spicy phenols. 

Initial rating January 4 2013. Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours hazy golden with a dense white head with small bubbles that slowly thin out. Aroma is spicy fruity and sweet, some alcohol, yeast. Taste is crispy sweet at first, than some bitterness together with some phenols. 
7-3-7-3-15=35

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2013 I must have had a bad batch of this as I wasnt very impressed with it, but I have since given it another chance and... wow!  This beer is beautiful! It has a very strong, perfumed aroma of good quality yeast and malts, with dried fruits such as cherries & apricots. The taste is yeasty, spicy, fruity with a gentle bitterness at the finish. It is medium bodied with good carbonation, and a smooth mouthfeel. The alcohol is not hidden in this, and at 9.5% it is more of a sipper, but it is now one of my new favourite tripels!

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2013 33 cl bottle. Perfect appearance. Golden yellow with a superb frothy white head. Hazy and cloudy liquid. The aroma is quite malty for a triple, with hints of cereal and caramel. Also hints of alcohol and grass. A floral aroma at the end. The taste is very good. Medium to full body with light to medium carbonation. A little on the bitter and sour side, but with the right balance, making it better than other tripels which tend to go very sweet on the palate, in my opinion. Dry, salty, spicy and long finish, very good indeed. Despite the ABV 9.5%, the alcohol is well hidden, although present in the aroma in a nice way. Overall just great, I think that this is the best triple I have ever tasted.
The beer is a fantastic mix of taste and pleasure. The best to drink in the riny days thinking about the old stories of its monks

#121
Ist das noch Bier? Im Glas natürtrüb-orange. Das Aroma entfernt nach nem Weizenbock, doch vieeeel fruchtiger. Der Geschmack ist unglaublich vielseitig: Malzig-Süß, hefig, fruchtig nach Birne und Pfirsich, äußerst präsent und der Abgang ähnelt einem Obstler nicht unähnlich: Fruchtig-alkoholisch mit wärmender Tendenz; GEIL!! Die nächsten Pullen dürfen bis zum Verfall des Mindeshaltbarkeitsdatum nachreifen.
	
Test vom 6.12.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,12,12,14,12,12 - 12,30

Is Holland heaven?  The fact that you can buy this beer almost anywhere is a good indication in the affirmative...  Great spiciness in this beer, heavy carb, light appearance with a nice, thick body.  High alcohol not really apparent.

Appearance: thick creamy head, rich golden color, canât quite see thru the glass Aroma: fruity, citrus, not very strong aroma Taste: c02 burn initially, thick and heavy feel with hint of citrus, bit of a bitter finish Palate: c02 burn first, then feels thick and heavy, goes down with a bit of a hop aftertaste Overall: probably not something Iâd seek out but can easily finish, hides the 9.5%abv well but you can still kind of taste it ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Chispeante,afrutada.La levadura trapistt se hace notar.Mucho menos carbonatada que una abadia triple.Agradable y viciosa en boca.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2013 Bottle 33 cl. Light golden color with a slight cloudiness. Not the dark color like some of the other trappiste brews (Rochefort 8, Chimay Blue). Flower and yeast aromas. Sweet aftertaste. A little less carbonation than Rochefort 8. Lively and not bitter, crispness is mainly from carbonation and not so much hops which is typical trappiste style. Very good brew, easy to drink. I give it the same rating as the Rochefort 8.

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur dorée légèrement pale, mousse correcte de belle tenue. Arômes fruités (pomme, raisins) et sourtout une superbe amertume. Etonnament rafraichissante pour une bière forte.  Carbonnation moyenne. Trouvée à Roby - Menin
Bottle.
Not the best trappist ale. A little on the winey side. Alcohol is prevalent.  A good beer, nice yeast esters, mild hop presence. But a little disappointing for the style.

Draught, 0.33l. Cloudy golden amber color with thick creamy brownish head and lively bubbles. Aroma of yeast, spicy hops and dry fruits. Taste starts with sweet caramel malt and followed by sour bready and fruity notes. Mouthfeel is very warm while finish is average bitter. Full body, thick texture and lively natural carbonation in palate. Dubbel is better to me, but thats only a slight subjective difference...

330mL bottle to tasting tulip
Molasses, bread, yeast, ginger, caramel, and apple. Clear light yellow with a thin white head and bountiful lacing. Taste is bitter, then sweet, then bitter and acidic. Light to medium bodied, smooth and silky with a late tartness.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2014 great white head, bright yellow colour; spicy, earthy, yeasty and sweet aroma and, perfect harmony of sweetness and bitterness with yeasty background and alcoholic spicy aftertaste as well as dry white wine notes; really good, really dry trappist ale; strongly recommended
this trappist beer has a golden appearance, the aroma is refreshing and taste is a smooth and it is floral tasting leaving an amazing taste on the palate with little alcohol to notice.
Bottle. Sweet, spicy, and loaded with alcohol warmth.  Great autumnal beer.

330ml bottle. Yeast, some sweet and fresh herbal aromas. Pours goldeb, hazy, with a huge white head, persistent, some lacework. Medium body, high carbonated, crispy texture. Taste is sweet, belgian yeasty character, some citrus notes. Aftertaste is dry and short. Classic triple one.

Bottle at De Stove (restaurant), Brugge - 01/12/12.
Lightly hazed golden blonde with a mahoosive frothy white head that retains well.
Nose is caramel malt, Belgian yeast esters, lemon, light hops.
Taste comprises Belgian yeasts, caramel, a good dose of booze, light spiceiness, big on the yeast.
Full bodied, smooth on the palate, little in the way of carbonation, boozey finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Pours a hazy dark golden color with a moderate pillowy white head. Nose has quite a bit of citrus in it with some of that yeasty Belgian style in it. Taste has much the same in it. Meh.

A nice head that dissipates. The scent is of spices, fruit, a touch of alcohol, and grains. The flavor has a dry finish that is very nice. I can taste spices, citrus, grapefruit, minimal hops, grain, and malts. This beverage has a mild bitterness. The palate is hit just a tad by the alcohol content and its dryness. Overall this is a nice relaxing drink. Its worth trying.

Aroma is banana, (maybe pineapple too!), and yeasty notes. Appearance is nice opaque straw-yellow with great head, touch of lace. Taste is malty, banana, pineapple a touch - interestingly. Palate is a nice all round mild bitterness, not at all a watery beer, good spiced hints to top it off. Overall, great tripel, I prefer their dubbel though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
