Hazy blonde with fluffy white head. Dry noble hop nose with candy sugar and yeast esters. Medium body and carbonation, banana and pineapple long dry finish with rasping nettley hop bitterness
Pale with sediments,kind of turbid too, lot of hops,spicy with honey and citrus
Quite spicy and bitter with a rich malt flavor in the bottom. Long aftertaste of anise and dried fruit.

Look: Pale Blonde with sediments, Big soapy white head. Smell: Fruity, hoppy, peppery, spicy, little alcohol, bread dough, perfume notes as well. Taste: Big bread dough up front, spices, fruit sweetness, pears, citrus, nice dry finish. Feel: Medium light body, tight carbonation. Overall: Hops round this brew out nicely. I love Tripels for the sure strength and drinkability. This one is right up my alley. Recommended.

Beer poor golden with a HUGE white head.  The carbonation rockets from the bottom more than any other beer Ive had.  Aroma starts spicy and ends with a huge pear presence.  Fruit carries to the flavor balanced with a mild malty sweetness, peppery flavors and a medium sweetness.  Palate is very fizzy with a medium body, and alcohol bitterness.  Overall very nice and a classic example of the style.

75cl bottle from Belgianbeershop.com. Westmalle Tripel is a hazy pale yellow beer with a moderate white head. The aroma is very yeasty, fresh and fruity (banana, citrus); very inviting. The beer is perfectly balanced between sweetness and bitterness. Its very refreshing, an ideal thirst quencher. Fruity and spicy accents. Moderately bitter finish. Excellent beer, one of my favorites.

Bottle from 2006.  This hasnt traveled well over those 6 years.  Hazy orange/golden color with no head.   Malty and spicy nose with a hint of alcohol.  Alcohol up front on first taste, slight burn that detracts from the malt/hop flavor.   Having had this brew at Café Trappisten in 2004 across the street from the Westmalle Abbey, anything less is just... less.  And this older bottle, not being treated properly, just doesnt do this beer justice.  I do prefer the dubbel but the tripel is wonderful.  I hope to find a fresher bottle and provide a re-rate.
One of the best tripels around. Period...dot.dot.dot...no exceptions, although Id choose a Karmaliet handsdown
On a roll. Another big, beaty, four to the floor, feel the bass beer. Trouser shaker. Smells like summer, taste of cloves again, becoming a habit.

Bottle shared with McTapps. A quality beer for sure. Deep dark with some roasted chocolate aroma. Liked it but after the first sips it offered me just a great and typical belgian nose. Nothing really more.

Bottle bought in bottle shop nearby and shared with MichaelBruch. Surprisingly yellow-golden colour with a very big, steady and creamy head. Taste of excellent fine yeast, green nuts and warm hay. You may notice the strong alcohol but nevertheless it is very easy to drink. Very delicious.
Fruity/bubble gum yeast aroma. Sweet flavor at first; followed by some bitterness, balancing it out. Nice apple-ish fruity flavor. Smooth for 9.5% ABV...
Nose of fruit and bubblegum. Taste  honey, fruity esters, and spice. Very nice brew to finish off a big meal.

Poured from a 330 ml bottle.
Colour is a tone lighter than of honeys, with lots of bubbles. 
Smells of fruit, banana and bubblegum.
Tastes good, fruity, with the alcohol present at the end of the sip.
Medium bodied and medium carbonated.

Bottle. Pours a hazy gold liquid with a thick white head that lasts throughout the sip. Quite fuzzy and thick. Great flavour with spices and honey. Aromas hide alcohol well. Interesting and goo d brew.
One of the reasons why I dont like tripels -- just seemed full of adjunct and soury essence.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Color: blond beer with medium heavy white foam and medium carbonation. Smell: wheat & yeast alliance, malt and caramel. Taste: wheat, yeast, sugar and alcohol, tastefully and explosive. Aftertaste: dry sensation and alcohol.

After one week of standing in a dark and chilled room it poured nicely and clear yellow.  Fruity, hoppy and a slight hint of vanulla aroma. Full and complex taste. Very soft to the palate with a mild alcoholic taste.  Long aftertaste.
Pours a cloudy, dull golden with pillowy white head. Aromas are yeast and booze..some sweet honey and floral aromas. Sweet grassy flavours followed by a boozy finish. Solid bevearge.

#600. Pours a golden straw color with a white foam head that settles to a lacing cap that last for eternity. Nose has yeast, biscuit, cereals, grass, and booze. Taste has all of these elements plus a hint of green apples. Body is light to medium. A great sipper on this blustery Buffalo day.

Golden with a thin head. Aroma is very yeasty. Taste is the same but adds some nice hop bite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is just magic! The taste of this beer is of summer and love. Allthough winter is setting on now, this makes my mind wander onto the spring. This golden Trappist do remind me of a good czech pilsener type with its calm bitterness and balanced hop taste. The head is moderate and not of the insanely fuzzy one, which i like. Allthough its very strong in alcohol with 9.5% its just easy and soothing as a pilsener but this is also better in my opinion.

One of the best trappist Ive ever tasted. The most defining aspects are its sublime appearance, with a pale golden colour with brilliant sparkles which enrich its cloudy aspect, and the second one, its impressive and overwhelming body, full, compact and powerful, without being heavy. Tastes and aroma to toffeee, caramel, brown sugar, flowers (in nose) and cereal. Flavour perfectly structured, with plenty of nuances wisely integrated. Very long development to finish in an elegant and heavenly finishing. Really extraordinary.

Bottle. Hazy amber with a thin layer of bubbles. Nose is orange peel with coriander and malts. Spicy peels and coriander in the mouth. Wakens up on warmth giving a depth of flavour. The taste belies its ABV with very little alcohol burn and lots of coriander and sweet custards. Finish is bitter and rich.
Lovely beer. Light gold color, sudzy white head.Refreshing and crisp, complex and satisfying.nice...
Stirchley Wines Bottle shop at Brum Beer Fest 2012; Pours straw yellow, lively head, cloves and grassy hoppiness, a little bit of spice. Really good beer.

330 mL bottle from Total Wine, Virginia Beach, VA.  Pale yellow pour that appears dark orange in the glass with a pillowy white head.  Aroma of light Earthiness, faint citrus, and barnyard.  The flavor contains some hint of clove and possibly corriander to go with expected floral, citrus, and Belgian yeast notes.  Slight warmth from the alcohol.  An excellent tripel.

Bottle (330ml from Peckhams, Glasgow):
Fruity with a mainly apple smell coupled with a little bit of lemon. There is a lot of spice initially and although not an intense aroma it is a noticeable one. I can detect some pear, yeast and some grain to but everything is very well balanced aroma wise.

Golden orange colour with a huge, three fingers width head that is quite bubbly looking and gradually reduces in size over the course of about five minutes but stops after losing only half its size.

Mix of apples and pears along with a lot of yeast and sugar that combine to make a very sweet, almost cider like drink. There is some lemon and citrus along with a lot of spice and overriding sweetness.

Spicy and quite dry as you would expect but other than that the alcohol is well hidden in this one. There is medium to high carbonation along with full and creamy body.

Alcohol content was very well hidden. The aroma was a little weak but very nice nonetheless and the taste was similar but slightly more pronounced. This one was a great beer that had a good balance.

(From notes 16 Oct, 2012) Bottle. The head is white and very compact; good retention and leaves a thick white blanket on the surface. Color is a clear golden. Aroma is a bit flowery hops, grass, the slightest hint of manure (in a positive way, strangely enough). Overall, the aroma is great, invoking some mental images of its origin. Cant say much about the flavors, except that there is a good balance between malt and hops; not too sweet and not too bitter. Same goes for the finish, which is long and balanced. Mouthfeel is quite creamy, even though the carbonation is average (bubbles are noticeable).This is not the first time Ive had this, and surely not the last. You can find Westmalle Tripel on the crappiest beer menus in Belgium (I had this in an Irish pub) and probably abroad also. However, I might pick this one even if I was looking at an extensive list of beers. This is simply a very good beer!
Slight hops aroma, yeast, alcohol.  Pours a light gold with ample white head.  Hints of fruit.  Good balanced hoppiness.  A little spice/acidic edge.  Light warmth from alcohol.
Bottle, 0.33l. Fruity aroma with carbonated,  spicy strong bitter taste. Nothing special IMO.

As close to perfect as you can get for a triple. These monks know what they're doing!! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2012 Bottle says best before October 06 2013 thus it was one year old. Deep orange hazy gold with a thick puffy white lasting head. Smells full of citrus fruit and mango, malt and a deep cookie under all that alcohol. I hope with some more ageing that will fade. Some spices, like ginger and hay. Medium oily body with soft carbonation. Tastes of malt and spice with alcohol tummy warming. A nice earthiness makes it more of a sipping experience. Apples, raisin, some lemon.The finish is dry with some hops lingering. Nice and complex. Delicious after it aged. Want more.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2013 Gold with wthite creamy foam. Aroma of malt and floral, at taste is light sweet and medium bodied.
29/3/13. Honey and candi sugar aroma.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2014 Large firm white head, golden colour, sweet honey sour and hints of bitter earthy appel smell, bitter sweet(honey like) warm but fresh taste with a medium carbonation, alcohol is there but pretty ballanced, creamy taste medium bitter

Bel dorato opalescente, schiuma pannosa e persistente.
Naso fruttato e speziato, con note di miele e lieviti.....dolce/amara, calda equilibrata e con un finale lungo e persistente.....
molto buona, anche se non ai vertici della categoria.....

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2014 Pours a golden cloudy beer with a nice and firm head. Aroma is yeast and orange. Full body and a warm alcohol feeling. A nice long bitterness and some dryness at the end. Well balanced!
Hazy dark gold. Sweet on the nose. Honey and flowers. Taste is sweet, bready. Taste is sweet and some pineapple. Sort of grassy. A little astringent.

33cl bottle. Pours a bit hazy orange with a great white head. Spicy aroma with hints of oranges and yeast. Flavor is almost the same as the aroma with notes of alchool. Finish is somewhat bitter but great overall
Pours an almost clear, light amber, nice carbonation. Aroma is fruit, fig, no alcohol.  Taste is a nice dark fruit with some alchol. Overall great beer.

Pours a hazy gold colour with a creamy white head that just hangs around beautifully.
Quite fuzzy for a Trappist beer, which I quite like. Great flavour, hides abv well. 
I like this beer a lot.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A tasty trappist, great with fish or pasta dinner. Pours a nice hazy yellow with a golden hue especially in sunlight. The yeast lends itself to a nice bread aroma with clove undertone. Finishes dry and the palette applauds with a nice citrus pep.

Looks like a Hefeweizen when poured. Good long lasting head. Slight white bread aroma. Bubbly mouth feel with perhaps too much fizz. Slightly spicy and wheat taste with lingering slight citrus finish. Surprisingly light. Overall a little boring compared to other Trappist Belgians.
300 ml bottle. Clear golden color. Thick foamy white head. A classic. Excellent Tripel, I recommend it.

Pours a hazy amber into the glass with a white head. Lots of malt on the nose with hints of clove. Spiced malt character on the palate almost like a hefe. Its a respectable tripel but not as complex as others Ive had. It definitely is drier than you might expect. Decent brew though and worth a try.

Rating aggragated from two scores, detailed below.

---

(Fresh) Bottle at North Bar, Leeds. Pours a pale straw yellow, big bubbly head. Aroma is classic tripel - banana yeast, a little citrus, a little spice. Taste is similar - soft banana, a little caramel, classic Belgian yeast, a touch of lemon and orange. Average mouthfeel/body, but suffers from the classic tripel problem of overcarbonation - lifts too much of the beer off the tongue, lessening the taste. Not at all bad, but not outstanding.
7, 3, 7, 2, 16 = 3.5. Rated Oct 2011.

---

Aged bottle (at least 12 years) courtesy of Zak Avery, as thanks for redecorating the Beer Ritz window display. What an utterly, utterly profound change. This is hardly the same beer. Pours a honeyish amber with a ust a ring of white head. So much going on in the aroma - honey, lemon, lemsip, apricot, pineapple juice, toffee apples, sherbet. Taste, though, is remarkably mellow. Apricot, honey, touch of menthol, caramel, lemon, a bit of booze (that doesnt burn). Feels amazing on the tongue, receding from it, leaving a subtle sweetish linger. And, after 12 years, the overcarbonations been sorted! Leaves just a prickle. Utterly, utterly incredible, one of the absolute best Ive ever had.
10, 4, 9, 5, 19 = 4.7. Rated Aug 2012.
Pours hazy golden yellow with a generous white head which reduces to thin and foamy.  Fruity aroma - citrus and banana.  Taste - light sweetness, honey, spice and alcohol.
pours a hazy golden colour with a foamy white head. sweet banana aromas lead into a very dry flavour with more banana and a solid malt backbone which finishs fairly tart.

Poured from a 33 cl bottle. Hazy honey color with a thick long sating head. Aroma of pine and citrus. Lots of carbonation. A hit of peaches and candy sugar. A biting hoppy aftertaste. A very fine example.

Aged almost 2 years .... Clear blonde pour thin creamy white head .... aroma is of citrusy orange, and spicy fruity yeast .... taste of spicy yeast, orangey citrus flavors, light lemon, and light dry abv ..... mouthfeel has the spicy bite from start to finish ... finish is dry with lingering spicy citrusy bite .... lives up to the hype
0,33l bottle. A hazy  orange tripel with a nice white head. The aroma is spicy and slightly sweet with notes of yeast, coriander, malts and hops. The taste is  spicy and sweet again,
Pours hazy golden with a beautiful thick white head. Aroma is grape, lemon, raisiny alcohol. Taste is very strong alcohol, lovely spices, altogether fantastic tripel.

Lemon, spicy yeast, citrus zest, banana aroma. Pours a cloudy pale yellow white a big white head. Taste is sweet, hints of clove with a mild, dry bitterness. Mouthfeel is surprisingly light for the alcohol content, lively carbonation. Aftertaste is dry, sweet, fruity and rather abrupt.

750ml bottle, shared at a small family gathering. Clear golden color, very active-looking carbonation. Very nice thick foamy white head. Ver nice super smooth lighter carbonation. Dry, clean finish. Estery nose. Great fruity aroma. Later pours are murkier with sediment. My family was surprised by the alcohol taste, but I think its very subtle and works well - I dont think this is a style they are used to. Head leaves some ropes and dots of lace. Some banana, light spice aromas. Lightly zesty sweet taste. Excellent Tripel, I really enjoyed it

750ml Bottle sampled in a Gulden Draak tulip and St. Bernies trappist glass, 
this ale had a yellow gold pour with faint orange juice color at the sides of the glass and made a two to three finger white head, the tulip glass had a strong center stream of bubbles with some streams elsewhere in the glass, the St. Bernies trappist glass had carbonation streams everywhere, 
this ale left spots and rings of lacing on the sides of the glass, the bottle had a ¼ wide or more dark ring of sediment on the bottom, 

the aromas were floral hops, faint spice, lemon, light fruit esters, some pale malt and bread, fruit and white sugar sweetness, 

the flavors consisted of pale malt, citrus fruit esters - peach and faint ripe banana, some pepper spice after the finish, a little dough yeast, and the finish was mostly dry, 

the mouth feel was light with a nice creamy feel on the tongue, 

this drink did not wow me like I thought it would, comparing the tulip and trappist glasses, the tulip gave a bigger nose and flavor, and the trappist glass presented a nicer mouth feel.

pours cloudy orange with a small foamy head, lots of fast and slow-moving CO2 streams. Honeyed chamomile on the nose. Alcoholic fizzy sweetness up front (7/10), notes of orange, coriander, malts, chamomile, light sourness, and bitter hops at the finish. Medium-high complexity, med-high depth, good transitions, good carry, good drinkability. This one has an edge in complexity than the dubbel but is more taxing on the palate.
Aroma: cereal, citrus, yoghurt,  vanilla, stonefruit. Color: Golden. Liquid: cloudy, sparkling.medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, medium body, ,
Nice clear golden tripel, did pour as over carbonated so a large foamy head. Aroma of fruits and esters. Taste a bit banana -y, sweetish aftertaste and bitterness.
33cl bottle from cervezalandia. Golden cloudy appearance. Large white head. Low sweetness and medium bitterness. Malt, herby, spicy, hoppy aroma.
I am sucker for Trappist ales.  Very good. I would highly recommend this.  Taste it now.

1 pint 9.4 ounce bottle. It pours a hazy gold with a very large white head. It has the aroma of citrus & spices with a clean & fresh scent. It has a lemony citrus flavor and tastes of coriander, vanilla, pear, non tart apple and has a fresh clean flavor.  This beer is very complex & refreshing.

Citrus pine hop smell. Crisp hop malt citrus taste. Beautiful lacing and head retention. Bitter like a very subtle IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

We sell Belgium Beers!

Says it all. You know the drill, very good, complex yadda yadda. I still dont know what Im talking about.

Pours clear rose gold with a foamy off-white head. Smells of eggshells, pinto beans, graham crackers and aged hops. Tastes of Belgian yeast, peppercorn, light malt, coriander, and booze. Ends with an unquestionable orange taste followed by a slight bitterness. Alright.

Bottle. Pours golden yellow with big fluffy off white head, resilient and well laced. Aromas of noble hops, spice and tart yeast character - a bit of creamy banana. Medium light body, noble hop flavour and spicy yeast character. A touch tart and moderately sour. Finish is dry, but a touch sweet, carmel and creamy.

a triple beer from belgium ( a real trapist as well) thats very common, many peoples favourite. to me its a bit  hollow not so much taste, 10 percent and ( again) to much gas in it, make this a hard one to drink. nice to have now and than but not my favourite. tried it at a warmer temprature as well ( maybe id have more taste than) but still, to much carbonation ...

Slightly hazy light golden colour with a thicker but lighter head. Candy-ish aroma but not as sweet taste. A nice and bitter aftertaste, not too strong or overwhelming but still full bodied and tasty. Very pleasant!
Yellow color with a big head. Taste of hop, slighly thick, dry. Alcohol is not dominant in the taste, but youll notice it later ;-) Really good blonde trappist.
Huge head, white, mostly staying, good lacing, yellow, cloudy, spicy aroma, sweet start with sour/acidic finish, medium to full body, decent beer.

33cl bottle. Pours golden with an impressive 2 finger, surprisingly thick and frothy head. Pleasant citrusy aroma. Delightful taste, hides the 9.5% well. Quite drinkable unlike other very strong beers I've had. Sweet and fruity on the palate. Great after taste. My all around favourite beer. World class, Belgian beer. Highly recommended!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at the fiddler.  Pours cloudy golden with a white head.  Aroma of yeast, wheat, light citrus and fruity.  Flavour is medium sweet and bitter.  Full bodied with moderate carbonation.

75cl bottle. Fruity, crisp bouquet with hints of vanilla and white chocolate. Bright and golden with suspended sediment. A thin head that stays put with some nice lacing. Well-balanced with a lingering bittersweet--reminds me of sweet dandelion. Beautiful mouthfeel--long-lasting carbonation with a full, creamy body that subsides and coats the mouth with a pleasant bitterness. Overall, really blown away. Consistent and "clear-headed," its a helluva Trappist tripel.

A-- Poured a straw gold color, very big head that slowly fizzled away. Left a good one finger of head. Did get some sediment in the glass.

S-- Straw, malt and candied sugar. Reminds me of how Duvel smells. Got me salivating in the back of my mouth.

T-- Complex, get a little sweet and then the burn at the end. Very interesting.

M-- Best of both worlds. Start off light and medium carbonated and then the alchohol gets you in the end. Better mouthfeel when a little warmer.

O-- At 9.5 I would suggest one,sip it, enjoy this puppy. It does creep up on you quick. Wish I got a 750 over a 330.

Overall an excellent beer.  Great beer for the style

golden color with a thick bubbly foam. smells hoppy and fresh from the malts. dry, bitter taste with a clear presence of the yeast. you dont notice the high alcohol % much which makes it a good beer if you wanna get drunk. overall a good yet simple trappist beer.

30cl bottle pours a cloudy golden color with long-lasting white head and good lacing.  Aroma is complex, but mostly of yeast and malt, with some banana, cirtus hops, and leafiness present. Taste goes from salty to sweet to bitter, with a long clean finish. (Alcohol is very well hidden except in the finish)  Body is medium to full with lively carbonation.  A very good Belgian Tripel which Im sure to try again.

750 ml bottle. Pours a yellowish white, feels quite opaque. Very resilient white head. Smells spicy, like mint. Tastes like sweetbread, pepper, mint, flour, wheat. Tad bit of bitterness and peppermint in the finish. Medium bodied, very creamy. Excellent Belgian Tripel. Loved every sip.
Bottle from Alko. Golden color, full white head. Strong, bitter sweet taste with earthy/barnyard flavor, citrus, fruits, toast and wood. Some alcohol in finish. Excellent trappist tripel.

Head: white colored foam. Color: gold. Aroma: malt, hops. Taste: hops, bitter. Palate: dry, much CO2, long lasting. Overall: very good, one of my favorites.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow, with a thick head with fine bubbles.  Nice aroma - a lot of spices, citrus, and yeast on the finish.  The flavor is similar - quite citrus-heavy, with a yeasty tang throughout.  Banana and vanilla come through on the finish.  Nice mouthfeel.  Belgian Tripels arent one of my favorite styles, but this is a solid one.
UPDATED: NOV 17, 2013 Nice aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Memorable. Rated in the past from the bottle.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2013 
Pours hazy amber. The lifetime of the white head is medium-long. The nose is spicy and has citrus, apricot, floral and alcohol notes. The flavor is semi-dry and yeasty in the front, goes through bitter lemon zest, greenish banana, spices and flowers in the mid-palate and leaves a long-lived, dry-sour-bitter and boozy finish in the back. Nice transition. Nice, thick viscosity and medium-high carbonation. A classic for a reason.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with 1in of bright white, lingering head. Lemon, somewhat spicy aroma that is refreshingly pleasant.  Taste is lemon citrus, a bit spicy with a slightly alcoholic finish. Light bodied and effervescent. Overall, a nice, refreshing beer (for 9% ABV!) but I dont feel as though its as good or complex as the darker Trappist Ales.

33 ml bottle at home. 
Pours a clear, orange to yellow color. Big, white foamy head that lasts. Looks really nice and appealing! 
Complex aroma driven by the yeast. Plenty going on, but I find the sweetness of methyl acetate to dominate the picture. 
Taste is both sweet and bitter, with some umami as well?
Good, balanced belgian beer!

Pours a brown colour with a soapy head. Aroma of sweet fruits, caramel and some leaves. Taste is more dark fruits, same caramel and belgian eyast. Sweet finish, but not too much. Really good balance here, one of the best belgian beers!
Muy rica al paladar, sabrosa ligeramente dulce. Suave de textura e intensa de sabor. Recomendable 100%.

Aroma has sweet fruits; citrus, aromatic, apricose and mango; yeast. Lots of nuances. Good aroma. Bit hazy honey yellow. Nice frothy head leaves good lacing.  Some spices and herbs. Taste has yeast, bit sweet and sour. Nice balance. Lots to taste. Even strawberry and sherry? Mango, banana. Long finish. Good nuanced flavor. Medium bodied, bit creamy and perky. Good carbonation. You noticed allready that I liked this one a lot. Like a walk in fresh air after rain in a well kept garden full of fruits and berries. Lots of personality and character. Even let sauna wait while I was enjoying this. Highly recommended.
Clear gold pour with a medium white head. Aroma of citrus, banana and honey. Banana and spice flavor with honey and a cloying sweet finish.

First Trappist ever. I am going to say, Different! The aroma is alcohol citrus sweet, malt some sort of clove lemon. It pours a golden foggy yellow. Looks just like honey with a white soapy head the diminishes pretty fast leaving little lacing. Taste kind of reminds me of a white ale or blonde ale. Bitter with alcohol at firsthand finishes with a rotting citrus after taste. Overall I would drink this over a blonde ale. THink I need to try a few more before I can say if I like it or not.

Attention ! Cette bière est une véritable bombe !!! Dans tous les sens du terme...
Dabord, si vous louvrez sans précaution, elle éclate et déborde comme une fontaine !!
Ensuite, dans le goût, cest larchétype des bières triple...
Noublions pas quhistoriquement Westmalle a été le premier à proposer la dénomination
de triple, et quil la mise en pratique de façon extraordinaire. 
Enfin, nous avons affaire à une triple à 9,5 % abv, ce qui relève dune diablerie du tonnerre.
Donc on  verse prudemment le liquide dans un très beau verre calice de la marque...
On admire la couleur jaune dorée sombre.
Le liquide pétille comme un champagne de la meilleure culture.
La luminosité est très belle mais pas brillante.
La mousse est bien formée et un peu vaporeuse.
Quelle admirable bière dans votre calice . une véritable bénédiction...
Puis on y porte le nez pour respirer des odeurs de citron première classe, de mangue et
de clou de girofle. Le tout nappé dans des céréales...
On porte maintenant les lèvres sur la coupe, et on savoure la texture crémeuse à souhait.
Le premier goût est sur lamertume de la girofle bien fondu dans des céréales maltées,
avec de la prune en primeur et du houblon fleuri. On croit rêver...
La 2ème bouche est sur lorge, la banane flambée, avec une pointe de gâteau de Savoie.
La 3ème est sur la pivoine, le sureau et le pain grillé, avec un équilibre céréales/houblon
extraordinaire et strictement propre à cette bière.
La levure est superbe, fine, souple et crémeuse. Noublions quelle sera la souche dautres
bières de premier niveau.
Le suivi est bien marqué et fortement soutenu par les 9,5 abv. Alcool fort certes, mais nuancé.
La finale est un feu dartifice sublime de saveurs, de nuances et déquilibre. 
Un sommet de lart brassicole. 
Je cote sur la base de 5 , mais comme cest une triple, cest un triple 5 ... donc 555 sur 100 !
( ceux qui connaissent mes notations savent quil y a encore mieux . Les autres prendront
plaisir à chercher  Le jeu en vaut la chandelle, divine bien sûr ...)

Golden/orange and a little hazy with a medium creamy head leaving a nice lace. Smell of fresh malt, hay and a bit of berries. Tastes quite sweet in the beginnig while later a pleasing bitterness arises. At the end spicy with caramel notes. full body, crispy,  long finish.
Barva: zlatá, pěna bílá hustá. Vůně: malinová. Chuť: výrazně plné pivo s chmelovým dozvukem a výraznou sladovoz chutí.

Poured into specific "Westmalle" glassware. Beautiful yellow color and thick head. Aroma of pure malt and hops intertwined to create a mouth watering smell. High carbonation and full mouth feel. This beer was delicious and is one of my favorites. Trappist beer delight

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of the best triples in the world, if not the best.
Beautifull color, troubled by the yeast.
Nice smell, no annoying side smells.
Excellent taste - strong in alcohol but never the taste of the alcohol. As a true triple should be.
Pours cloudy copper with one finger of white head. Aroma of yeast, cloves, wheat, and butterscotch. Taste is sweet, butterscotch, and spices. This is a very good tripel.
Good flowerish aroma, but with a little metallic odour. Nice yellow, cloudy beer with a big thin white head. Very strong taste, but with a nice round finish of caramel and malt.
Nice Ale, white head , not my first pick but deservers attention. 9.5 % alcohol and you can taste and smell it a abit.
Drinking this is like getting a punch in the back of your head. Even having a strong taste, it pleases everyone!

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a big frothy white head. Aroma is citric and mellow, dank and herbal with some earthy and slightly funky notes. Flavor starts with some of the citric lemon, dry and herbal with some spice coming in, the funk is still there and creeps up to dominate the finish. Medium to full body and a soft carbonation.

A: Yellow, straw hues, slightly hazy, enormous whipped meringue head, long lasting retention, nice lacing. Hard to ask for more.

S: Very distinctive Belgian yeast character, slight alcohol, spices, fruits.

T: Fluffy and light. I always look forward to drinking any trappist ale. Fruity and spicy, Westmalle Tripel is well balanced and very flavorful.

M: Light body, slight warming alcohol finish.

D: A great beer that Id certainly drink again.
Fantastic trippel, classical choice when drinking a belgian trippel. Recommended to beginners and experts.
Strong bitter taste, you can feel power of this beer. White, really good foam, stays very long. "Honey" colour. Good Belgian tripel.
This is the beer I judge all Tripels against.  Not too sweet, not too dry, perfect.  Stay thirsty my friends.

Pours cloudy golden colour with one finger head. Smells of dark fruits and malts. Taste includes dark fruits, a little citrus, caramel malt and little spicey. Overall a very good beer, without being amazing.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2016   0.33 bottle.   Looks pretty decent with its heavy, cloudy, deep yellow color and a nicely contrasting, completely white head. Aroma is composed mostly of coriander, various citrus scents, and typical Belgian yeasts. Taste is sweet, very yeasty, spicy, full of character and undiluted. A medium body and a slightly sticky texture, carbonation can be defined as average. Finish is medium long and noticeably more herbal than the rest. Overall it is a good beer which I enjoyed thoroughly - the only blemish is its imperfectly hidden alcohol content... almost there.
From the bottle. Citrusy, bready, touch of alcohol (but the 9.5% is well hidden), hazy yellow in colour, lovely foam which hangs about. A mesmerising beer.
bread, citrus, alcohol, golden, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, average carbonation, long finish,

It pours gorgeous ochre with a slight reddish tint; the head is off-white and thick, like whipped egg-whites. The aroma has notes of: almonds, blood-orange jam, Belgian Candi-sugar, alcohol, barnyard-funk, coriander, and rye-bread. The taste is medium tart and finishes medium bitter and dry; there are notes of: coriander, sour-dough bread, blood-oranges, alcohol, lemon-pith, and Belgian Candi-sugar. The palate is full-bodied, medium carbonations, big mouth-feel (foamy), with a medium finish. Overall it was  a phenomenal Tripel. This beer shows that a Tripel is not just a watered down Quadrupel .
This is certainly one of the best beer in the world. The taste is bitter and fruity. The color is foggy and the foam is strong.
La reine des bières. This is a really fabulous beer. Served not too cold (10 degrees centigrade) its palate, appearance and tast will rank the top, as far as I am concerned.
UPDATED: SEP 12, 2012 0,33 fl hjemme: nydelig aroma og flott skum som varer. Deilig balanse sødme-bitterrhet og litt citrus. Et farlig godt øl.

My perfect beer. Tastes like dreams and happiness. Crisp, clean, and sharp. Maybe an inkling of citrus, definately sunshine. This beer is perfect for a warm day. Refreshing and intoxicating. Champainge bubbles with nice head. Lattice bubbles on glass. Golden color with monstor taste. This is the shit. Thank you God for this amazing beer!

Una delle triple migliori che abbia mai bevuto, anzi forse la migliore. Ottimo aroma fruttato, sapore di frutta matura molto morbido, birra beverina nonostante la gradazione alcolica che però al contrario di altre birre si fa sentire anche se non da affatto fastidio, retrogusto che ti riempie la bocca ed è duraturo!

Bottle. Cloudy, light brown colour with a nice white head. Aroma has toffee and some malts and floral notes. Taste is sharp, the alcohol hits you first. After that you get some cherry and yeast.  This ones an alright trappist but not my favourite for sure.

33 cl bottle at home. Pours clear, sparkling golden witha large, big bubbled, off-white head that leavrs good lacing. Wooden, spicy, sweet, fruit, floral yeasty caramel nose. Sweet, spicy, bitter and alcoholic. Full bodied. Fitting carbonation. Dry tongue. Shortish mouth but a long and pleasant aftertaste. Balanced and formidable. Worked really well with breast of duck and a creamy sauce.

0.75l Bottle pour: Orange-yellow with thin head. Aroma of pineapple, banana, starwberries, citrus, spice. Taste phenolic spicy, wheat cracker, fruit, alcohol. Dry mouthfeel, alcohol hidden but noticeable, some astringency and powdery yeast. Very enjoyable

Very, but, really very hazy golden color.  You cant even see your finger through the glass.

Its smell complexity. Departs from banana (strongly), goes to citrus hops, and lands to spicy (coriander for sure).

It tastes what smells but more sourish. Not bad, but the carbonation gets you even if YOU do not want it.

This aspect (medium-high carbonation) let me less excited. But in the overall it  is a good Trappist. Thumb up!
Aroma does notsmell very good.  Hints of orange.  Very light body.  Sorry if strange finish with a spicy taste.  All in all I was not a fan of this beer.

Golden color with nice thick lasting head. Hoppy malty aroma. Taste is hoppy with hints of herbs, and spices. Lasting aftertaste indicative of the taste.

Pours musty yellow with 2 finger head that doesnt disappear.  Aromas of spice and yeast, cellar, bananas, wheat, earth.  Very spicy with lots of wheat flavors, great carbonation with a lot of bright acidic tones.  Distinct alcohol flavor pervades the palate and gives a little edge to the entire drink.  The banana aroma balances the acidic tones.  I rather wish I could live up to the vows trappist monks take if it meant I could have a little of this all the time.

Pours yellow with a thick pillowy head. Nice aroma of biscuit, lemon and cloves. Nice dry palate and taste with good clove spiciness. Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

First things first.  Don?t drink this straight out of the fridge.  Let it warm up.  Aroma is pine, citrus zest, dry beach sand, and a bundle of hay stored in an old barn with a thin layer of dirt spread across a damp old-fashioned concrete floor. A soft breeze carries the scent of a Belgian spring through the aged lumber, completing the complexity of its boquet. Color is cloudy golden with plenty of foam.   Initial taste is mild bitterness with a full bitter finish, but nowhere near IPA bitter.  Mouthfeel is thin with tingly and prickly carbonation.  Overall a good golden tripel.  If you take it too cold, you?ll get nothing but alcohol and hops, so be sure to let it warm up before drinking.  The only downside to any Belgian golden ale is that the carbonation tends to clash with the pine-citrus aroma.
It smells a bit citrus-fruity, fruity-yeasty. The taste is bitter-citrus, alcoholic-fruity. In the aftertaste it is stronger. Interesting Trapist! 9/11/10/12/11/11

Aroma is elegant and light. Fruity and smooth taste. Bitter-fruity after taste is well balanced. Delightful color enriches enjoyment.

The cream of the crop!  Brilliant head that withstands time.  Palate is full with sensations hitting every part of tongue.  Aroma is out of this world!

Pale yellow, a bit cloudy beer with a large, light head. Aroma is a bit floral and citrus. Delicious, sweetly fruity taste. Finish is a bit alcoholic but not too much. Palate is average and sparkling.
Very little in the way of aromas.  Sweet malt with a little astringent hop flavors. Overall a good triple.

Pours pale yellow with a big fluffy white head. Nose is peppery, ginger, belgian candy and hay. Taste is well balanced bittersweet but sides more on sweet. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean. Medium body and a great long aftertaste.

330ml bottle. Cloudy golden colour with huge firm frothy lacing white head. Yeasty and fruity aroma, banana, spices. Yeasty, spicy and fruity taste. Lacks intensity and complexity relative to most other Trappist beers.
Bottle. Cloudy gold with bubbly head. Yeasty, spicy (pepper?), malty. Thin, almost incomplete body. Smooth texture despite carbonation.
330ml bottle. Bright yellow color. Smwll fizzy white head. Yeast dominates in aroma. Dry, yeasty bitter taste. Fizzy. Not bad.

Bottle 330 ml. Hazy golden/orange beer with a small long lasting white head. Nice lacing. Aroma of citrus (lemon), spices (coriander?) and yeast. Taste is medium sweet with lemon/orange peel, spices and malts notes. Mouthfeel is impressive. Big body with a really nice balance of warming alcohol and bitterness that leave the palate dry. If you search an abbey tripel, its exactly what you get here. Perfect example of the style.

Smells a bit funky. Kind of old smelling. Taste is great though. Rich and bold yet smooth. Nice spice. Lemon pepper. Coriander. Dry spice. Delicious. Not sure if it isnt surpassed by some of the new wave trippels like golden monkey and la fin du monde amongst others. Still a great beer.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2015 Color giallo carico con una soffice schiuma bianca piuttosto spessa. Al naso è speziata con sentori di fieno, agrumi, malto, lievito e una parvenza di speziato; il gusto è mediamente amarognolo e luppolato controbilanciato da note dolciastre fruttate, mielose e caramellate.
