Opaque mustard gold. Pineapple nose. Subtle fruits blend with high carbonation to make a food friendly, yet complex drink. Clean and fresh mouthfeel and a dry finish.

From the 11.3 oz. bottle stamped: 14/06/13-3-003325.  It pours a cloudy looking pale yellow with a small fizzy head.  The aroma is of yeast, pale malts, spice, and tart fruits akin to pineapple.  The body is medium to bold. The taste is both tart and sour with a spiced, dry hopped ending. This is something that you need to be in the mood for.

Aug 2008: Normal brown 33cl bottle. This one has been hanging around my garage for a couple of years or so. It had been left with a few other goodies boxed up waiting for me to break open when my regular beer stock began to shrink a bit. Best before 30th Oct 2008, so fairly old I guess and ready to go!

Poured into my Westmalle Trappist Challice (what else would you use, if you had one?).

I tried to pour it without getting any sediment into the glass, but I got excited and the whole bottle ended up within the challice. A few bits floated around in a golden hazy cloud of beer. On top sat a thin covering of white bubbles, which were forever being replenished by a rising torrent of other bubbles.

The aroma is all about degrees of sourness and how your nose picks it out. Fruit smells range from Gooseberries to Grapefruit through the spectrum of fruity colours available to man.

The taste is a explosion of flavours, fizzy and different. A bitter sweet mix of the best Belgium has to offer in a glass of Tripel.

The alcohol is evident throughout, but it doesnt detract from the overal complexity and pleasure this beer seems to exude.

A very, very good beer. I have loved it for years and forgot about my little pack of Belgian beers stashed away, some more crackers to come!
Appearance is large white head with hazy orange. Aroma is a sweet citrus. Taste is lots of wheat with some sweet citrus and alcohol kick. Overall very solid.

Pours a murky golden orange, with a two finger head. Aroma is peach, apple, grass, citrus, spice, alcohol, bread, banana, yeast - nice and complex. Carbonation leads the attack on the palate but immediately gives way to an exquiste balance of medium sweetness and bitterness, very complex and pleasant with a long finish and a wonderful medium bodied oily mouthfeel probably due to the high alcohol content, which is exceptionally well blended and hidden. Absolutely loved this one, what a fantastic beer! I thought I was a dubbel man, but Im now re-thinking...

Wow ... this might be a perfect beer! I wrote some notes down while tasting half of the bottle, and then looked at some of the reviews -- and I think that I am not alone in loving this beer. 

I picked this beer up on the recommendation of the woman at a bottle shop in Belgium (store description and location, below). This woman is a saint! What a great recommendation.

Appearance: (5.0) The tulip glass looked amazing with the gold color of the beer and eggshell head from the Triple.

Smell: (5.0) Hints of citrus, a little pepper and some apple. As the beer warmed, the smell became more pronounced.

Taste: (5.0) A good spice came through ... very nice. A small amount of alcohol.

Mothfeel (5.0) Good malt with slight carbination. 

Overall (5.0) This must be the gold standard for all Belgian beers. 

*** Le Moine Austère ***
Just up the road from us in Beligum, is a wonderful bottle shop called the Austere Monk (Ill review it after BA adds it: Le Moine Austère, Rue Dorez 8, Tournai, Belgium) (a review: http://www.monnuage.fr/point-d-interet/le-moine-au My wife and kids found the shop while touring the Grand Place and visiting the Christmas village. The family was excited to bring me to the store and even sent a few photos of the wall of bottles. 

As I looked at the selection, I instantly wished that I knew more about Belgium beers. I understand a little French and shopkeeper was willing to bring to me some of the local beers and the traditional favorites. (Side note: it is *very* helpful to have a wife that speaks and understands French!) She pointed out which beers were still made by monks (down to five, she said), and those breweries which tend to create craft beers. She loves to make gift baskets, filled with beers, glasses and other treats. I cant wait to return!

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-30-2011 00:36:59
UPDATED: MAY 12, 2012 Floral aroma that leans to nailpolish, spicey, vanilla, cloves with a very fruity taste. Apple, ginger and peaches. Bitterness has a dry finess.

Pours hazy golden with a huge head. Decent malty/banana hinted aroma. Taste is excellent. Strong fruity taste, malt, hint of banana, yeast and alcahol. Noticable bitterness. Plenty of carbonation, full bodied mouthfeel. Very decent beer
Nice golden, cloudy color.  Pours with nice frothy head.  Lots of carbonation.  Light bitter taste, acidic/citrus.  Lingering, slightly bitter aftertaste.  Very tasty.

Poured from 11.2oz bottle to tulip:

Pours a glowing straw gold with a massive, white, loose-gauge head and distinctive lacing.

The nose on this one is unsurpassed. I pray to god Westmalle comes out with an air freshener someday. Sweet bread and esters, clove, banana, subtle fig, cereal, more yeast.

The taste is almost equally as impressive. Its more pronounced than most tripels Ive had. Huge yeast, some alcohol, sweet bread, pear, banana, very good.

The alcohol is more prominent than others in the style but it doesnt detract from the overall perfection of the beer.
Bottle. Yellow with huge dense head. aroma koriander, citrus, grass. Taste sweet malt, citrus, quite warm alcohol a quite hoppy and dry finish.

(First Taste, Home, 330mL Bottle, Vintage July 2011, Tulip, 9.5% ABV, Cellar Temp, 07/05/2012. #37.


Appearance (4/5): Pours a slightly hazy (but surprisingly clear for a Trappist ale) light golden yellow with a frothy, white, one finger, lasting head with decent lacing. A little sediment.

Aroma (8/10): Dominant yeasty cheese and barnyard notes, clove, cinnamon, and cardamom spiciness, and lemony citrus, with toffee, perfume, and spruce notes.

Taste (8/10): Very spicy and smoothly bitter with yeasty undertones. Still has the sweet opening youd expect from an abbey ale, but quite muted. Has a salty/savory finish. Alcohol is definitely present on the tongue.

Palate (4/5): Medium/full body, lively carbonation, oily texture that has a slick, dry finish. Warming and satisfying. Very smooth. The saltiness adds a bit of substance.

Overall (17/20): Pretty good. Not exactly my favorite Trappist beer, but it does well and has a unique savory note that isnt at all unpleasant. Reminds me a little of Dieu du Ciels Blanche Neige for some reason. Good for cold weather. 

Drinkability: 3/5. Character: 4/5. Buy Again: Probably No.
Smooth Triple, nothing too crazy but Pretty good overall. Loved the chalice it was served in.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a thick sudsy head that stays forever. Aromas of yeast, bananas, cloves, and various spices. Tastes very doughy and a bit buttery with a good amount of an alcohol burn. Quite fizzy on the tongue as well. Very well balanced but I feel left wanting more out of it. Dont get me wrong, this is a fantastic brew, just one I am slightly disappointed with.

Poured from bottle.  Aroma of fruit cocktail and banana.  Cloudy golden with white head that stays.  I taste apple, malt, cinnamon, banana and a slew of spices including coriander, white wine basil.  Alcohol in the back.  Im actually catching s hint of cocoa in the aftertaste.  There is a sweetness that becomes more noticed as I drink.  A fine beer - better than mint julep on this day.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Smells like a wheat beer, banana, clove etc. Taste is mostly yeast, bread, some spice. Theres nothing thats super amazing about this beer, flavour wise. However its really easy to drink and hides the high alcohol content well. Typical of Trappist beers and this is deserved of its high ratings.

330ml bottle. Light yellow body, a little cloudy, a huge soapy white head leaving some lacing.
Nose is yeasty, with a good dose of orange peel, tons of grassy hops, strong alcohol tickling, spices, some dried apricot. Alcohol is the first thing you notice in your mouth, then the yeast, followed by a generous amount of bitter hops, a late malt sweetness tries to smooth the aggressiveness. Lots of carbonation. Very good tripel, a little too harsh for my taste though.
The low score isnt an indictment of the beer, so much as the style of beer it is. Too much yeast, but it does have a very smooth texture and mouthfeel to it. Its like liquid bread.

Bottle from Preporská pivotéka. Medium white head, rather short duration. Hazy golden colour. Lively carbonation as far as I can see. Aroma of citrus fruits (orange), caramel, honey, spicy. Taste is initially medium sweet with some light bitterness in the background. Progressively turns less sweet and more bitter towards finish, light sourness also appears middle-way. The finish is mostly bitter. The mouthfeel is creamy, thick. Well balanced, excellent.

Bottiglia da 33cl. Color biondo dorato con schiuma bianca, abbondante di grana media abbastanza persistente. Al naso non grandi profumi solo poche note mielose e un leggero caramello. Al palato risulta una birra corposa dove fa da padrone lalto tasso alcolico con note mielose e pepate che danno un leggero pizzicore sulla lingua, per fortuna  chiude con un amaro delicato. (sinceramente mi aspettavo qualcosa di più sconvolgente sia come profumo che come sapore).

Apariencia: color amarillo dorado turbio, corona abundante, consistente, persistente y de burbuja muy fina.
Aroma: intenso, se nota sobre todo el olor de la levadura: típico olor de panadería, galleta, corteza de pan...ligeramente afrutado, frutas blancas.
Sabor: también muy intenso y complejo, muchos matices, seco y especiado, se notan los lúpulos. Mucho cuerpo, sabor muy largo, alcohol bien integrado.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2012 Initially clear, but when poored out completely hazy golden light orange color with nice foam head. Nice bitter taste with some caramel and orange. High alcohol, but that is not killing taste. Good beer. (Velp 201110)

The mother of all tripels. Ive tried this a number of times and to really enjoy at its peak whatever you do, dont refridgerate! Due to its easy availability over here in Holland its tempting to drink the same day as purchase. I would advise to leave in a cellar or anywhere below room temperature for at least a week beforehand. Open the bottle and let it breathe for a few minutes. The medicinal taste is then at its best. The carbonation is amazing, similar to champagne. Ive only found this exact carbonation with Westvleteren Blond. Its incredible stuff, really

UPDATED: APR 24, 2015 Hazy orange color with a big foamy head. Aroma of sweet malt, some orange zest, yeast, grassy notes, flowers. Taste full, sweet and alcoholic. Orange notes some pepper, low carbonation, a little metallic note in the finish that is otherwise fairly dry.
UPDATED: JUL 11, 2013 Hazy orange colour with huge head. Aroma is spices, yeast. Flavour is yeast, fruity, spicy, dry finish.
Fruity, slightly yeasty aroma. Great oragnge-gold color. Appears slightly cloudy. Fair head retention. Hoppy flavor. Hint of a mix of herbs. A good beer.

Bottle. Wow, what a brew. Colour is not all too striking, with a lightly hazy orange and a nice thick creamy head. The aroma is a bit more striking though, with a very nice fruity chewing gum-ishness (in the most positive imaginable way), orange and plum. The body is nice and thick, and the carbonation is at a near perfect level for this beer. The flavour starts of quite malty, with some caramel notes, and develops into a yeasty bitterness giving a nice dry finish that also has some alcohol notes. Brilliant!

Bouteille 330 ml. Couleur blonde, collet blond. Arôme dalcool, malt et agrume. Goût sucré. Une bonne bière
Bottle 330 ml. Blond with a white head. Aroma: alcohol, malt, citrus. Sweet taste. A good beer.
pours light yellow. smells of citrus and yeast. nice dry finish. great beer.

330 ml bottle. It says on the bottle to serve it after letting it rest for a few days and cooling it to 8 - 14° C. Pour it carefully. The yeast should be let at the bottom of the bottle and enjoyed seperately. Tastes great. Belgians know how to brew proper beer!

Bottle 330ml.
Pours clear blond with good white head, featuring good lacing. Aroma is of citrus and spices. Taste is of citrus, yeast, alchool. Bitter finish. Nice balance. A good, classy beer.
11.2 oz bottle pours golden with a white head.  Aroma of spice and a bit of bananas.  Taste the malt, bananas, yeast and some spice.

Shared a 25.4 oz bottle with the wife.  Not my favorite style of beer, but amazing beer is amazing beer.  Smells yeasty and sour with a hint of banana.  Beautifully cloudy and golden.  Tastes as it smells...sour and yeasty.  Smooth and velvety in the mouth.  Again...amazing brew.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2012 Bottle at home...

Love this beer. Pours straw yellow with a decent head. Somewhat sweet going down with a slight bitter / sour aftertaste. Decent balance of hops and malt.

750ml bottle best before: 15/11/12. Poured in a 12oz tulip. Great clear golden color. Aroma of hay, toffee, banana, orange peel. Taste is in line with aroma with a great dry finish. Just a touch of hop at the end. Overall one of the best tripels out there.
Acidic, light head, extremely cloudy,a tang fills your mouth that stays for a great length of time

Uber-cloudy straw yellow. Huge, puffy, lilywhite head. Tiny bubbles.

Aroma is lemon and Belgian funk. Touch of orange peel. There is an earthy undercurrent; mushrooms? There is some serious funk here, very peppery, with some horseblanket/barnyard stuff. Touch of cooked vegetables.

Spicy cloves, orange peel and lemon. Very spicy funk. A little bubblegum with some hay and some sweet malts. Very little bite. 

Very fizzy and bubbly feel, but creamy on the back end. Its a very solid beer, although somewhat horsey.

11.2 oz bottle poured into a goblet.  States a best before date of 6-14-13.  Cloudy pale straw color with a one finger white head.  Smells of citrus, lemon, woody, earthy and spicy.  Tastes of spice/pepper, lemon and citrus.  Its got some alcohol burn to it in the finish that lingers.  It dances on the tongue.  Not as refreshing as Duvel and has more body to it.  Another good tripel.  Balanced, complicated and refreshing but still very flavorful and high in alcohol.
Bottle shared in Seattle. Nice spices in the sip - non-beer drinkers should even enjoy this one.

Too dry for my liking. I guess you could say its balanced, the malt and hops back-and-forth is just about right. But theres a hell of a lot of alcohol in the flavor. This is the kind of beer Id recommend to my friends who generally prefer booze to beer.

Excellent balance of crispiness and complexity.  I find it thin-bodied but with bold complexity, which is quite surprising and rewarding.  Every element balances out perfectly.  Alcohol is evident throughout--in the nose, the palate, and after.  Beautiful frothy head.  Its complexity and alcohol presence overpower the citrus, making it less refreshing than other citrus brews.  But this IS a tripel, so its not supposed to be just refreshing.  A very strong brew, with very active carbonation.  A little tart on the tongue as it goes down, but overall the taste is VERY GOOD.

A golden pour with a substantial light creme head. Moderate lacing on the the glass.  The scent is dark fruits and spice.  Earthy.  The taste was a real surprise.  Wheat, mild hops, strong carbonation, but in perfect proportions to be simply delicious.  I'm an instant fan.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A - banana, bubblegum and light citrus.
A - light gold and hazy with thick head
T - sweet and light sour with melow hoppy bitter
P - mid and soft
O - its special
Aroma of coriander, cloves and yeast. The taste is bready, with notes of banana and butter. A mild sweetness in the long finish. Full bodied and satisfying.
Honey, lemons, champagne medium dry and mild spicy blond/triple ale of extreme strength which is masked by the quality of the overall product. Very, very good.
Une très bonne bière. Une amertume marquée et un goût très agréable. Assez raffraîchissante.
Bottle.  Great aroma, sweet taste with a smooth finish.   Really enjoyed this beer.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2012 Towering long-lasting head over a opaque deep honey-like gold. Faint aroma of grains and yeast with very light spice scents. Bitter bite thats well balance with plenty of spice and light fruity notes. Crisp and satisfying dry finish.

Bottle, poured a light golden color, with huge frothy head.  Aroma of spice, light belgium yeast, grains.  Light bitter, light sweetness.  Ends with a dry finish.  Slightly above ave cabonation; champaign-like.  This is an interesting trappist trippel. Quite spicy, straight to the point, and dry.  Very good. I think I like the dubbel better though.

Pours cloudy golden yellow with a big fluffy white head. Smells fresh and fruity with some spice and flowers. Taste has notes of spice and fruit with dry hop presence. Texture is silky, almost creamy. Med carbonation. After taste is dry with a little citrus and alcohol. Everything is well balanced and elegant.

Bottle. Clear pale golden colour with white head. Dominant peach aroma with a little bubblegum, strong bitterness, high carbonation. Medium to short finish and heavy body. Pretty good, but memories from the bottle shared with my husband in Brussels last autumn were better.
Årgång 2003. Stor jästfälling (stora klumpar). Ganska het kolasmak, torr eftersmak men hyfsat trevlig

33cl bottle. Fluffy white head. Nice shady grainy color. Aroma of yeast and honey. Among flavours you could find banana and pineapple with a hint of caramel. A lot of expressions. One of the best banana splits money can buy!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle from Discount Liquor Milwaukee. Pours a golden, light amber color with a white head. Aroma is fruity, yeasty, a little boozy. Medium on the palate with smooth, soft carbonation. Flavor is sweet, bready, yeasty, a little alcohol, with a spicy finish. Very tasty.
bottle. Yellow-orange opaque pour. Aroma is spice, yeast, some banana. The taste is spicy and boozy. A bold beer, nothing very subtle. Very good, but Ive had better tripels.

Hazy gold pour, 2 fingers of puffy head.  Aroma of citrus fruit, yeast,  a bit of barnyard funk,  pineapple, banana.  Yeasty taste, banana wheat pineapple, slight spiciness slight hint of booze, toffee, lots of lacing.  Damn good.

Aroma is niet overweldigend. Geurt niet gigantisch. Kleur is geel met een goede witte schuimkraag die aardig blijft zitten. Smaak is hop, gist met een beetje citrus, een klein beetje caramel/honing en veel koolzuur. Prima trappist die lekker wegdrinkt.

Aldus Huubs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 mL bottle. Pours a cloudy golden-orange with a huge white head. On the nose are fresh citrus with orange and lemon zest, followed by earthy, biscuity malts, banana esters, pineapple, peach, peppery spice and some grassy/piney hops. Mouth feel is oily with medium carbonation Taste-wise: toffee malt, strong aromas of Belgian yeast, peach, pear, orange peel, tropical fruit esters, cloves, black pepper, and a hint of oak. Some hop bitterness comes in near the end with a good dose phenolic funk. The finish is medium-long, medium bitter and peppery, leaving grassy hops and citrus. Very complex and well balanced; one of the best Trappist brews Ive had thus far.

330mL from LCBO. Poured into a Duvel tulip, hazy pale gold with a huge frothy white head that filled the glass and left huge swaths of lacing. Aroma of pale malt sweetness, lots of yeast, some citrus and grassy hops, subtle spice. Flavour is less sweet than expected, again pale malt but more grainy than sugary, lemon, yeast, a little spice. Grassy hop bitterness kicks in promptly, quite dry and peppery especially on the finish; lean, mineral and a little tart. Fair bit of alcohol heat on the finish for the style, maybe because of dryness? Mouthfeel is moderate and a little oily, with nice soft carbonation. A brisk, refreshing but complex tripel on the spicy rather than fruity side.

A typical but very nice tripel.
Golden color with nice carbonation and foam.
Citrus and malty aromas and taste.
Very refreshing and nice.

Bottle at Kulminator, March 2012. Vintage 2003.

Clear light amber with a small head. This was tastier than a "normal" Tripel, because of aging? Dark fruits, some alcohol, malt, grass and some floral notes. The body was on the thick side, not that much alcohol.

Another Tripel ;-). Poured from a bottle into a Trappist Glass, Hazy gold in color with a generous head which stays very well, really just screams tripel from appearance to taste, aroma is subtle but unmistakable, Good carbonation, slight tang and good warm feeling as an after effect. Really wonderful

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2012 pours hazy bright golden with a creamy white head, good retention and lacing. lightly toasted malts, hint of caramel, bready, honey, peppery, fruity, dry grassiness, hint of sweet grains, complex, spicy. white port. lively and soft, full body, medium long floral-grassy-citrusy finish. awesome!

Bottle enjoyed at home
Well well, this is a beer ive had alot of times the last 12 years, but first time since i joined RB. It pours golden hazy with a massive white head. Takes a while to pour.  Smells of belgian yeast esters, malts, alcohol some hops and spice. Super malty taste, classic belgian triple, tons of sweetness, spice, clove and grass. Thick feel, full bodied, intense bitter finish. A very malt driven beer that still contains alot of interesting hops. Totally a very complex beer with alot of aromas and tastes. I seem to have the need to compare beers like this to others, so i have to take it up against the other Trappist big brothers. Rochefort and Westvleteren are some tiny mm above, Orval too i think. But hey, this is a world class beer for sure

330ml bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a slight orange hue. Frothy white head with strong retention. Aroma of spice, and yeast with a slight hint of citrus. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. no visible carbonation but its present in the mouth-feel. Fantastic and unusual body to this beer. Finish is very dry and slightly woody/bitter.. In comparison to La Fin du Monde Id say this beers more bitter, less sweet and uses a different yeast. Im a big fan of the Unibroue yeast used in La Fin. Next La Fin du Monde is a bit more fruity.

From the bottle, pours a hazy yellow with big creamy head. Aroma carries straw, yeast, floral hops, citrus. On the palate rather oily feel, with a prominent alcohol warmth on the back end. Lovely Belgian brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy deep yellow with mountains of tight foam.  Aromas - lots of citrus, combined with straw, pepper.  Taste is dry, bitter, touch of sour.  Pretty intensely dry.  Alcohol is there, maybe more than Id like.  Its light, but definitely a sipper.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2017 May 11, 2017
330ml bottle.  Best before of 02/02/17.  Left this guy in the cellar to see what it did with the hops.  Pours a lightly hazy gold with some serious sediment floaters, and a huge off-white head.  On the nose, sweet dried light fruits (sultanas, apricots), with faint honey like notes, caramel, and a faint floral note.  Taste wise, sweet with candy like white grape juice, sultanas, spice, faint alcohol burn, and a tiny bit of minerality that leads into similar sweetness with more pronounced mineral bitterness and a tiny bit of soapiness in the finish.  I definitely enjoyed this more this go-round than last.


Original rating, March 13, 2012 - 3.6
330ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a large creamy white head.  Aroma is lemon citrus, sweet malt, white grape juice, yeast, candied tropical fruit.  Taste is sweet, with 9.5% alcohol very much present.  Again, lemon citrus, with dried fruit, grapefruit pith, yeast, mineral notes and a very serious dry bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours a hazy straw colour. Lasting white "steamed milk" head.  Aroma is orange, dough, alcohol, pepper. Oily feel. Sweet up front with a bitter boozy finish.  Pretty nice balance, could probably use a little more time in the bottle. Not much complexity but this is definitive tripel style.

0.3l bottle from LCBO, served in a chalice. Appearance: Cloudy orange yellow, large fine white head that dissipates slowly. Aroma: hops, banana, cloves, cinnamon. Palate: medium bodied, though quite thick. Smooth start, dry finish. Taste is sweet and spicy. Very good.
Bottled. Pours hazy pale yellow with a huge white head. Smells and fruity, spicy and malt, abit alcohol with a similar finish.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2014 July 2014 update: definitely seems that the alcohol is better hidden than in the last one two years ago, although still pronounced. Pours straw with lots of foamy head and and lots of lacing. Nose is light yeast and some lemon. Notes of yeast, lemon, some pepper and grassy hops. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter with a lasting dry bitterness and spicyness. Medium body somewhat creamy with lively carbonation and the peppery bite. Awesome!

Lovely big beer. Big straw, cereal up front, with come good floral hop in the middle. Finish is very dry with a beefy alcohol burn. Pours pale with a light head that dissipates quickly to a small froth that lasts awhile. Alcohol burn is pretty pronounced. Be interesting to cellar this for awhile to see if it mellows at all.
UPDATED: MAR 19, 2012 E una Trappista e quindi per forza buona. Detto ciò la birra risulta "granosa" con  venature erbacee e un tocco di zucchero candito. Finale di non so che di reisinoso. Ottima!.

Bottle from LCBO.  Served at cellar temperature.  Was excited to try it, but did not impress me too much.  Poured pale yellow.  Weak aroma of yeast and booze.  Taste was pretty good, but a little bland.  Boozy and dry.  Fine, but definitely not my favourite Tripel.

In a 330ml bottle from the LCBO. Smell is fantastic, a sweet banana smell, mixed with doughy yeast and a tiny bit of herbs. Appearance is really nice, a hazy golden fog with some tick foamy head that dissipates slowly and leaves nice lacing. Very active carbonation on the palate, maybe a bit too strong. Taste is a bit disappointing when compared to tripels like karmeliet. Taste is sweet at first, then quickly gets overpowered by the carbonation leaving a slight bitter hoppiness and some definite alcohol taste. Good, but not great.

A superior tripel.  To hell with Calvin Klein, these floral hops are real perfume.  A touch of oaky bitter hidden in the taste of alcohol.  Not sure what kind of freemason/trappist relation Dan Brown would cook up based on the label but I highly approve the ritual.
If I could only bring 1 beer to a deserted island, let it be this One. Best tripel ever.
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. Ill update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.

From notes.  First reviewed 4/19/2010.  Poured from a 11.2 oz bottle into a tulip.

Quite a luxurious appearance! Even with a gentle pour, a magnificent 3 inch white head formed in my tulip. A small dark brown dab of sentiment came out and rests delicately on top. The bright, full golden color is nearly transparent, and the re-energizing carbonation from the bottom dances with the small yeast particles, creating a snow globe effect. Great head retention and tons of sticky lace down the sides of the glass. 

Bready malt, crisp green apples, along with some mild spiciness in the nose. Alcohol is definitely present, more so as it warms.

Crisp green apples and white grape skin create a slightly tart first impression. Pale malt, honey, and a warming alcohol presence arrive next, bringing a complex spice mixture as well. Dextrin sweetness is unable to mask a slightly medicinal / alcohol flavor at the end.

Crisp, with above average carbonation. Slight tartness inspires salivation, furthering the desire for the next sip. Finishes dry.

 In my opinion, the taste improves as it warms, but I do not really want to wait for it to breathe and warm up. A few of these will send me into a blissful state.

The beer looks and pours beautifully with an excellent head. The upfront taste is fantastic but there is a a strong alcohol bite in the after taste that I did not like.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2015 Bottle @ Heeren Van Liedekercke - this is a vintage 1996 - expiration date 18/09/1998. Nose: clearly oxidated, yet hints of peach, clove. Taste of madeire and orange peel. 3.5
-----
fresh Westmalle still is one of my favourite all-round beers: nice yeast character, full medium sweet body and a very nice evolution while warming up. This is truly one of Belgiums top beers (except for the lambics :-)).

Read the reviews and I was expecting more.  I think its because I prefer a sweet tripel and this one has more of an alcohol bit.  The beer looks and pours beautifully with an excellent head.  The upfront taste is fantastic but there is a a strong alcohol bite in the after taste that I did not like.

Amazing aroma of spice, yeast, and fruit.  Perfect soft white head.  Surprisingly not sweet for a tripel, much more bitter than I would have thought.  Taste is yeasty and spicy with a medium-full body.  great beer
My first trappist beer. Dont know why Ive allowed my self to live without trying any. Loved it instantly.
Al jaren mijn favoriete tripel. Goud van kleur, fruitige complexe geur en een vrij zoetige smaak met bittere afdronk. Topbier.

This dry Belgium Trappist triple is simple yet complex! It pour golden brown with a light head and a spice filled aroma. The triple tastes wheatie but bitter and the palate is pure and simple. Great all around beer!

33 cl. bottle @ home. Hazy golden with a white head. Yeasty fruity smell. Full mature yeasty fruity taste. Very balanced beer with a lot of complexity and layers of flavour. Really really good tripel.

Aroma of banana and pomaceous fruits. Opaque school bus color, very active. States best before 3/12, but these boys age well. Flavor of yeasty esters fruity booze. Oily medium body. Great traditional Belgian.
The standard by which all other Tripels are judged.  Positively delightful.
Bottle. Nice head but disappears quickly. Aroma of hops and fruits. Interesting taste that changes as beer gets warmer. Fruity at first changes into a bit more spicy and dry. Very interesting beer.
Golden colour. Yeasty floral aroma. Flavour of yeast and citrus, spice. Good tripel

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden color with a perfect white head that lasts and lasts. Aroma is malt, banana, and spice. Taste is banana, biscuit, and a little bit of pear. Mouthfeel is medium and bubbly. Very good. There is a bit of alcohol warmth on the finish.
Bouteille 33cL. Belle couleur doree trouble. Nez de malt et un peu de banane. En bouche: longue finale cremeuse... malt, levure, epices et un peu de banane. Excellent +!
Tot op heden nog steeds mijn favoriete biertje. Maar er zijn er nog zoveel om te proeven!

33cl bottle.
Good white head.  Clear golden pour.  Slightly spicy aftertaste.  An excellent triple.

Currently drinking while typing. Upon pouring you are greeted by a sweet malty aroma consisting of booziness, banana, pineapple and pears. Beautiful pillowy white head with a great lasting characteristic which sits upon a bright golden pearly looking opaque ale. Flavours of savoury sugars, full malts, subtle booze, spice and banana again with a long lasting cereal flavour in the aftertaste. A noteable well masked alcohol content too. Great feel in the mouth, good carbonation, great foamy feel on the lips and a superb dry finish. Seriously good tripel ale but I cant say it is my favourite, definately a must for lovers of abbey style tripels!
pours a cloudy yellow with a large white head.aroma is of citrus and bananas.taste is bananas and orange and a pleasant sweet maltness.palate is creamy and has a nice fizzy dry finish.very nice.
dough, grass, floral, banana, cooked vegetables, vanilla, golden, cloudy, frothy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, salty, full body, flat, thick feel, long finish,

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2013 Amber orange body with white lacing head. Aroma is oranges, mandarin, grass, hay and leather. Palate is slick , soft , oily and smooth. Carbonation is fizzy and soft. Taste is  slightly bitter dry and fruity tart, with warming sensation from high ABV 9,5%. It is a good tripel, that Ive enjoyed since years, this time however it taste only "good". Still one of the better one strong blondes/tripels. Very smooth overall, and warming.

Bottle.  Hazy dark yellow pour, nice lasting half inch head and a sweet light fruit aroma.  Flavor also has nice floral and spicy fruit esters, a little well blended sugary flavor, wonderful malty backbone and finished warming and slightly dry.  Cant believe I havent had this before now, very good!

Ar: Peaches, orange, a bit of ginger and black pepper.
Ap: Straw gold, hazy - large meringue-like white head with good retention, fine bubbles, and clingy lacing.
T: Medium-sweet orange and pear up front - bitter orange peel and herbal-spicy hop flavor mid-palate - mellow peach, pear, and orange on the finish, mixed with some spicy black pepper.
P: Medium body, high carbonation - creamy mouthfeel from the carbonation that is accented with a carbonic bite on the finish, which is very dry.
O: Just a wonderful beer - complex, refreshing, satisfying - fruit, spice, and bitterness all come together and harmonize superbly.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 Amazin beer! I think one of the best I have tasted. Golden pale colour with a great white head thats hold so long. Aroma to malt, florar and spice. Powerful body and taste. Beside it improves with the time goes by.Excellent beer!
Sapore molto alcolico, nettamente luppolato. Rimane in bocca una nota amara molto prolungata. Sapore molto deciso.

From a bottle dated "Best Before 01/03/12." Poured into a Duvel tulip glass.

A: I tried to pour carefully but some sediment got in causing a hazy amber body with little almost no head, the head was white.

S: Slightly tart citrus fruit and some light malt hints.

T: Lemon upfront with pepper meshing well, theres a slight alcohol taste at the end. Theres a lot going on, but this is what stands out. I cant say Im a big fan.

M: Very crisp, medium bodied with sharp carbonation.

O: Im not sure if the dating is European or American, if its European, which I expect, then this is still before the best before date. If not then this may be bordering on too old to enjoy. Ill have to try this fresher.
So ................. long.   The clarity belies the complexity of flavors contained it.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2013 330 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on January 5. Pours clear pale golden with a huge fluffy white head that slowly dissipates while clinging to the glass. Smell is sweet with cilantro, lemon zest, black pepper, Belgian yeast and alcohol. Taste is sweet, spicy and slightly bitter with some alcohol. Very similar taste and smell. Finish is sweet and spicy. Perhaps a bit too much alcohol in the taste.Re-rate! Great balance and a perfectly crafted beer. Raising my rating by a bit.

tried 20 dec  brussels sprouts bar singapore .Westmalle tripel  Served at right temp in proper glass 
Clear golden. Big white head that settles. Quite a crisp fresh fruity taste with lingering alcohol at the end. Very drinkable for the abv.  Think it is better as a food accompaniment. Summer beer. Lacks the comfort factor of a gulden draak
Pours a cloudy orange with a white head and aroma of yeast. Flavor is of yeast, spices, citrus and alcohol with a bitter finish. Well balanced and good tripel.
Gedronken bij dutch drebus @nye, goudgeelniet helder. Heel veel schuim. Zoet en goede carbo.

Bottle at the Beerhive.
This is the triple that set the standards for triples. I expected it to be more complex. I got notes of bananas, floral, spices, lots of malty sweetness. A good beer but I have had better Triples.

Malty and syrupy on the nose ad pours cloudy amber. The first sip is impossibly smooth but if you take a generous mouthful of this beer youll realize that this is one of the few amber beers that tastes great on the back of the palate. Fill your mouth with this beer and youll taste the spicy and bitey carbonation on the tip of your tongue, the malts and sugars (caramels and toffees) on the sides, the refreshing bitterness at the back and another heavy dose of malt as you send it down your throat. A really great Belgian beer that only needs a bit more colour and dark candi syrup to be truly outstanding

Tasted on 12/28/11 from a 330mL bottle (thanks to Jane), best before 29/06/13.  Pours a hazy honey golden with a very thick and rocky white head that slowly recedes to rocky lace.  The nose is dry and spicy with dried citrus peel, resin bitterness, floral grass, and very dry bread and cereal malt.  The flavor is very dry, with a hint of caramel malt in addition to the bread and cereal, and the citrus hops presenting as fresh citrus fruit in addition to the floral grass, resin bitter, and dried citrus.  The body is full and oily with lively carbonation and a long spicy citrus hops finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy gold with thick off-white head; some lacing. Aroma is yeast, spice, lemon, and coriander. Flavor is citrus fruits, spice, herbs, honey, and some alcohol. Medium mouthfeel and carbonation; some warming. Very nice beer.
Det här är inte en favorit, smaken är lite för tam och alkoholen känns lite för mycket. Slutsats: lite av en besvikelse, jag hade förväntat mig mer.

pours hazy yellow with a lasting white head and lots of lacing.  aroma has notes of lemon, yeast and coriander with an overall soapiness.  taste is complex with bitter sweet citrus (lemon primarily), coriander, soap, some herbs, and more hop presence than one would expect from a trappist ale.  finish is dry.  a fine tripel, well balanced and warming.  the high abv is well hidden.
Slightly better than the chimay tripel. Has a slightly better palate and ending but doesnt reach the top according to my preferences.

Bottle from Beers of Europe
Yellow, hazy, frothy white head with good lacing.
Aroma - Spicy, yeast, bit tart, hint of citrus, aroma is quite subtle, no alcohol. 
Taste - Yeasty, bitter, underlying sweet malts, fruity, hint of honey, spices, hint of  vanilla, alcohol very noticeable. 
Palate Bitter, yeasty, medium to high carb allows flavours to move around, medium body, powdery texture, underlying creaminess. Finish - smooth, increased bitterness, powdery, dry, spicy, bit of cake mix, slight sherbet, cleans well. Complex. 
Overall - A complex, well-made tripel with a surprising subdued aroma. Each sip reveals something else. The palate is superb.  Alcohol is too noticeable though.

Golden orange cloudy pour with nice cloudy head after settling. Strong yeasty, doughy, and spicy aroma and taste. Lightly carbonated , well balanced with bitterness and alcohol accounting for most of the taste and follow through.

Pours a hazy peach-orange color with an awesome head. Massive lacing throughout. Aroma was spices and somewhat yeasty. Taste is spices, some floral, a little grassy, and alcohol comes through at the end. Dry finish. Great carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2012 poured from bottle into a chalice. Pours a solid orange color that is slightly hazy with a good head. Perfect color for a trappist.

the aromas arent jumping, but very well blended. On the subtle side with aromas of orange peels, some florals, a slight touch of funk and all sorts of various citrus aromas as well.

The feel is extremely well weighted and round. The flavors of citrus, orange peels, hints of earth, and white florals are deep and polished.

This is a standard bearer, and for great reason. This is just a class beer that you want to drink and savor at the same time.

The aroma is yeasty and spicy, distant tropical fruits, faint alcohol. The body is medium, spritzy carbonation. Bready and spicy yeast, with a dry, hoppy, and lean finish. The finish is bold and long, with mint and anise notes coming through. Very nice trappist tripel.

olor suave a malta y frutas,al paladar bien carbonatada con aromas bien balanceados de malta lupulo y frutas, me dio sabores mezclados de banana,albaricoque y algo mas. En fin una buenisima cerveza recomendada!
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: Pretty solid beer. Hazy golden/slight amber coloring with a frothy, short-lived, white head. Aromas are of caramel, toffee, and dough. Taste is of biscuit, sweet caramel, a bit dry, and containing some mixed spices. I also got hints of some tropical fruit. Semi-sweet, dry finish. Pretty tasty.

33 cl. bottle. Slightly hazy, golden colour in my trappist glass. Big, white head that quickly fades to a thin, staying cap. Exceptional malty and yeasty aroma with lots of spicy and fruity, exotic notes. The alcohol also shows as a pleasant burn on the palate. Lively carbonated, with a full body and a great, long lasting finish with tons of complex Belgian yeasts and malts and notes of licorice and hops. I really enjoyed this classic beer! Just as good as the dubbel.

A good belgian trappist. Sometimes at some beerfestivals you can get it straight from the tap. At that moment you can taste the best of this beer. Caramel, chocolate and coffee are the mats witch best come up. Resin and grass are the hops. The  alcohol is good discovered by those.

Murky amber with suspension, thin head that stays.
Light smell, champagne, banana.
Alcohol burn, dont get much else past the alcohol. Bit sour, very spicy.
Overly carbonated.
Not too unpleasant but doesnt have much to give, for me.

Pale cloudy yellow with a fluffy white head. classic tripel aroma, sweet and fruity, with a high carbonation. taste is fruity, some citrus, almonds and good bitterness. long finish, and good punch of alcohol. its not subtle, but its good.

25oz bottle.  Cork pop opening, excellent pour great lacing and head.  Rich golden hue seems layered in complexity just in the color.  Aromas are sweeter just like a belgian tripel should be.  So balanced, nice yeasty flavors up front with an immediate sweetness taking over the mid, finishes so smooth, the ABV is so well hidden.  Excellent balanced sweetness, nothing you need for dessert, but maybe to sip on before.  Ripe citrus mingles with the sweetness.  Long finish.

There are spices, flowers and fruits in the aroma, also alcohol, and something that resembles a perfume scent, but no way it feels alien to the beer. Taste follow the same lines and finish is an outstanding fruity mouthful. A clear yellow colour and a white head. Head is huge at first, becomes rocky, then settles. (Bottle)
Golden colour, fruity aroma...light taste, brilliant aftertaste...foamy head...carbonated to perfection!

Light, fruity and yeasty aroma.  Beautiful hazy light gold color and plenty of white fluffy head.  Light, gentle fruity/floral flavor with enough carbonation to leave dry notes after the sip.  Finishing note is almost of a skunked beer but surely that cant be it.  Overall, not that complex of flavor.  Enjoyable beer, but not the best tripel I have had.
Bottle. Pours a pale yellow colour with a thick white head. Plenty of fruit and alchol in the aroma, the taste is sweet and fruity with a dry bitter finish.

hoppy tase, golden, clear, nice white foam, medium bitterness, full body, lot of lively carbonation, bitter & long finish, maybe kind of agressive tasting, but it really is a benchmark for this type of beer.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2011 Exceptional malty aroma.  Quite well-carbonated, with a lively head.  Color is a golden yellow.  Wonderful yeasty flavor, with some spicy and fruity notes (kinda like a shiraz).  Nice licorice, malt and hops on the finish. I really enjoyed this beer!
Everything But the Best especialy if you can find it Von t Vat or on Taf for our English Friends

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange-gold, with a huge white head, which lasts extremely well and leaves behind good lacing. The nose is rich in sweet spices, with nutmeg, some cloves and a touch of cinnamon, as well as a sweet, estery aroma. An agreeable level of hoppiness introduces this beer, producing some spice flavours, before giving way to a smooth, almost weizen-like banana flavour. This mixes with cloves and nutmeg leading into a lingering, dry and spicy finish. This is a lovely beer, and the first tripel I have had that I have actually found properly enjoyable.

Hazy yellow body, white head. Aroma of fruity wheaty malt, some apple and tart when warms. Nice spices and yeast. Flavour is very fruity, perfumy yeast, mild alcohol, and bitterness. Very nice tripel.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2015 #1 Fris kruidig met hints van mineola en limoen, licht metaal, weinig nasleep, aroma fruitig. Bier prikkelt, maar is niet uitdagend genoeg. #2 Smaak is wat dieper door hogere temperatuur, geur een ietwat toffee. Alleen palate +1, rest onveranderd. Wordt niet beter tijdens drinken. #3 aroma plus 1, smaak is in het begin knallend, wat peperige nasmaak, ook plus 1. #4 proeverij @ de Klep 2 juni 2013. #5 (Feb 2015) Nee, ondanks de vele aanbevelingen (en minachting voor een andere opinie te hebben), dit is niet de beste tripel. Wat vlak. Zou vandaag aroma en smaak cijfer hebben omgedraaid.

Fles 33cl
KleurL Licht geel met een brede witte schuimkraag die mooi blijft bestaan
Geur: Licht fruitig
Smaak: Licht bitter, Licht zoet. Alcohol wordt aardig verborgen gehouden.
Erg lekkere tripel.
Clear pale yellow, impressive fluffy white head. Aroma of yeast, clove and banana. Spicey taste with more clove, banana and dry nuts. Warming alcohol. Quite carbonated. Like this one.

330ml bottle from Alko
BBE 22/08/13 - Pours light orange with a massive foamy white head. Aroma has notes of earthy notes, malts, pepper, spices and metallic hints. Taste is quite spicy and fruity with some hints of plum, malts and hops. Slightly carbonated and warming finish. Well balanced, spicy tripel.

Pours a Nice Yellow with some nice lacing. Aromas of Fruit and spice.. The Taste was beautiful, Pears, oranges,lemon and Banana. This is a Solid Tripel, Very classy, crisp and Clean. I cant wait till I get my hands on another one of these girls.

Serving type-Bottle

Pours a cloudy golden honey, generous white head and mild lacing.  Big taste of caramel malt dipped in light citrus and spices, with a satisfying semi-bitter finish.  Yes, this is a strong brew, and the alcohol is in front, but it is a well-balanced, solid quaff.
Just a solid, solid tripel. Nice dryness, light fruits, sweet but not too sweet. fabulous beer.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2012 Bottle. Light hazy golden colour with a white head. Malty and fruity aroma. Rich malty and fruity flavour. It is possible to use a lot of adjective to describe this beer. The only thing you have to do is to go and BUY IT NOW!

Cloudy yellow pour with large fluffy head. Yeasty aorma with slight malt. Taste is slightly malty with high carbonation making this beer seem very heavy. Very dry finish with a hint of bitterness. ABV is very noticable, a bit too much because it is not hidden well. Average beer.

Westmalle Tripel is golden beer, with thick and foamy head.
Aroma has some fruits and spices, sweet malty character and alcohol.
Taste is fruity (citrus, pear and some bananas), sweet grainy malts combining to the spices. But..the overwhelming alcoholy character is just way too boozy.
Palate is rather full, but still drinkable.
Nice Tripel, just too much alcohol ruins this beer.
Flavors of citrus, bandanna, caramel, and hops. Bright honey color. A bit dry and boozy.

Bottle into snifter.

The aroma of this bottle fell a little flat.  The head really died quickly and didnt present a solid smell for very long.  The odor has a bit of a bite but is not bold.

The appearance in the glass is very even hazy gold.  There is almost no head after the initial pour.  Looks good but isnt astounding.

There is sweetness in this triple but the flavor, overall, is short lived.  Bitterness seems to linger but not strongly.  Initial flavor is good but not as full as expected.  

The only thing that really strikes me on the palate is the carbonation.  Its quite fizzy.  The texture is thin with a light to medium body.  The finish is abrupt with not a lot of lingering texture in the mouth.

Overall a tasty beer but it really lacks legs.  Seeing as how it is a triple, it kind of left me wanting for flavor.

33 cl, bottled. Pours quite clear with small white had. Yellow golden color.  Aroma has floral hops and but not noticeable alcohol in it. Lively carbonation and bit biter finish. Not bad but not my favorite either.
Bottle, pours cloudy yellow with white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, caramel, candy. Taste is very sweet. Nice trappist

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2012 33cl bottle. Hazy yellow/green with a big white head. When it goes down, it leaves stains. Nose : Peach and bubblegum like notes. Yeast and banana. Sip : Fluffy. Sweet. Spicy with a banana all around. it ends a bit sour. Nice. Sour taste makes this sweetness and fruitiness calm down and let the beer freshness appear. On the end we get one of the most amazing blend of noble hops. The hops stays there even in aftertaste. When it comes to high alcohol , its well hidden. This is a kind of pale beer you want after your hard day of work.

33 cl, bottled. Pours clear, slightly cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma: Sweet tropical fruits, malt, hops. Taste: Sweet, balanced bitterness. Slight citric sourness. Fruits and malt. Citrus. Palate: Medium body, creamy. Above average carbonation. Sweet citric aftertaste. Very pleasant.

Pours clouded, orange-tinted yellow. Quite lively, white head. Most of it disappears quickly, but about 5 mm lingers on. Yeast, wheat and apple nose. Also some candy and alcohol. Apple, wheat, candy and alcohol aromas. Highly carbonated, and heavy feel, most likely because of the alcohol. Good beer, even though I sense Im not the biggest fan of tripels.

For me this is the 2nd best beer I have ever tasted till now.  I am happy to live close to the abbey where it is brewed. 
The taste is quite bitter but with lots of spices in the nose and taste. Very good to compare with strong flavoured fish dishes.
Nonostante sia un grande amante delle tripel, questa non mi fa impazzire...è veramente troppo alcoolica. Dopo questa bestemmia posso anche andarmene :-)
Ahh, one of the best Belgian ales I have ever tasted. Strong but well balanced beer.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2013 
33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 16.03.2013
Aroma has citrus, orange and some wheat notes. Flavour has citrus, spices and hints of alcohol. Foamy palate. Warming alcohol in the finish. Good and rich tripel, but the alcohol comes slightly too much through.
33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 20.05.2012
More spicy and dry, and alcohol is hidden better. Some slight cardboardy notes lurking in background, but they do not disturb much. Well preserved.

Bottle ---> Brandy snifter. Pours a nice hazy gold body with a thick, creamy head. Aromas are a bit sweet of citrus with lots of mellow yeast notes, even vanilla perhaps. There is a slight presence of alcohol in the nose as well. Tastes like a tripel; lots of  honey, yeast and alcohol make for great flavors.The mouth feel is a little dry from the carbonation, but also malty with a nice warm finish. Pretty drinkable given the higher ABV, so watch out.
Bottle 330ml. Pours golden color with a really high white foam. Aroma grass and belgian yeast. High in carbonnation. Slight alcohol taste, but not prevalent. A good trappist. Not Bad.

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090217.
Pours hazy pale golden colour with a huge white foamy head. Aroma of light spices, grass, belgian yeast, malts, earthy notes, orange peel and citrus. Flavour of light malts, citrus, spices, yeast, light caramel, some honey and clove. High CO2, full-bodied, mildly sour palate with a bitter finish. Alcohol stays in the background. Very balanced tripel.
4335

Bottle 33 cl, Cracked Kettle. Pours cludy golden amber with a huge creamy off white head leaving nice lacing. Aroma is sweet malty caramel hoppy fruity bready spicy and some tropical fruits. Flavor is fullbodied sweet fruity bitter pungent tart spicy and syrupy sweet. Finishes peppery and very bitter hoppy with a nice malty touch.

Nice golde colour, little hazy. White head that didnt last too long. Yeast in the smell, some citrus and little alcohol. Malty flavour, also little yeast. The alcohol is apparent in the aftertaste. Rather creamy feeling. Somewhat fruity taste with some spice. 
Little too much taste of alcohol for me.

If you have never tried a true Abbey Tripel, might I suggest you try this one?! It is an excellent example of the true Trappist brewing technique (and only a few monasteries in the world can call their ales abbey tripels!!). Loads of apricots and lemongrass in this flavorful brew; nothing overbearing, just a rich, succulent taste and texture in this fine beer. While this brew pairs up well with many foods, I prefer to have these as either an aperitif or as a dessert brew all to itself.

Hell trübes Tripel mit getreidig-süßem Geruch. 
Der Geschmack ist dem eines Tripels entsprechend: fruchtig, leicht alkoholbetont, aber auch mit einer spürbaren Bitternote. 
Passables Tripel. Hat leider nicht ganz meinen Nerv treffen können.Test vom 14.1.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Pours a brilliant cloudy gold color with tall white head and some floating sediment.  Yeasty-wheaty aroma.  Malty, fruity, spicy, yeasty, and just a little toasty.  Hints of clove, esters and alcohol.  Long bitter finish.  Rather dry, great sipper.  Prefer the dubbel, but this is very good too.
UPDATED: SEP 25, 2011 Gibsons.  Big head, bubbly, hazy golden color.  Aroma is orange spice.  Taste is rich bitter spice, malt, orange peel, very dry finish.  Pronounced alcohol.  Complex, delicious.

330 ml bottle. Leiden, the Netherlands.
Hazy yellow golden colour with small to average size white head.
Citrusy fruity hops and mild yeast in aroma.
Flavour is yeast, citrusy fruity hops, mild bitterness, fruity sourness and mild sweetness. Solid Tripel.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 A: Darker golden yellow body. Good clarity. Large fluffy white head. Moderate amount of lacing left behind after each sip.

S: Bright lemon-yeast notes emerge up front. Light hay, wheat, banana, clove, and pear round out the nose.

T: Like the nose, there is a blend of classic belgian yeast by products: banana, lemon, clove and perhaps some pepper. Nice wheat/hay like malt notes. A bit raw, but tasty.

M: Moderate body with effervescent carbonation. Nice drying finish. 

O: A classic tripel that is worthy of its reputation. Personally, I prefer the St. Bernardus Tripel and Tripel Karmeliet over this offering.
light sweet hoppy aroma,yellow,hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice hoppy finish.

Orange coloured and hazy. Has a white head, lasting. Aroma is yeasty and malty, light bread. Flavor is fruity, white-wine, delicios hoppy-herbal finish. Starts heavy sweet. Creamy and soft carbonation,.
Anche solo per rispetto verso una signora, ovvero la signora di tutte le tripel, o meglio la mamma delle tripel...Io la bevo sempre molto volentieri!

Lacy head on glass while sipping. A light hop finish that is slightly creamy. Good carbonation. There is a very pleasant vinegar funkiness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I find all of the "trappist" brews to be of high quality and worth a try. Not the best tripple Ive ever had but something anyone into exploring different styles should try.

[330ml bottle, gift from Jim] Do not allow your hands to tremble even slightly whilst pouring this one, for it is full of annoyingly bouyant chunks of sediment desperately fighting to get into your glass.  Assuming you are successful, youll have a clear, deeep gold beer with a huge fluffy white head and a lot of fizz.  A strong smell of yeast and bread wafts from the glass.  Theres some bread in the flavour too, but its predominantly spicy - ginger, and maybe some coriander.  Grassy hops come through, but dont disguise the obvious alcohol.  Theres a hint of banana and a mild, but lasting earthy bitterness  in the finish, leaving your mouth feeling a little sticky but also a little dry.  However, the fizz is very annoying - it offers annoying prickles rather than the nice fluffiness of some Belgian beers - and meant this fell short of many other Trappist beers.

Lots of lemon and sweet malt in the nose. The flavor is an interesting mix of sweet malt and sour yeast followed by sweet grapes very late. The finish is long and dry. Very creamy mouthfeel before the hops cut through. As it warms, Im getting a distinct lemon pepper flavor.

En två år gammal flaska där bäst före datumet precis gått ut. Gigantiskt skum, dimmig gyllengul vätska. Stor doft av belgisk jäst, apelsinskal och mogna äpplen. Först ganska söt i munnen, sedan riktigt jäststram, fruktig lång eftersmak, beska äpplen, alkoholvärme och lite smak. Betydligt torrare, stramare och kraftfullare än färsk. Vinner definitivt på lagring hävdar jag utan att ha en färsk intill.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Tulip. 

Appearance: Hazy straw yellow with billowing, foamy white head and great lacing.

Aroma: Earthy, dry and clove-like. Slightly tart. Light banana and other fruits.

Taste: A little sweeter than the aroma, with a heavier banana and fruit profile. Some light mustiness with a dry, slightly tart, snap at the end that leaves a strong clove aftertaste.

Palate: High carbonation with a medium body that is slightly more syrupy than expected or preferred. Mostly dry finish, but not as effervescent as hoped for.

Overall: Great tasting Tripel that does not quite have the refreshing and effervescent feel that I love in regards to all Pale Belgians, whether Tripels, BSPAs or Saisons. Still, one of the best Tripels that I have had.
Bottle, pours a nice a golden colour, the taste is a pretty average triple, not too much spicy or yeasty, very alcoholy in the taste. Pretty average triple.

From notes: Poured into Trappist glass-slightly hazy golden-amber with a thick white head.  Nice lacing.  Mild banana ester aroma, along with citrus and bready notes.  Palate was deep and slightly oily.  Flavors of banana ester mixed with bready yeast.

Bottle (quite some sediment). Big white head, slightly turbid yellow appearance. Nice sparkle. Highly carbonated. Clove and earthy yeasty flavor. Medium sweet to dry, spicy and bitter taste with a final bitter mouthfeel. Perfect triple.
Bottle in brussels. Poured light yellow with medium head. Very dry, light spice and citrus aroma and flavours.

Pours hazy yellow with a nice white head.  Aroma is spices, coriander, orange peel, candi sugar, and belgian yeast.  Taste is spicy with moderate sweetness, citrus, pepper, candi sugar, belgian yeast and a nice hoppy finish.  A great belgian tripel!

Bottle from Csak a jó sör. Poured murky, golden color and an off-white, creamy lacing head. Banana, yeast, vanilla, cinnamon, coriander in the nose. Malty sweet, pretty strong on the palate with high carbonation. Somewhat fruity aftertaste, with hoppy bitterness and no taste of the alcohol. Not a beginner brew for sure, outstanding!

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2014 Hazy blond, stable white head. Nose is bubble gum, snuff of coriander, fruity bonbons, cloves, banana. Body is full, carbon medium, texture near oily. Palate is dominated by fruity bubble gum, bitter herbs, quina, ripe banana and malt. Long bitter finish. Bottle. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a large head. Aroma is spiciness, pepper, fruitiness, citrus. Taste is spicy, fruity, citrus, pepper. Sweet in the middle with the dryness taking over at the end.

330 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a cloudy golden yellow with modest-sized, lasting white head and lots of floaties.  Aroma has alcohol, banana, pear and light clove.  Flavour is full of yeasty esters - banana, pear, clove.  Alcohol is more subtle than in the aroma but still provides a distinct warming.  Quite dry.  Fine, active carbonation.  All in all quite nice.

75cl bottle. Hazy golden with a foamy white head. Floreal aroma with hints of yeast. Taste is dry, spicy, but complex. It starts with alcohol, flowers and ends very dry because of the remaining yeast. A good beer

Poured from a bottle into a trappist glass. Appearance is a hazy copper to gold with a thin head of white foam. Nice carbonation bubbles constantly flowing up from the bottom of the glass. The thin white cap of foam just sits atop the beer refusing to budge. Aroma consists of sweet esters, banana, cloves, bubblegum, cinnamon, and a light, floral alcohol note shows itself when you dig deep. All of these aromas are just faint whispers, none really announce themselves for the oblivious onlooker. The taste comes next. The first thing to touch my tongue says orange peel pierced with cloves. As this flavor washes over the tongue it gives way to bubblegum and an earthy, spicy alcohol, almost like a rum. As this layer diminishes, bananas make an appearance and seem as though they have been rolled in cinnamon perhaps in preparation of a bananas foster. The finale is abrupt yet subtle. Theres not really any sort of lingering aftertaste, but more a pleasant "have a nice day" and then it is gone.  Mouthfeel is smooth with just a faint tickling of carbonation on the front of the tongue.
One of my personal favorite trappist ales, although truthfully I havent had all that many.  Pours a nice golden-orange shade with an off white head.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2014 Aug. 19, 2011: Bottle in Westlvleteren glass. Cloudy orange colour. Can definitely smell the alcohol here, some dried fruit, slight banana. Taste is sweet banana and alcohol with ample bitter hoppy flavour, dry aftertaste. Warming. I actually like the dubbel better. Still, a pretty good trappist.
Aug. 27, 2014: Upped the taste score by one. Fabulous sweet fruity malt, dry boozy finish, but lots of flavour.

Bottle served in a large tulip. The billowing head quickly fills the glass on a soft pour. Has a pale orange color, a clear body, and champagne bubbles. After waiting for the massive white head to subside to a sea foam island. Aroma is dry and spicy with distant stone fruit. Light bitter, light sweet flavor that has noticeable heat. Medium body, thick-creamy texture, lively carbonation, and a long dry, bitter finish. A good beer, but I was expecting more.
Underwhelming... there are much better trappist ales such as La Trappe and Rochefort. Slight flavor, typical belgian malts. ABV 9.5, IBU 36.

330mL bottle poured a golden hazy ale with huge off-white head with good retention and lacing.  Aromas of caramel, fruit and yeast.  Taste is mildly sweet with strong yeast notes and a dry bitter finish.  Good mouthfeel provided by adequate carbonation and medium body.

Bottle in a Trappist glass - pours cloudy and golden with off-white head. Has sediment in it. Aroma is yeast and earthy. Bitter aftertaste. So much flavor, but it is unfortunate the aftertaste is a little unpleasant. Overall a great beer.

Poured golden with PLENTY of head and a lot of haze. Definitely bottle conditioned. Smelled delicious with hops, some floral and yeast. Taste was similar with a strong yeast and malt flavor with a hoppy finish that wasnt bitter.

Pours a hazy golden. Fizzy white head. Good lacing. 
Hay, fruity aroma. 
Sweet, tart taste. 
Thin mouth feel, fizzy, bitter, alcoholic.

The beer pours a hazy golden color with a white head. The aroma is fruity. I get a lot of orange and lemon notes as well as some floral notes. There is some grass from the hops as well as some Belgian yeast and a little bit of candy sugar. The flavor is heavy on the yeast and orange citrus notes. I also get some sweetness from the candy sugar and a little bit of pepper and coriander. There is a little bit of alcohol detectable. The beer is very easy to drink. Thin to medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. A world classic.

Clear orange body with a creamy white head that last. Aroma of  coriander, pepper, lemon and bubblegum. High yeast presence. Spicy hop, coriander and pepper are well mixed in this well balanced beer.  Admirable complexity and subtleties. Sweet mouth feel with cassonade and fruity esters end. Houlala!

Pours hazy straw with copious white head.  Tinge of acidic citrus, alcohol, bready, yeast, mild spice.  Sweet Belgian malt, acidity, candy, bread/dough, and citrus.  A little more of an alcohol bite than expected.  Dry, acidic finish.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2012 Rerate. One of the best tripels. very fruity aroma and taste, oranges and grapefruit. Very nicely carbonated. During my previous rating I clearly was a bit overwhelmed from tasting my first ipas and imperial stouts. Only recently I?ve come to re-appreciate good Belgian tripels. (score was 3.1) Zelfde waardering als de Leffe Tripel. Deze twee bieren na elkaar geproefd maar ik kan geen favoriet vinden. De hogere score van Leffe komt doordat het bier troebel is. Qua smaak is het me om het even. Geloof dat Westmalle iets bitterder is.

750ml bottle.  Pours a pale golden color that is very hazy with a thick off white head that starts strong and lasts throughout, leaving a heavy dose of lace.   Has a spicy and fruity nose with lots of banana and clove.  Taste has lots of banana, clove, and sweet malt character that are balanced nicely.  The alcohol asserts itself in the flavor, but doesnt take over and finishes spicy and aggressive with a warming on the palate, along with a light yeasty flavor.  On the thinner side of medium bodied with a crisp, dry mouthfeel.

One of the legendary Trappist ales, youre never sure whether you should drink it or put it in a museum.  Belgian yeast dominates the aroma, with a little banana and citrus coming through.  Great balance between malt sweetness, alcohol, spice and carbonation in the flavor. Very easy drinking and surprisingly smooth for a beer this strong.   A classic, even though I like the Westmalle dubbel a little better than the tripel.
Most probably the best tripel in the world! The bitterness is so delicate and well-balanced. A piece of art
Very strong beer with a overwhelming taste which is rather roasted and alcoholic with a touch of nutts. Its palate is very strong and it develops great in your mouth and has an intense aftertaste.

The Westmalle trapist beer is maybe one of the best trappist beer in his kind. The most brillant aspect of this beer is the taste which stays in your mouth for a long time. The taste is full and nice with a minor bitter aspect. A must for beer lovers!

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2011 Golden colour, fine fluffy white head. Aroma malty and belgian yeast, vanilla, banana, quite spicy and citrus. Slight hops tone coming through. Flavour sweet(ish) malty. Citrus, yeast. Hops touch. Body bit oily and quite thick for a blond beer. Finish bit sticky with a hoppy bitterness. It appears much lighter in alcohol than it really is, making it a bit tricky when enjoyed on Sunday mornings after short bicycle trips, as is more or less tradition in the Belgian border region where I grew up.
Quite simple the standard triple, the benchmark to which I put all other tripels.
(From 33cL bottle)

-update 14 Dec 11-
Tasting of old bottle, bb 06. Held up surprisingly well. Changed character, more malty tones, port and madeira notes, lost the hops. Solid body. Very, very pleasurable.

400# bottle 33cl, pours nicely cloudy pale golden with huge white fluffy head.... Aroma is yeast, alcohol, spicy...the flavor is spicy, orange, fruits.....lots carbonation, medium body ....... nice Trappist

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2014 Spicy, yeasty, estery aroma that suggests a whole bouquet of tart fruits. Very fresh and delicious. The taste is more conservative, more citrusy and less of a bouquet than the nose led me to expect. It is elegantly bitter with a sour component. The body is medium with high effervescence, resulting in a distractingly fizzy finish that leaves a fruity, slightly bitter aftertaste that I find absolutely pleasant. I dont find this beer to be as boozy as some have pointed out--on the contrary, I think it conceals the alcohol content very well. That said, I consider this to be more of a sipper and a one-bottle-a-nighter, because the citrus component does become a little too much past a certain point. An excellent brew, though.
Very strong in taste with not a whole lot of character.  This had a huge yeast nose and the flavor was very much dominated by this.  Not my favorite.
Its a nice beer, nice tripel, but not that spectacular in my opinion. Best about this beer to me are the body and carbonation. Alcohol very well hidden. Good mouthfeel.
Poured into my trappist glass. Pouredsurprisingly light. Thin white head, and cloudy. Aroma is typical Belgium ale, but really clean. Flavor is similar. This is a great tripel!
UPDATED: AUG 10, 2011 bottle, yellow coloured with nice white head. Smell: woody, orange peel, yeasty. Taste: orange, nice yeast, very nice fruity and hoppy. Superb Tripel!

Small white head diminishes quickly. Murky yellow brown colour with chunky sediment. Aroma of cookie dough, butterscotch. orange, spice (cloves nutmeg, cinnamon maybe). Smooth round creamy palate, a hint of astringency in the finish. Candy sweet on the lounge with hints of acidity and bitterness. I can see why this has been hailed the best beer in the world.
Pretty average tripel this one. Didnt disslike anything, but i also wasnt very impressed. There are better tripels out there.

This beer comes with a big reputation. Hopefully I can do its reviw justice.
Pours like a pilsner, hay coloured and with an enormous fluffy white head leaving good lace. The scent is subtle, sort of bready with golden crumpets, sugarcane and a whiff of lemon scent and household cleaner.
The taste is pure tripel. Glorious yeasty fruitiness, like freshly risen muffins. Full, silky and creamy, it is deceptive considering its appearance. Theres lemon zest, juice and a dusting of nutmeg in the mouth as well as a little bit of dough and floral vegetal flavour and then a kiss of banana sweetness toward the end of a lingering finish. Big like for a sophisticated and elegant ale.

nice gold colour
to aroma it was strong hos aroma from atec
to taste delicate taste of orange and herbs
when I poured it to my glass the foam was thick and stay for app. 7 minutes.
I strongly recommend this beer to everyone.

This is my favorite tripel. Great spice characteristic and almost some banana, with a light alcohol punch which rounds it out oh so well. Beautiful hazy yellow, Ive tried this so many times I cant count and it just keeps getting better.

In bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy orange colur with a thick white head. Lots of berries on the nose also some alcohol. Flavourwise, the alcohol is well ballanced witth the fruity tones, some banana also. A little prickly mouthfeel but very nice.
Bottle. Foamy white lasting head. Hazy golden. Aroma has slight notes of yeast. Flavour is sweet with fruits, alcohol and malt. Creamy palate, medium carbonation and long somewhat bitter finish.
33cl bottle. Amber in color with a creamy head, Smell of bark and malt with a hint of lemon. Taste is of a sour fruit and a leafy ending. Lasting flavor throught.

Durchaus alkoholischer Antrunk, was durch eine prickelnde Kräuternote kompensiert wird. Deutlich malzig zeigt sich auch dieses Westmalle Bier, komplex, muss man doch gleichzeitig noch milde fruchtige Nuancen erkennen. Das nicht unbedingt schwache Hopfenaroma ist dadurch ebenfalls etwasin den Hintergrund gestellt, bestimmt das Bier aber trotzdem deutlich mit. Kernig-würziger Nachgeschmack. Voluminös und komplex, immer wieder schön, so etwas! 	 
Test vom 7.10.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 11,13,11,13,11,12 - 12,00

Looks great, golden with big white head. Aroma is a bit of a let down, mostly yeast with hints of fruit. Taste, on the other hand, is excellent. Probably my favourite belgian blonde. Yeast, malt, sugar, dried fruit (mango, apricot), a touch of lemon. Nice carbonation and full body rounds it off. Pleasant bitterness, too, not too sweet like some blondes tend to be in terms of aftertaste.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2011 Beautiful looking tripel. Glows orange amber in the glass. Hazy with an amazing amount of effervescent bubbles after pouring. Big white head which dissipates to a thin white one a couple of minutes later. Nose is citrous, lemon and grapefruit, spicy yeast and malt barley grain. Flavour is bitter. Lemon and grapefruit, again spicy yeast, pepper and the finish is a lingering grapefruit bitterness.
Golden haze with a great top, fresh aroma and a rich complex taste.One of my favorite Belgian trapist and the best blond one that i have tried.
Orange, good head.  Spices and almost dark fruits in the aroma and the taste.

Golden beer with a big and blond head. Aroma is nice and fresh, fruits, bananas and spicyness. Taste is fruitfull, some bananas, alcohol and peppery spicyness. Overally, taste is simple and uninspirating. Nice to drink with strong carbonation. More complexicity and alcohol should be totally hidden, now Westmalle is only medium Tripel.

Bottle, 33 cl. Pours yellow with a nice white head. Aroma is nice and flowery yeasty, citrus, caramel, hayish malts, notes of ripe orange and pineapple. A bit of farmhouse like musty yeast notes.  Taste is more robust, a very clear yeast component, flowery and sweet, taste of orange and pineapple, hayish and caramel malts. A bit peppery and spicy in the background. Very balanced, and the yeast component is very nice. Indeed a nice tripel. But I like the Dulle Teve a tad more than this one.

Wow, what a shame I never drank this one before. This is for sure the mother of all tripels. Poured out of bottle being golden coloured, forming a nice 1,5 finger head. Aroma has little raisins, some yeast and subtle spices like rosemary and lavender. It goes down incredibly well for a 9%. Full bodied and round. Taste is soft and sweet, bitter a light hoppy bitter kick to it.

SCHIUMA:
schiuma abbondante, bianca, non finissima abbastanza persistente
COLORE:
oro chiaro con tonalità arancio, leggermente velata

INTENSITA / FINEZZA / AROMA
profuma di frutta matura, con un fondo classico e consistente di lievito, in cui si insinua il malto con note caramello e zucchero, il tutto condito con un profumo alcolico piuttosto evidente.
GUSTO / RETROGUSTO / PERSISTENZA
entra dolce, fruttata, con una coda leggermente acidula, per poi lasciare libero sfogo a sensazioni alcoliche che lottano con un amaro finale abbastanza evidente, che lascia a momenti ritornare il malto in primo piano per poi prendere nuovamente il sopravvento nel restrogusto, con qualche nota speziata.
CORPO / CARBONATAZIONE / CONSISTENZA
copro medio, ben carbonata, da soprattutto sul finale una sensazione alcolica e di calore in gola.
-Buona, godibile con un tasso alcolico elevato ma non fastidioso. Lamaro finale la rende più dinamica, non permettendole di cadere in un dolce noioso. Le sfumatire fruttate ed il classico belgian style sono ben calibrati dando un prodotto completo e di qualità. bevuta accompagnando dei buoni formaggi francesi a pasta molle e con sapori molto intensi. abbinamento ben riuscito, dove ben pochi vini potrebbero reggere il confronto.

Bottle. Pours tanslucent orange-gold with clumpy white head. Aroma is of Belgian yeast, alcohol, sweet malts. Tastes of slight banana, slight clove but overwhelmed by alcohol taste. Very strong, fizzy carbonation mouthfeel. I think this may have been an older bottle

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2011 Bottle: pours a beautiful orange with a white head that slowly dissipates into slight lacing.  Smells of citrus and a floral mild spice. Flavors consist of everything from an earthiness to the aforementioned citrus which is not as pronounced as the smell makes you think it will be.  The aftertaste is the first time that you notice the alcohol as everything else fades away.
Bottle. Color orange with big head. Aroma fruity, hop, floral. Taste hop, fruits, floral, sweet.

Ar: wine, citrus,pale, hazy
Ap: frothy, white foam
Ta: medium bitterness, alcohol
Pa: long finish, bitter, average carbonation, medium body,

A moderate amber color with slight cloudiness.  Thick, tight, frothy head that is well sustained.  Floral, spice (cloves?), slightly fruity aroma that finishes with a very slight, sweet malty scent.  Well founded carbonation with a sweet taste - not overpoweringly alcoholic that I thought I would taste.  Nice, slightly dry finish of fruit and spices again.
Really nice tripel, one of my favorites. Good bitter flavor, bit of apple and banana, much malts and strong alcohol presence. Pretty awesome ;)

Pours a marshmallow creme white head with a golden body.  Aromas of grassy hops and some yeast.  Flavor is slight banana, alcohol, grassy, yeasty.  Finish is sweet with the alcohol and a banana note, yet dry.
UPDATED: JAN 6, 2012 Bottle. A golden yellow/orange colour with a nice white foam. The aroma is rather fruity, malty and a little hop. The taste is smooth with hints of banana, citrus and spices.

11.2oz bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours opaque golden with a thick, lacy, off-white head.  Aroma of light malts, strong spiciness, light floral hops, and a very light note of alcohol.  I used to think that this beer was overrated as one of the best Tripels, but now I realize that it really is one of the best.  Smooth texture.  A great beer.
golden hazy colour. fruity (bananna like) aromas with hints of yeast. well balanced with medium body,creamy like, sweet start and somewhat dry finish. wonderfull tripel

Bottle 33 cl from De Bierkoning in Amsterdam. Poured hazy golden in colour with enormous creamy off-wite head. Aroma is filled with sweetness, yeast and light hints of fruits and spices. Very pleasant aroma. Slightly fruity, malty and yeasty in flavour. Very well balanced. Smooth overall with a bit dry finish. A tad of bitterness with some  spices in aftertaste.

Aromas of lemon peel, pine, spice. Fantastic fresh bitterness in the taste, this beer is very well hopped for a tripel. Some spicyness in the aftertaste and surprisingly little alcohol. Amazing for 9.5% ABV. Maybe less balanced than some other tripels but surely the most refreshing.
Good, strong flavored tripel. Alcohol is noticeable when it warms up, but integrates nicely in the taste.
Pours with a medium white head on a cloudy yellow body. Strong malty aroma with spices, pine and alcohol. Sweet flavor with spices on a medium body.

Bottle 33 cl from Bier-Bienne (CH). Golden orange beer with fine white foam and fine sparkling. Complex fruity nose, malt, freshness and hop. The taste is fine, soft, smooth with hints of banana, zest of citrus, spices and herbs. The bitterness is pleasant and concludes a perfect balance.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2012 (11.2oz bottle) pours dark golden color with chunky white head. Very active carbonation.   Aroma has belgian yeast, vinous fruit (grape?) And some spice.  Taste is sweet malt with spice and a hoppy bitter finish.  Thin to medium bodied and creamy texture.  Finish is bitter and dry.   The original and ultimate tripel.
